Her group partner María del Carmen F. is married to a farmer who sold a calf to help her. María used the money to start her business selling frying pans and other small items.

Marcia Marbelly G., now 22, began at the age of 12 to produce frying pans and sell yogurt. When she was very young, she worked with her mother in this business, but now she is independent.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metal plates to produce frying pans

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene  44 años, vive con su esposo y sus  hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace mas de 21 años se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, cultiva principalmente maíz  de color con  su esposo y sus hijos, durante  la época de la cosecha vende  el maíz seco  para transportarlo a la capital; cuando empieza con la selección del maíz que será comercializado contrata los servicios de varias señoras  que realizan el arduo trabajo todo el día.  El producto agrícola que ofrece es bien cotizado ya que la calidad del maíz es buena y esto la anima  mucho ya que desea continuar en esta actividad, que le permite solventar los gastos familiares acrecentando su producción, es así que cuando tiene mayor demanda y no  tiene cosecha compra de sus vecinos para vender y de esta manera complacer a sus clientes.Es la cuarta oportunidad que  tiene un crédito con  MFP, esta muy satisfecha  de  pertenecer a su banco comunal que le permite  socializar  con los demás integrantes de su grupo y compartir ideas de progreso.El dinero lo utilizará en la compra de varias extensiones de terreno que le sirvan para cultivar  mayores cantidades de maíz y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Esther, 44, lives with her husband and their children in her own house. She has been doing agricultural work for over 21 years. Together with her husband and children she primarily grows colored corn. During the harvest time she sells dried corn in order to transport it to the capitol. When she starts selecting the corn that will be sold, she contracts the services of several women to do the arduous work all day. The agricultural product that she offers is very popular because the quality of the corn is good. This motivates her a lot because she wants to continue in this activity. It allows her to pay the family expenses and increase her production. When there is a great demand and she does not have a harvest, she buys from her neighbors to sell. This way she makes her customers happy. This is the fourth opportunity that she has had for a loan with MFP. She is very satisfied to belong to her communal bank, which allows her to socialize with the other members of her group and to share ideas about progressing. She will use the money to buy various pieces of land to plant a greater quantity of corn and get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land to plant in greater quantity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell bread and fruit

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo  y sus hijos en su casa propia.Hace muchos años se dedica  a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno que aprovecha cuando se dirige a trabajar en una hacienda ganadera, cría sus propios animales , y después de varios meses de cuidarlos y hacerlos engordar los lleva a vender en alguna  feria ganadera o al camal, es ahí donde tiene las ganancias merecidas de los meses de tanto sacrificio. En el futuro desea tener un establo donde albergue a mayor cantidad de  animales  y su capital siga creciendo.Es la octava oportunidad que tiene un crédito con  MFP y se siente muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal y se compromete una vez más a ser puntual en cada uno de sus pagos.El dinero del préstamo lo utilizará en la compra de 2 toros pequeños de raza.
texts.en:
Juana is thirty-nine and lives with her husband and children in her own house. She has been raising and selling cattle for many years, an opportunity she makes the most of by working on a cattle ranch. She raises her own animals, and after several months of caring for and fattening them up she sells them at a market or to a slaughterhouse to earn the fruits of months of great sacrifice. In the future she would like to have a stable to house more animals so she can keep growing her capital. This will be her eigth loan with MFP. She feels very happy to be part of her village bank and once again she promises to make each payment promptly. She plans to use her loan to buy two young purebred bulls.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Monica Del Rocio

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Crédito es formado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que buscan cada día la manera de salir en adelante y así entregarles un mejor futuro a sus familias, viven por distintas partes de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta la tercera ciudad mas importante del Ecuador, es una ciudad que tiene una belleza natural que enamora a propios y extraños.

La Sra. Mónica Jiménez es socia del banco comunal El Crédito,  vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene una amistad muy buena con todas sus compañeras del bankito, tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre, fruto de esta unión han procreado 2 hijos que se encuentran de 20 y 15 años de edad, su  primera hija estudia en el colegio Ciudad de Cuenca, y su hijo menor en el colegio Octavio Cordero Palacios, su esposo es albañil, profesión que le permite aportar económicamente a su hogar, la casa en la que habitan es arrendada.

Mónica se dedica a la venta de encebollados (Sopa de pescado), tiene 5 años trabajando en este, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, su horario de trabajo es de 9 a.m. a 22 p.m., vendiendo su producto casi todos los días a excepción del día jueves que descansa para estar un poco mas con su familia, nos comenta que si le va muy bien en su negocio, aprendiendo esta labor por si sola ya que la necesidad y las ganas de superarse le dieron fuerzas para realizar este exquisito platillo, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo en la fundación y  fue una amiga la que la incentivo para formar parte de este grupo para que reciba los beneficios que la fundación entrega a todas sus socias, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en pagar unas deudas que adquirió. Las deudas que la Sra. Debe pagar son las que compra 80 libras semanales de pescado para la elaboración de sus encebollados y en el pago de sus joyas que se encuentran en prenda. Su gran sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Community bank El Crédito is comprised of a group of determined women who aim, on a daily basis, to find ways in which to progress and create a better life for their families. The women live in different areas of the city of Cuenca, the third most important city in Ecuador. The city is surrounded by spectacular scenery that captivates visitors and residents alike. A member of the community bank El Crédito, Mrs. Monica J. lives in the city of Cuenca, and gets along with all her colleagues at the cooperative. She is 38 years old and lives with her common-law partner and two children, aged 20 and 15 years. Her eldest child (daughter) studies at the Ciudad de Cuenca college, and her son attends the Octavio Cordero Palacios school. Ms. J.’s partner is a builder whose work provides a steady income for the family. The family live in rented accommodation. Monica has been selling fish soup for the past five years. She does this from her house and works from 9am till 10pm every day except on Thursday, when she rests to spend time with her family. Monica taught herself how to run her business out of necessity and a wish to better herself, and reports that things are going well. This is Ms. J.’s second loan cycle as part of the Fundación after a friend encouraged her to form the collective and informed her about the benefits such a group could receive. Monica will use the loan provided by FUNDACION ESPOIR to repay some debts. The debts are for the 80 pounds of fish that she buys on credit each week for her fish soup, and to pay off some jewelery she had previously pawned. Her dream is to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay off debts from buying fish on credit, buy back jewelery from the pawn shop

loans.name: Maria Eufemia

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Crédito es formado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que buscan cada día la manera de salir en adelante y así entregarles un mejor futuro a sus familias, viven por distintas partes de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta la tercera ciudad mas importante del Ecuador, es una ciudad que tiene una belleza natural que enamora a propios y extraños.

La Sra. María P. pertenece al banco comunal El Crédito, vive en el Cantón Girón siendo muy visitado por sus hermosas chorreras y su naturaleza, se dedica a la venta los productos YANBAL pues su hija empezó con la venta de estos productos y ella le ayuda, el resto del tiempo se dedica a su casa, tiene 3 años trabajando con su bankito, nos comenta que los prestamos le ha beneficiado mucho en un bazar que tenia, pero lo tuvo que cerrar porque sufre de osteoporosis y reumatismo lo que reprodujo que tenga muchos gastos y ya no pudo mantener su negocio y ya se encuentra en dos años en tratamiento y espera recuperarse pronto.

María tiene 49 años de edad, se encuentra casada, fruto de esta unión ha procreado cuatro hijos de que se encuentran de 31, 28, 22, 18 años de edad, su hija de 31 y su hijo de 22 años son casados y viven independientemente con sus propias familias ya formadas, su hijo de 28 años se encuentra viviendo en el exterior emigrando para darle un mejor futuro a su familia y es quien ayuda le ayuda económicamente para sus medicinas y su hogar, su hija de 18 años estudia en el Colegio Los Andes, su esposo es Chofer, es propietario de un bus de la Cooperativa Trans Girón, no poseen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregó lo va a invertir en el bus de su esposo ya que necesitan comprar repuestos para brindar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros, su gran sueño es que su salud mejore para poder trabajar y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The “El Crédito” Village Bank includes a group of persevering women in a daily quest for success and a better future for their families. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, the third largest city in Ecuador; it’s a city of great beauty that captures the hearts of locals and foreigners. One member of the Village Bank, María P., lives in Cantón Girón, popular for its beautiful waterfalls and nature. She sells YANBAL [beauty] products; her daughter started selling them and she helps out. She spends the rest of her time taking care of her home. She has been with the bank for three years and tells us that the loans had been very helpful when she had a small store, but she had to close the store because she has osteoporosis and rheumatism. She kept incurring expenses and she couldn’t keep up her business. She’s been in treatment for two years and hopes to recover soon. María is 49 and married with four offspring, who are 31, 28, 22, and 18. Her 31-year-old daughter and 22-year-old son are married and live on their own with their families. Her 28-year-old son lives outside the country; he emigrated to provide his family with a better future, and he’s the one who provides María with economic support for her medications and her home. Her 18-year-old daughter goes to the Los Andes School. María’s husband is a driver and owns one bus in the Trans Girón Cooperative. They don’t own a house, so they rent. She plans to use her new loan from FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR for her husband’s bus; they need to buy spare parts so they can provide better service to the passengers. Her greatest dream is that her health will improve so she can work and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for their bus

loans.name: Nancy Maribel

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Crédito es formado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que buscan cada día la manera de salir en adelante y así entregarles un mejor futuro a sus familias, viven por distintas partes de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta la tercera ciudad mas importante del Ecuador, es una ciudad que tiene una belleza natural que enamora a propios y extraños.

La Sra. Nancy Vázquez  vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca por la calle al Cebollar, tiene 28 años de edad, se encuentra casada, su esposo tiene dos actividades tiene una mecánica pero también trabaja como taxista, viven en la casa de su suegra pero de forma independiente, aun no tienen hijos por lo que esta deseando pronto tener uno.

Nancy es secretaria de un Radio Taxi, lleva 7 años trabajando en este lugar, tiene turnos rotativos de 4 a.m. a 12 p.m., de 12 p.m. a 20 p.m. y de 20 p.m. a 4 a.m., tiene un gran vinculo a de amistad con todas sus compañeras y amigas del banco comunal, tiene 2 años trabajando con los prestamos que la fundación le hace entrega y le gusta por que paga interés y capital al mismo tiempo, fue su cuñada la que la incentivo para formar parte del bankito y todos los beneficios que la fundación les entrega, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de herramientas para el taller de su esposo, su gran sueño es tener un bazar para comenzar a tener su negocio propio.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Crédito in made up of a group of tough and motivated women who spend every day looking for ways to prosper and achieve for themselves and their families a better future. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, which is the third most important city in Ecuador. It is a city known for its natural beauty both by its inhabitants and by foreigners. Mrs. Nancy Vázquez lives in the metropolis of Cuenca on Cebollar street. She is 28 years old and married. Her husband has two jobs – he works as a mechanic but also drives a taxi. They live independently within her mother-in-law's house, and they don't yet have any children, although she would like to have one. Nancy is the secretary of a taxi service and has spent 7 years working at this company. She works different rotation shifts, which are from 4 a.m. to 12 p.m., from 12 p.m to 8 p.m and from 8 p.m to 4 a.m. She has close relationships with all the members of her communal bank and has been receiving loans from the foundation for two years. She likes this organization because the loan payments include both interest and capital at the same time. It was her sister-in-law who encouraged her to join the communal bank. Any profit she earns from the loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR will go towards the purchase of tools for her husband's workshop. Her greatest dream is to have a business of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools for her husband, a mechanic

loans.name: Rubia Group

texts.es:
Martha del Socorro M. es una de las integrantes del grupo el Rubia. Esta señora de 42 años hace aproximadamente seis años empezó a vender tortilla, bastimento por excelencia del nicaragüense y poco a poco empezó ahorrar  para invertir en la producción de nacatamales. Actualmente M. ahorra nuevamente para poder dar hacer un horno para producir pan y cosa de horno.

Su compañera Damaris L. Medrano vende de manera ambulante ella viaja a los departamentos ofreciendo sus productos  especialmente en el norte del país donde atenido mayor aceptación. Mientras Martha Azucena hace cinco años empezó con 2 colecciones de zapatos actualmente ella distribuye gran cantidad calzado de diferentes estilos.
texts.en:
Martha del Socorro M. is one of the members of the group Rubia. She is 42 years old and has been selling tortillas (a staple of Nicaraguan cuisine) for approximately 6 years and, little by little, has been saving and investing funds in the production of nacatamales (a different regional food). Now, M. will start to save up for an oven to make bread and other baked goods. Another member of the group, Damaris L. Medrano, distributes goods – traveling to different districts offering her products. Her products sell especially well in the north of the country. Although Martha Azucena started her business five years ago selling two types of shoes, she now distributes a large quantity of different styles.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and firewood

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Agée de 53 ans monsieur A. Yaovi est marié et père de cinq (05) enfants. Il mène l’activité de stockage et vente de céréales depuis vingt (20) ans. Le stockage se fait dans des futs et des bidons en plastique pour éviter l'attaque des insectes nuisibles aux grains de céréales. C’est une activité très rentable dans la mesure où le maïs, principal produit d’alimentation de base de la population de la région, devient une denrée rare en temps de soudure. Malgré l’importance des stocks de Mr A., il ne parvient pas à satisfaire à la forte demande de la population. Il sollicite donc un financement qu'il compte utiliser pour constituer un stock plus important de céréales. Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et le niveau de vie de son ménage.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaovi A. is 53 years old, married and father of five (05) children. He has been in business storing and selling grain for the past twenty (20) years. This is a quite profitable activity to the extent that corn - which is the main staple of the population in the region - becomes a rare commodity during the off-season. Despite the size of Mr. A.'s stock supply, he is currently unable to satisfy the strong demand of the population. He therefore requests a loan that he will use to increase his grain storage capacity. The benefits will allow him to improve living conditions for his family and the household living standards.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Storage and selling of corn

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Mimina is the coordinator of the "Mujeres Solidarias" (Women in Soldarity) loan group. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a northern port town that is economically based on tourism. Running water is not potable and electricity is unreliable. She is a widow and lives alone in a simple structure.

Mimina is excited to be taking her third loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing business by purchasing a dozen pairs of pants, t-shirts, and bedsheets. She will use the profits to continue investing in her business, which she hopes will provide her an easy life in her old age. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy pants, t-shirts and bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Ludy

texts.es: Ludy  tiene 28 años vive con sus hermanos en la casa que fue  heredada de sus padres.Se dedica a la agricultura y venta de toros, además cultiva papa (tubérculo peruano), maíz y alfalfa que complementan la venta de sus animales, principalmente vende en grandes cantidades la alfalfa que  distribuye a los comerciantes y cada 6 meses recoge sus cosechas para vender sus productos, también comercializa  sus toros  que le ayudan en su economía, para el futuro quiere tener un establo grande y mas extensiones de terreno para incrementar sus ganancias.Es la cuarta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con  MFP, y siempre ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos y esta no será la excepción.El dinero lo utilizará en la compra de fertilizantes, insecticidas y sacos de abono para  sembrar mayor cantidad de  alfalfa.
texts.en:
Ludy is 28 years old and lives with her siblings in the house they inherited from their parents. Her business activities are agriculture and the sale of bulls, as well as the cultivation of potato (a Peruvian tuber), corn, and alfalfa which compliments her animal sales. She mostly sells large quantities of alfalfa which she distributes to shopkeepers. Every 6 months, she harvests her produce and then sells it. She also commercializes her bulls, which are quite profitable, so she hopes to have a large stable in the future as well as more land to increase her profits. This is her fourth loan from MFP and she has continually shown herself to be punctual in her payments – this loan will not be an exception. She will use this money to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and sacks of manure in order to plant a larger quantity of alfalfa.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy fertilizer and insecticide for her fields.

loans.name: Acuario2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Acuario 2 está integrado por Rosa María Gaitán G., Manuela de Jesús Jiménez y Rosa Amanda Suárez tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras.  Gaitán es la coordinadora del grupo esta señora hace dos años invirtió sus pequeños ahorro en la compra de cerdo para su destace y venta en el cual le a ido bien.

Por su parte Manuela de Jesús Jiménez en 1992 empezó a comercializar bisutería de manera ambulante con el tiempo  gracias a su esfuerzo, trabajo y dedicación logro tener pequeño tramo en mercadito de Managua. Mientras Rosa Amanda desde hace diez año vende tortilla en su casa.
texts.en:
The group Acuario 2 includes Rosa María Gaitán G., Manuela de Jesús Jiménez and Rosa Amanda Suárez, three hard-working and entrepreneurial women. Gaitán is the group coordinator. Two years ago, she invested her small savings into the purchase of pigs to butcher and sell, a business which has served her well. With regards to Manuela de Jesús Jiménez, in 1992 she started to sell jewelry from door to door. With time, thanks to her effort, hard work, and dedication, she has been able to set up a small stand in Managua's marketplace. Meanwhile, Rosa Amanda has been selling tortillas out of her home for ten years.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital for her business

loans.name: Papa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Papa D. est un maçon de 42 ans qui habite à Yoff Tonghor un des quartiers de Yoff. Il est sociétaire de la caisse depuis mai 2004 et a déjà bénéficié de 3 prêts antérieurs.
Il est marie et père de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 1 an et demi et 10 ans. Monsieur  D. s’active principalement dans la construction de bâtiments depuis 1987. Il a choisi son métier par passion. Il est responsable de famille et son devoir est d’assurer la subsistance pour sa famille. Actuellement il vit dans la maison familiale alors qu’il dispose d’un terrain personnel. Son intention est de la construire pour améliorer le cadre de vie  et les conditions de bien être de sa famille. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs pour faire des briques dans le but d’envisager le démarrage des travaux.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié
texts.en:
Mr. Papa D., age 42, is a mason who lives in Yoff Tonghor, one of the neighborhoods in Yoff. He's been a member of UIMCEC since May 2004, and already benefitted from three previous loans. He's married and the father of three children, age one-and-a-half to ten. Since 1987, his main business has been construction. He chose this profession out of passion. He's responsible for his family and providing for them is a duty. He currently lives in his family's house, even though he owns a lot. He intends to build a house to improve the living environment and standard of his family. He's seeking a loan to make bricks in order to start the work. Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC, with the support of lenders, succeeds in supporting populations in revenue-generating activities, which promotes valuable socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To male bricks in order to build a house

loans.name: Luz De Amor 1 And 2 Group

texts.en:
Iris, a 43 year old woman from L. Alcarrizos, acts as the coordinator for the "Luz D. Amor" (Light of Love) group. Iris's story is representative of the other women in this group. 

Iris is a single mother who lives alone with her son in L. Alcarrizos, an urban, industrial area that lies in the outskirts of Santo Domingo, the Dominican capital. The area lacks access to potable water, has unreliable electricity, and inadequate sanitation and health care. 

Iris came to Esperanza seeking a loan to help expand her beauty shop, Salon Iris. Iris will be using the money from this first loan to purchase twenty hair care products for her customers. In the future, Iris wishes to improve her business by purchasing fans for her salon. 

Iris wants to promote the success of her business by saving money to remodel the salon and purchase clothing to sell in the store. Her long term goal is to use the success of her business to support her son. She says, "I want to help my son become useful in his life and in society." 

Iris is grateful for the support of Esperanza and the opportunity to turn her dreams into reality. Thank you for lending to Iris and Luz D. Amor!

loans.use: Hair and beauty products

loans.name: Myers L.

texts.en:
Myers is married to a nurse with two children. They also care for his wife’s two younger sisters. 

After a vigorous search job, he decided to go into business for himself. Over the past eight years, Myers's business has been growing gradually and he now owns a small liquor store that is located in centre part of the market.

Myers is looking for a loan to pay his children’s school fees and to get more stock for his store.

loans.use: To buy drinks and liquor

loans.name: Sidikie

texts.en:
Sidikie K. owns a small grocery shop in the centre part of town. Before going into business, Sidikie was an assistant tailor. Later, he decided to start his own business so that he can care for his family very well. He has a wife and six children. Two of his children are in senior secondary school and the other four are in primary school.

Sidikie has been a good client of ARD when he was in the Solidarity loan group, but now he is seeking an individual loan so he can buy more items for his shop. This will help him to increasing his profits and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell food products

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul K. is a father of  four children, married to a woman who is a farmer.  All of his children are in primary school.  Abdul owns a store where he sells rice and other agricultural products.  He has had several other businesses until a couple of years ago when he started selling rice.  His wife, though a farmer, usually helps Abdul in the store, and its profits are used to care for his family.  Abdul is seeking a loan get more stock for his shop, thereby expanding his capital and income.

loans.use: to buy rice for his store

loans.name: Eliseo Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Sr. Eliseo C. A. tiene un taller de mecánica (mantenimiento y reparación de motos y vehículos livianos), ubicado en el C. urbano de Condega, El Sr. Eliseo C. utilizara el crédito para la compra de una computadora, la que le facilitara a su hija mayor para que se dedique a la toma y edición de fotografías, este servicio será brindado al publico y de esta manera obtener un ingreso familiar adicional.
 
El Sr. Eliseo C. A. comenzó desde temprana edad al oficio de mecánica automotriz, este negocio comenzó a crecer ya que es el único taller reconocido en el Municipio teniendo así buena demanda de su servicio. Este cliente ha tenido este negocio desde hace 15 años , trabaja cada día desde las 7 de la mañana hasta 5 de la tarde por seis días a la semana, antes de dedicarse a la mecánica el era productor de tabaco.

El espera que con la compra de esta computadora su hija se dedique a las tomas fotografías y ediciones de estas y así aumentar los ingresos a la familia y también el nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Eliseo C. A. has a mechanic's workshop (motorcycle and light vehicle maintenance and repair) located in the urban zone of Condega. Mr. Eliseo C. will use this loan for the purchase of a computer which will allow his eldest daughter to start a photography business, taking and editing pictures. She will offer these services publicly, allowing the family to attain additional revenues. Mr. Eliseo C. A. started working as an automotive mechanic at a young age. His business has been growing since it is the only official workshop in the municipality, and is therefore in high demand. He has owned this business for 15 years, and he works 6 days a week, each day from 7 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. Before becoming a mechanic, he used to grow tobacco. He hopes that with the purchase of this computer, his daughter will be able to start taking pictures and editing them in order to increase their family's income and also improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer and its accessories

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro de 45 años vive sólo en la tranquilidad de su casa propia ubicada  en  la  sierra del Perú.Desde hace 30 años siembra papa (tubérculo peruano), arveja, maíz y flores de gladiolos, en sus  tierras; sus actividades agrícolas las desarrolla junto a su joven sobrino Elmer quien le ayuda a sembrar, cultivar y cosechar, para luego comercializar los productos naturales en el mercado de la ciudad, con las ganancias que obtiene Alejandro cubre los gastos de su vivienda y los invierte en el cuidado de sus sembríos, además ayuda económicamente a su sobrino que siempre  esta pendiente de él; en el futuro tiene pensado adquirir mas terrenos productivos donde sembrar en mayor cantidad, sobretodo  arvejas y flores de gladiolos en sus diferentes colores, los cuales son muy cotizados en el mercado.Este es el noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP y le gusta trabajar con los integrantes de su  banco comunal, pagará puntualmente sus cuotas para acceder a más créditos que le permitan salir a delante.Además el dinero  lo invertirá en comprar semillas de arveja, de flores de gladiolos, e  insecticidas, fertilizantes y abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 45 years old and lives alone in his own house located in the mountains of Perú. For more than 30 years he has grown potatos, green peas, corn, and gladiolus flowers on his land. He works on his farm with his young nephew Elmer who helps him plant, grow, harvest, and later sell the products at the city market. With his profits Alejandro covers his living expenses and invests in caring for his plants. He also provides economic support to his nephew who always cares for him. In the future he hopes to acquire more land where he can grow green peas and gladiolus flowers in different colors. These flowers are sought after in the market. This is the ninth loan that Alejandro has applied for with MFP and he likes to work with the members of his community bank. He pledges to make his payments on time, so that he will be able to receive more loans in the future. He will invest the money from the loan to purchase green pea and gladiolus flower seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, and organic fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcahse of fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds

loans.name: Lenin Augusto

texts.es:
El señor Lenin augusto Gomes Pérez trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) en un proyecto sobre manejo de sombra en el cultivo del café , el crédito se le otorgo para la compra de medicina de su mama ya que ella tiene problemas en el corazón y su medicina es muy cara por lo que necesitaba con urgencia el crédito , el espera que su mama se recupere con esta medicina y lleve una mejor vida 

Lenin es soltero y no tiene hijos solamente tiene bajo su cargo a su papa y su mama y viven en la misma casa , el a tenido un total de dos créditos  el cual a pagado muy bien a trabajado por dos años con ceprodel.

Lenin  nos dijo que sus créditos con ceprodel le a servido de mucho ya que a resueltos muchos problemas dentro su familia y espera seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Señor Lenin Augusto Gomes Pérez works in the Catholic Agricultural University of Trópico Seco (UCATSE) on a project focusing on the use of shade in coffee cultivation. The loan that he seeks is for the purchase of medicine for his mother. Since she has heart troubles and her medicine is very expensive, Lenin needs this loan very urgently. He expects that his mother will recuperate once she gets her medicine, and that it will help her to live a better life. Lenin is single and has no children. His father and mother are the only people under his care, and they all live together in the same house. He has had a total of two loans, which he has paid off properly. Lenin has worked for two years with Ceprodel. Lenin tells us that his loans from Ceprodel have done him a great service, helping him to resolve many problems for his family. He looks forward to continuing his work with them.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE MEDICAMENTOS PARA SU MAMA

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 32 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her family in Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey (a dish made with milled maize, which is cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish). She has many customers because people who live in her area eat kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. Janet has applied for a loan to buy more supplies, such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her income and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia de 26 años, vive con su pareja Edgar de 34 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos Lesly de 9 y Miguel de 4 años; todos viven juntos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años se  dedica a sembrar maíz, papa (tubérculo peruano), arveja, habas, en los terrenos que adquirió como herencia de sus padres y los  que logró comprar; en el cuidado de sus cultivos recibe la ayuda de su esposo e hijos, quienes al igual que ella comparten la idea de salir adelante; lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y ver como florecen además obtiene  buenas ganancias  al comercializar su siembra , ya que sus productos son bastante requeridos por los clientes en el mercado de la ciudad, tanto es así que algunas cosechas no las traslada sino las vende directamente a los mayoristas en su misma chacra; para el futuro tiene  pensando construir una casa  en la ciudad ,además desea seguir sembrando arveja y flor de gladiolos en mayor cantidad.Este es el noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada  porque le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal ya que la gente que lo integra es responsable, puntual y honrada.Celia, tiene pensado comprar con el dinero del préstamo bolsas de semilla de arveja, varios sacos de fertilizantes y 2 cabezas de ganado  para arar sus chacras.
texts.en:
Celia, 26 years old, lives with her partner Edgar, 34 years old. They have two children Lesly (9) and Miguel (4). They all live in a single family home. For 10 years she has worked growing corn, potatos, peas, and beans on the lands that she inherited from her parents and on some land that she was able to buy. Her husband and children help her care for the plants. What she likes most about her work is planting her land and seeing how the plants flourish. She is able to make a good profit upon selling her crops because these products are in demand at the city market. Sometimes she even sells an entire crop to wholesalers. In the future she hopes to build a house in the city. Also she hopes to grow peas and gladiolus flowers in larger quantities. This is the ninth loan she has had with MFP and she is excited. She likes to work with the community bank because the members of the bank are responsible, punctual, and honorable. With the loan money Celia plans to buy green pea seeds, bags of fertilizers, and two head of cattle to plow her farms.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcahse of seeds, fertilizer, and cattle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a businesswoman who makes a living selling clothes, linen and lace. She hawks her goods on her own, and moves them very quickly.  She is 43 years old, married and has five children. Four of her children are in school, while her oldest is learning a trade. She supports her family with the income she earns from her business. She has been working for eight years, but growth is slow due to insufficient funds. She buys her goods in Accra, Ghana's capital, and hopes that this loan will allow her to expand her business and increase her income. She is grateful for the assistance she receives from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi (which means "Friday born") is 56 years old, married and the father of six children. All of his children are in school, and he makes a living by running a grocery store where he sells items such as sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits. He buys his supplies in Accra and sometimes from the nearby town of Cape Coast. It has been his dream to expand his business by adding new items to his inventory, and he is applying for this loan to buy drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and other items such as tomatoes, smoked fish, dried fish, onions, spices and groundnuts. His goal is to increase his income to support his children in school, and he is very grateful for the assistance he receives from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and biscuits and other items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 37 years old, married and the mother of five children. Two of her children are in school, thanks to the income generated by a bakery that she and her husband own and operate. Grace works hard all day to help her dear husband, baking brown bread, sugar bread and butter bread for her loyal customers. She has been in this business for seven years, has done well despite the challenge of raising her children as well as working. She has applied for this loan to buy raw materials for her business. This loan will allow her to both provide for her family and save for future contingencies. She very much hopes to receive support from Kiva lenders, because that support will make a huge difference in her family's life.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Awa W. est une jeune femme mariée  âgée de 29 ans qui habite à Ouakam. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur. Elle a intégré le commerce de tissus, sacs, chaussures et divers produits depuis plus de 4 ans. Madame W. a eu la chance de naitre dans une grande famille ou presque tous les membres sont des commerçants. Sa mère voyage périodiquement en destination de la Chine de l’Inde ou de d’autres pays dans le monde.  C’est a partir de la qu’elle s’est exercée  en prenant les marchandises qu’elle  essayait d’écouler jusqu'à ce qu’elle se soit approprie une clientèle. Par conséquent elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs pour renouveler et accroitre son stock de marchandises. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins personnels qui ne peuvent pas être réglés avec l’argent qu’il reçoit de son mari.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs Awa W. is a young lady, aged 29, who lives in Ouakam. She is married and the mother of three children. She was already granted a previous loan. She has been for four years in the trade of cloths, handbags, shoes and various other items. She was fortunate to be born in a large family where nearly everyone becomes a merchant. Her mother travels regularly to China, India and other countries throughout the world. Mrs W. learnt her selling skills as she took these goods and sold them to a clientele that she steadily built up.

Currently she applies for a loan of 200,000 CFA francs to renew and increase her inventory. Her profit enables her to satisfy her personal needs that cannot be met with the money she gets from her husband.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is 33 years old, married and the mother of three children, all of whom are currently in school. Her husband is a trader, and the family lives in the Cape Coast region of Ghana. She sells items such as jeans, trousers, blouses, ladies slippers and cosmetics. Eva says that the sale of cosmetics is very lucrative, and therefore she wants to expand her inventory and, along with it, her income so she can do a better job of meeting her family’s needs. She will use this loan to travel to Accra to buy these goods in bulk, and would very much appreciate your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her business

loans.name: Samuel Francisco Group

texts.en:
The communal bank of “Samuel Francisco” is comprised of twenty hardworking men and women who are dedicated to various independent businesses. These businesses include shops that specialize in dressmaking as well as shops that sell curtains, furniture, iron lamps, clothing, perfumes, silver jewelry, fast food, fruit, and/or vegetables. Each member plans on investing their portion of the group loan in purchasing merchandise and other stock items that will help them grow their respective business.

The members of “Samuel Francisco” are from Talca, a city in the Maule region of central Chile. The two communities in Talca that the group members come from are called Samuel and Francisco, which is how their communal bank name was made. The climate in the region is Mediterranean, so the land is great for wineries and is a very scenic area. Nevertheless, the region is one of the poorest in Chile.

Mariela is the president of “Samuel Francisco” communal bank and she is pictured above wearing a green T-shirt in the second row. She sells clothing and perfume and travels twice a month to Santiago to purchase her merchandise. Mariela has two children, aged 11 and 9, and she is currently expecting her third child. Her dream is to have a clothing shop of her own in the city center.

For Mariela, Fondo Esperanza has meant important and sustaining economic help for her business, helping her achieve more financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata S. is a married woman with three children. Out of her hard work she has been able to build a small shop where she has been selling drinks and provisions for the past eight years. Other than her children, Aminata has one dependent who is staying with her and usually helps her to sell in her shop. On a regular basis, she opens her shop from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm daily.

Aminata intends to expand her shop, increase her capital, and buy more stock. To be able to achieve this, she is seeking a loan.

loans.use: To buy  drinks and provisions

loans.name: Qoriccoyllor Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICCOYLLOR” y viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Los socios se reúnen cada 30 días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa y esta conformado por 11 socios. 

Nuestros socios alteran sus actividades del hogar con sus pequeños negocios como: Valentina vende menudencia de res y  Marisol confecciona de vestidos a pedido del cliente. 

Los demás socios se dedican a brindar servicios por ejemplo, Flora hace servicio de llamadas en la calle, Miguel trabaja como albañil, Julia es enfermera, Maria Pilar es cocinera,  Jhon cesar es guía de turismo y Carmen Irene es auxiliar técnico de contabilidad.

Nuestra socia Giovanna tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta Jora (La chicha de jora es una bebida ancestral en el Perú y América, y su principal ingrediente es la jora o maíz fermentado.). Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y he ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Giovanna requiere el préstamo para comprar más maíz.

Los socios que tienen negocios requieren el préstamo para comprar productos como menudencia y telas y los que brindan servicios para el gasto familiar como por ejemplo la educación de sus hijos.       

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “Qoriccoyllor” communal bank and they live in the city of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. The group meets every 30 days in the main office of the Asociación Arawia [Kiva Field Partner] and it is made up of 11 members. Our members alternate their diverse domestic activities with small businesses, such as: Valentina sells beef giblets and Marisol makes dresses to her client’s specifications. The other members work in services, for example: Flora provides street-side cell phone services, Miguel works as a bricklayer, Julia is a nurse, Maria Pilar is a cook, Jhon is a tour guide, and Carmen Irene is an accounting technical assistant. Our member Giovanna is 30 years old and she lives with her partner and has two children. She sells jora (jora chica is an ancestral beverage in Peru and America- its main ingredient is jora, which is fermented corn). She has been in this line of work for several years and it has gone well for her because of the effort she puts into her work. Giovanna needs the loan to buy more corn. The members who have businesses need the loan to buy products such as giblets and fabrics, and those who work in services need it for family expenses, like their children’s education. The members value and appreciate the loan granted to them through this program and they are committed to making their repayments in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members who have businesses need the loan to buy products such as giblets and fabrics, and those who work in services need it for family expenses, like their children’s education.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame is 33 years old; she is married and enjoys commerce. She has four children and three are currently in school, while her last born is breastfeeding. She is a retailer of engine oil, brake fluid, and other automobile spare parts. She also supplies engine oil to her loyal customers in a garage situated in her shop where she sells the items. She sells the oil to her customers in smaller quantities rather than in bulk.

Maame is handicapped by low working capital since oil prices have gone up. She therefore needs the loan to remain in business. She wants to use the loan to buy additional barrels of engine oil, gallons of brake fluid and scrap parts to serve her customers. She believes this will enable her to make good income for her business and her family's well-being. She hopes to repay the loan within a scheduled time period.

loans.use: To buy additional barrels of engine oil, gallons of brake fluid and scrap parts, etc.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es: Daysi tiene 25 años y vive con su esposo Gilmer de 28 años, con quien tiene 2  hijos;  Angie de 10 y Cristopher de 1 año; todos viven en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 8 años su labor empieza desde muy temprano,ya que se dedica a sembrar arveja, papa (tubérculo peruano), maíz y flor de gladiolos, junto a su esposo, paralelamente elabora panes los que comercializa desde las 6 de la mañana en su pueblo; le gusta más hacer los panes porque le agrada probar sus bocadillos; para esta pareja ambas actividades les resultan bastante rentables, pues explican que la panadería les deja ingresos económicos diarios, mientras que la agricultura es por temporadas  pero les permite comprar algunas cosas de primera necesidad, para más adelante tiene  pensado aperturar una panadería en la ciudad, además de ampliar su pequeña tienda de comestibles  ubicada en su casa , también desea comprar más terrenos, sembrar en mayor cantidad. Este es el noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP, además esta muy contenta con el trabajo en su banco comunal porque aprende bastante  y comparte sus experiencias en cuestiones de ahorro e inversión con los demás integrantes. Con el dinero del préstamo, comprará varias bolsas de semilla de arveja, sacos de fertilizantes y botellas de insecticidas, para cuidar adecuadamente sus tierras; además invertirá en los insumos para elaborar panes, y en la compra de mercadería para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Daysi is 25 years old and lives with her husband Gilmer who is 28 years old. They both have 2 children; Angie who is ten and Cristopher who is 1. They all live in a house where they pay rent. For eight years her work begins very early, since she plants Peruvian potatoes, corn, and gladiolus flowers with her husband. Similarly she makes breads that she sells from 6 in the morning in her town. She prefers to make breads because she enjoys tasting her pastries. For this couple both activities bring in much profit. They explain that the bakery gives them a daily income while agriculture being seasonal permits them to purchase basic necessities. For the future she plans to open a bakery in the city as well as extend her small food store in her home. She also plans on buying more land and plant greater quantities. This is the ninth loan that she has with MFP. Furthermore, she is very happy with the work being done in her communal bank because she learns quite a lot and shares her experiences about savings and investment issues with the rest of the members. With the loan she will buy many bags of pea seeds, sacs of fertilizer, and bottles of insecticide so she can properly tend her land. Furthermore, she will invest in materials to make pastries and in the purchase of merchandise for her food store.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, merchandise, and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Nancy Fabiola

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Joaquín esta formado por un grupo de señoras que se encuentran dispuestas a entregarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos todos viven por el sector de San Joaquín, este es un sector muy hermoso de la ciudad de Cuenca, en donde la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la agricultura y también a la venta de cuyes asados, carnes asadas, canelazos (mezcla de canela, naranjilla y un poco de licor), etc.

La Sra. Nancy C. es socia del banco comunal San Joaquín, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sector de Medio Ejido, tiene 37 años de edad se encuentra casada y ha procreado 3 hijos que se encuentran de 15, 13, 5 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio Técnico Salesiano, su segundo hijo estudia en el Rincón del Saber y su último hijo estudia en el Jardín Hernán Malo, su esposo trabaja como chofer de un camión, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nancy es comerciante de todo tipo de ropa actividad que realiza hace 4 años, su mercadería la vende en su casa y los días miércoles en la Feria Libre (mercado de Cuenca), laborando este día de 6 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., también cuenta con un bazar y las ventas no son tan buena porque no se vende mucho, se lleva bien con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal por su carisma y alegría, se encuentra trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación hace 3 años y medio, siendo una amiga que la invito a formara parte de la banca comunal, con el préstamo que recibe de la fundación lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercadería como son pantalones, blusas, chompas, etc., para tener un mejor surtido para esta temporada, su mayor sueño es de poder viajar a los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
The San Joaquín Communal Bank is formed by a group of ladies who are willing to provide a better future for their children. The all live in the San Joaquín District, which is one of the most beautiful in the city of Cuenca. Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and also sell roasted guinea pigs, grilled meats, “canelazos” (a warm spiced drink made of cinnamon, naranjilla juice, and a little bit of liquor), and other delicacies.

Sra. Nancy C. is a member of the San Joaquín Communal Bank. She lives within the city of Cuenca in the Medio Ejido District. Nancy is 37 years old, married, and has three children (ages 15, 13, and 5). Her oldest child is a student at the Salesiano Technical High School. Her second child attends the school called “El Rincón del Saber” (The Corner of Knowledge). The youngest child is enrolled in Hernán Malo Kindergarten. Nancy’s husband works as a truck driver. They do not own a home, so they are currently renting.

Nancy has sold all types of merchandise, but she has been selling clothes for the last four years. She offers her products out of her home and every Wednesday at “La Feria Libre” (the open market in Cuenca). Her work schedule is from 6am until 5pm. Nancy also manages a bazaar, which has not done as well because she not been able to sell much. She gets along well with other members of her Communal Bank because of her charisma and cheerfulness. A friend invited her to join the Communal Bank 3½ years ago so that she could take advantage of the loans being provided by the Foundation.

With this current loan that she will be receiving, Nancy will purchase goods such as trousers, blouses, sweaters, and other items so that she will be well-stocked for the upcoming season. Her biggest dream is to travel to the United States.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, blouses, sweaters, and other items

loans.name: Rosario Beatriz

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Joaquín esta formado por un grupo de señoras que se encuentran dispuestas a entregarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos todos viven por el sector de San Joaquín, este es un sector muy hermoso de la ciudad de Cuenca, en donde la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la agricultura y también a la venta de cuyes asados, carnes asadas, canelazos (mezcla de canela, naranjilla y un poco de licor), etc.

La Sra. Rosario C. es socia del banco comunal San Joaquín, tiene una gran amistad con todas sus amigas y compañeras de la banca comunal, se encuentra trabajando con los prestamos que la fundación les ha entregado hace 4 años y fue incentivada por una promotora de crédito para que forme parte de los beneficios que entrega la fundación y nos comenta que los prestamos le han beneficiado para surgir poco a poco creciendo en su negocio y en su familia, tiene un bar en una escuela hace 2 años y le va bien, siendo el horario que  labora de 7 a.m. hasta la 1 p.m. de lunes a viernes.

Rosario vive por la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, por el sector de Cristo del Consuelo, tiene 51 años de edad, se encuentra casada y su esposo trabaja como gerente de ventas en una empresa, con quien procreo 4 hijos que se encuentran de 29, 28, 22 y 13 años de edad, su primera hija es profesional y tiene un laboratorio clínico, su segundo y tercer hijo son casados y viven independientemente con sus familias y su ultimo hijo estudia en el colegio Unedid, siendo el orgullo y fruto de su esfuerzo el poder contar con su casa propia, con su nuevo préstamo que la fundación le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su bar como son papas en fundas, gaseosas, bolos (jugo en fundas) helados, chupetes, etc., su meta es de seguir creciendo con su negocio y así poder darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Joaquin is comprised of a group of women who want to give their children a better future. They all live in the San Joaquin neighborhood, which is a very pretty part of the city of Cuenca. The majority of the population in this area works in agriculture and also in the sale of foods such as grilled meats and canelazos ( a hot drink made of sugar cane liquor, and cinnamon.) Rosario C. is a member of this communal bank. She enjoys a great friendship with all of her friends and colleagues in the communal bank. She has been taking loans from the foundation for 4 years. The loan representatives from the foundation inspired her to work with the foundation and take advantage of the benefits that it offers. She tells us that the loans have helped her to increase her business, little by little, allowing both her business and her family to see improvements. She has had a snack bar in a school for 2 years, and it is going well. She works from 7am until 1pm from Mondays through Fridays. Rosario lives by the city of Cuenca in the Cristo de Consuelo neighborhood. She is 51 years old, married, and her husband works as a sales manager for a company. They have 4 children aged 29, 28, 22 and 13 years of age. Her oldest daughter is a professional and has a laboratory clinic. Her second and third children are married and live independently with their families. Her youngest son studies at the Unedid school. She feels proud that through the fruits of her efforts she is able to have her own house. With the new loan from the foundation, she will buy products for her snack bar such as potato snacks, soft drinks, bolos (juice in a plastic sleeve), ice cream, lollipops, etc. Her goal is to continue to grow with her business and in this way give her best to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: potato snacks, bolos (frozen juice in packets), ice cream, lollipops, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Baye Assane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Baye Assane S. est un jeune tailleur de 34 ans, dynamique et très ambitieux, qui habite dans la localité de Ouakam.Il est membre depuis 4 ans a la caisse de l’U-IMCEC a Ouakam et a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit. C’est avec l’appui de son oncle qu’il a reçu une formation dans ce domaine. Et par la suite il s’est battu dans l’espoir de se créer une bonne place dans ce secteur. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans cette activité c’est le respect que sa clientèle formule envers lui et en contrepartie la satisfaction qu’il leur procure. Il sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs dans le but de réfectionner son atelier de couture et de le rendre plus attractif.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié
texts.en:
Mr Baye Assane S. is a dynamic and very ambitious young tailor, aged 34, who lives in the city of Ouakam. Four years ago he became a member of the Ouakam branch of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC and was already granted a loan. He learnt the dressmaking craft thanks to the support of his uncle, and then struggled to earn his place in this sector. What he appreciates most in his work is the respect that his customers have for him. In return, he gives them satisfaction with his products. He applies for a loan of 50,000 CFA francs to renovate his workshop and make it more attractive.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renovate his workshop

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 23 years old. She is a married woman with two children, one of them currently in school. She prepares and sells pastries such as meat pies and doughnuts. She supplies them by herself in the market center and retails them to her customers in bulk. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests loan support to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family and especially for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials (flour, sugar, margarine, yeast,firewood etc.)

loans.name: Dominica

texts.es: Dominica de  43 años vive al lado  de su madre Gregoria de 62 años y su joven hijo Alvarilio de 20 años, juntos viven en su  casa que es propia.Cada día debe levantarse muy temprano  a vigilar sus tierras ya que cultiva diversos tipos de vegetales entre los que destacan zanahorias, arvejas y habas; con la ayuda de su madre y de su hijo realiza esta ardua labor diaria, ya que debe vender toda la producción a los mayoristas del mercado de la ciudad, es por eso que es importante que la cosecha sea buena , además le gusta su trabajo porque le ayuda bastante económicamente, también cría cerdos y los comercializa de vez en cuando ; como  es una mujer emprendedora y con muchas ganas de trabajar tiene pensado en el futuro sembrar en mayor cantidad para vender y obtener más ganancias.Aunque es el sétimo préstamo con MFP promete ser cumplida en cada uno de sus pagos, ya que no quiere quedar mal con ningún miembro de su grupo que trabaja muy parejo para alcanzar cada uno sus proyectos.El dinero del préstamo tiene pensado invertirlo en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de arveja y zanahoria para empezar con el aumento de la producción, y también comprará abono para darle buen mantenimiento a sus tierras.
texts.en:
Dominica is 43 years old and lives with her mother Gregoria, who is 62, and her son Alvarilio, aged 20. They reside together in Dominica's house. Each day they have to get up very early to care for the fields where they cultivate diverse types of vegetables, including especially, carrots, green peas, and beans. With the help of her mother and son, she carries out this work daily. Dominica sells her entire production to wholesalers in the city market. For this reason, it is important that the harvest be a good one. Besides, she likes the work because it helps her out economically. She also raises pigs and sells them from time to time. Since she is an enterprising woman with a strong desire to work, she is considering sowing more crops in the future to sell and obtain added earnings. This is her 7th loan with MFP and she promises to be prompt with each payment. She doesn't wish to lose her standing with any member of her group. They work together to achieve each of their projects. The loan will be invested in purchasing various sacks of green pea and carrot seeds, so that she can begin expanding production. Also, she will buy manure in order to maintain the quality of her land.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SEEDS AND MANURE FOR HER FIELDS

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a food vendor who prepares and sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

In addition, Cynthia also sells raw food like bags of maize at the market square of Cape Coast. She has been in business for five years now.

It has been Cynthia’s dream to improve her business strength and to stock raw materials. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her children, especially for their education.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Lawrencia

texts.en:
Lawrencia is 41 years old, is married, and has given birth to four children. Currently all her children are in school.

Lawrencia has sold porridge in her neighborhood for six years now. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or taken with what we call kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about twenty minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge.

With a large customer base, Lawrencia wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of millet, beans, sugar, peanuts and milk to increase production. With the loan she wants to trek to the major farming areas in Ghana like the north of Ghana so that she can buy stock in bulk. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to make porridge and kose

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell essential commodities

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is a 52-year-old woman who is divorced and the mother of four children. All her four children are fully independent. She divorced when the husband could not take responsibility for the children. Adwoa had to work to cater for her children until they became fully independent.

Adwoa is a food vendor and sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Adwoa wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her business and also to save part for medical expenses.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for making kenkey

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi started her fish and gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) business five years ago in a community market where she lives. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty fish in the market and for that reason she is popular with many. As she lives by the coastal area in the central region of Ghana she gets the fresh fish before she smokes them. Many people buy from her in the market place.

Esi is 40 years old, is married, and is the mother of four children. Two of her children are currently in school; she supports her children from the business proceeds. She depends on that for their food, school bills and sometimes their medical bills.

Esi requests the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and her business growth. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy gari in bulk and more fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell construction supplies

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a 57-year-old divorced mother with five children. Three of the children are in school while the others are working and living on their own. She operates a drinking spot where she sells all kinds of soft drinks such as canned malts, Coke, Pepsi, sachet water, etc. She is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide for her business and three children in school. She has been running the drinking spot for ten years now. She needs the loan assistance to buy assorted drinks to upgrade her stock. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks to upgrade her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Brida Eulalia

texts.es:
El banco comuna Las Caleras está formado por un grupo de mujeres que saben que en la vida nada es fácil pero con sudor y sacrificio pueden llegar a tener muchas cosas para poder entregarle lo mejor a su familia, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca siendo esta la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, que se distingue por su belleza arquitectónica y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

La Sra. Brida A. es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive en el sector Las Caleras, tiene 45 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión conyugal a procreado 5 hijos que se encuentran de 19, 17, 16, 14, 11 años de edad, su hijo de 19 años estudia en la Universidad Salesiana, su hijo de 17 años emigró al exterior ya que pudo obtener la visa gracias a su padre que reside en el extranjero, su hijo de 16 años estudia en el colegio Febres Cordero, su hijo de 14 años estudia en el colegio Miguel Cordero, su hijo de 11 años estudio en la escuela de la Basílica, su esposo migró hace 9 años de forma ilegal pero ha podido obtener los papeles para trabajar legalmente, no tiene casa propia y la casa  en la que habitan es arrienda.

Brida se dedica a los que haceres domésticos pero también se dedica a la cría de pollos hace poco tiempo, tiene 10 años trabajando con los préstamo del bankito y nos comenta que fue un promotor la que la incentivo a formar parte de este grupo, los préstamos otorgados le han beneficiado mucho pues le han ayudado a pagar sus deudas y a cubrir sus necesidades, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace va a invertir en la compra de más pollos, alimento y vitaminas para estos, su gran sueño es de poder llegar a tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Caleras is made up of a group of women that knows that nothing in life is easy, but with hard work and sacrifice they can eventually have many things, in order to be able to give the best to their families. They live in the city of Cuenca, which is the third most important city in Ecuador, distinguished by its architectural beauty and the warmth and friendliness of its people. Mrs. Brida A. is a member of the communal bank who lives in the sector of Las Caleras. She is 45 years old, married, and has five children; ages 19, 17, 16, 14, and 11. Her 19-year-old son studies at Salesiana University. Thanks to his father living abroad, her 17-year-old son was able to obtain a visa and moved out of the country. Her 16-year-old son studies in the school Febres Cordero, while her 14-year-old son studies in Miguel Cordero. Finally, her 11-year-old son is studying in the school of the Basilica. Nine years ago, her husband migrated illegally, but he has been able to obtain the necessary documents to work legally. They do not have their own house, but they rent one. Brida takes care of the domestic chores but also has been raising chickens for a short time. She has worked with loans from her bank for 10 years now and tells us that it was a promoter who gave her the incentive to become part of this group. The loans that have been granted to her have benefited her a lot, helping to pay her debts and to cover her necessities. With this loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR, she is going to invest in the purchase of more chickens, as well as feed and vitamins for them. Her greatest dream is to eventually have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens to raise, and feed and vitamins for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sales of beauty and cosmetic products

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
El banco comuna Las Caleras está formado por un grupo de mujeres que saben que en la vida nada es fácil pero con sudor y sacrificio pueden llegar a tener muchas cosas para poder entregarle lo mejor a su familia, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca siendo esta la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, que se distingue por su belleza arquitectónica y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

La Sra. María L. es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, se lleva con todas sus amigas del banco comunal, tiene una pequeña tienda panadería, desde que era pequeña trabajo en el oficio de la panadería el cual aprendió y su horario de elaboración es de 5:30 a.m. a 8 o 9 a.m., y el resto de tiempo de dedica a su tienda, nos comenta que sufre de cáncer al seno pero que está a punto de terminar su tratamiento y se siente muy bien y da gracias a dios de su recuperación, lleva 10 años trabajando con el bankito y los prestamos le han beneficiado en su hogar y negocio.

María vive en Las Caleras, tiene 51 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha concebido 4 hijos que se encuentran de 30, 26, 25, 23 años de edad, sus hijas de 26 y 23 años son divorciadas, su hija de 26 años actualmente se encuentra estudiando en la Universidad, su hija de 23 años se encuentra trabajando para pagarse sus estudios en la Universidad Católica, y sus dos hijos varones son solteros y viven en el extranjero razón por la cual le pueden ayudar económicamente, siendo gracias a ellos que ha podido construir su casa propia, su esposo trabaja en un taller pequeño pero propio de carpintería,  con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en su tienda comprando productos para surtirle más como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc., y también en su panadería comprando huevos, harina, etc., su gran sueño es de ya no tener deudas.
texts.en:
The community bank Las Caleras is a group of women who know that nothing is easy in life, but with a great deal of effort and sacrifice they can obtain many things to improve the lot of their families. They live in Cuenca which is the third most important city in Ecuador. It is known for its architectural beauty and its warm and friendly people. Sra. María L. is a member of the Las Caleras bank, and she gets on well with all her friends there. She owns a small bakery and store where she has worked since she was a young girl learning the trade. She does the baking from 5:30 to 8 or 9 am. and the rest of the time she works in the shop. María has breast cancer, but she has almost finished her treatment and feels very well. She thanks God for her recovery. She has been a part of the community bank for ten years, and the loans have been a great help in both her home and business. María lives in Las Caleras. She is 51 years old, married, and has four children aged 30, 26, 25, and 23. Her 26- and 23-year old daughters are divorced. The 26-year old is currently studying at university, and the 23-year old is working to pay for her studies at the Catholic University. Her two sons are single and live overseas so can help her financially. Thanks to them she has been able to build her own house. Her husband has his own small carpentry business. With the loan from Kiva partner Fundacion Espoir, María is going to buy products such as rice, sugar, noodles etc so that her store has more stock. As well, she will buy eggs, flour etc for her bakery. Her greatest desire is to be debt-free.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, oil etc for her bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sales of staple goods and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es:
El banco comuna Las Caleras está formado por un grupo de mujeres que saben que en la vida nada es fácil pero con sudor y sacrificio pueden llegar a tener muchas cosas para poder entregarle lo mejor a su familia, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca siendo esta la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, que se distingue por su belleza arquitectónica y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

La Sra. María Zhamnay es socia del banco comuna Las Calera, vive en la Virgen del Milagro en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene un gran vinculo de amistad con todas sus compañeras de la banca comunal,  tiene 42 años de edad, se encuentra casada siendo el fruto de su unión conyugal el haber procreado 3 hijos que se encuentran de 21, 15, 4 años de edad, su hijo de 21 años estudia en la Universidad Sudamericana, su hijo de  15 años estudia en el colegio Miguel Moreno, su hijo de  4 años está en el jardín, su esposo es Mecánico Industrial, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en  casa de su suegra.

María se dedica a la venta de pollos, tiene 3 años en este negocio, los pollos los compra ya pelados y luego los vende, tiene una tienda en María Auxiliadora, vende solo los domingo de 6 a.m. a 1 p.m. el resto de días ayuda a sus esposo en el taller, tiene 6 años trabajando con el bankito y nos comenta que los créditos le han ayudado mucho con el pago de deudas y estudios de sus hijos, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para continuar con su negocio, su gran sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank Las Caleras is a group of women who know that nothing is easy in life, but with a great deal of effort and sacrifice they can obtain many things to improve the lot of their families. They live in Cuenca which is the third most important city in Ecuador. It is known for its architectural beauty and its warm and friendly people. Sra. María Zhamnay is a member of the community bank. She lives in the Virgen del Milagro area of Cuenca where she is close friends with the other members of the bank. She is 42-years old, married, and has three children aged 21, 15, and 4. Her 21-year old son studies at the Universidad Sudamericana, her 15-year old son is a student at the Miguel Moreno high school, and her 4-year old daughter is in kindergarten. Her husband is an industrial mechanic. As they do not own their home, they live with her mother-in-law. María has sold chickens for three years. She buys them already plucked and then sells them. She has a store in María Auxiliadora which is open only on Sundays between 6am and 1pm. The remaining days she helps her husband in his workshop. She has been a member of the bank for six years and says that the loans have helped her greatly to pay her debts and contribute to her children’s education. With this loan from Kiva partner Fundacion Espoir she will buy more chickens so she can continue in the business. Her greatest desire is to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Produce and sell coconut oil; stockpile corn

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia M. de 57 años, vive en una casa de cemento ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, es madre soltera con 2 hijos ya mayores de edad y 1 hijo menor de edad.

Natalia inicio el negocio de la tienda hace 4 años atrás porque le gustaba la idea de vender productos alimenticios y tenia que buscar la manera de tener un ingreso para sus hijos. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días vendiendo legumbres, carnes, bebidas, arroz etc. Una de las mayores complicaciones es cuando se forman los grupos de personas que les gusta beber alcohol y tiene problemas afuera de su casa.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes, legumbres, arroz, para agrandar más el negocio. En el futuro quiere ver su tienda como la mejor del sector y poder sacar una sucursal.
texts.en:
57-year old Natalia M. lives in a cement house located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. She is a single mother with two grownup children and a younger son.
