Natalia opened her store four years ago because she liked the idea of selling groceries and she had to find a way to support her children. Now she works from 6 in the morning to 10 at night every day selling vegetables, meat, drinks, rice etc. A big difficulty she encounters is when groups of people who like to drink alcohol gather outside her house and cause problems. With the loan she wants to buy meat, vegetables, and rice to expand her stock. In the future she would like to see her store as the best in the area and be able to open another store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of food products and basic necessities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of cloth, food products and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Prepare and sell food products

loans.name: Abilio Florencio

texts.es:
Abilio J. de 42 años, vive en una casa de cemento tiene agua y luz como servicios básicos su casa esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, es soltero y no tiene hijos.

Abilio empezó trabajando en una panadería después se quiso independizar y se saco una tienda, ya tiene 8 años con ella ahora el trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 22h00 todos los días vendiendo colas, leche, arroz etc. Una de las mayores complicaciones es la delincuencia que hay en su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, colas, aceites para agrandar aun más el negocio. En el futuro quiere agrandar mas el negocio y poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Abilio J. is 42 years old and lives in a concrete house with basic services (water and lights), located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. He is single and has no children. Abilio began working in a bakery but later, decided to become independent and open a grocery store. That was 8 years ago. Now he works every day from 6:30 AM until 10:00 PM, selling colas, milk, rice, etc. One of his biggest problems is delinquency in his neighborhood. With this loan he will buy rice, colas, and cooking oil, in order to expand his business. In the future, he wants to enhance the business even more, and to be able to improve his house.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY RICE, MILK, AND COLAS TO SELL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell food products and basic necessities

loans.name: J. Antonio

texts.es: El señor J. Antonio H. es un cliente distinguido de nuestra Institución ya que anteriormente se le había otorgado el crédito para realizar una mejora en su vivienda y todos sus pagos se registraron siempre puntuales, y en estos momentos esta tramitando nuevamente el crédito para la impermeabilización del techo de su hogar ya que en estas temporadas de lluvia su techo se ha ido dañando.
texts.en:
J. Antonio H. is a distinghished client of our institution who has had loans with us in the past to do home improvements; his repayments were always on time. Currently, he is requesting new funding to weatherproof the roof on his house because it has been damaged in the current rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To weatherproof his house.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El señor Ismael al igual que su esposa son clientes distinguidos de nuestra Institución ya que anteriormente habían solicitado el crédito para el pago de unos gastos médicos, y ahora están tramitando este crédito para terminar la construcción de una barda en la parte trasera de su vivienda, para mayor protección de la familia y del hogar. 
El labora para un laboratorio medico y su esposa en una óptica en el área del mostrador, son una familia joven pero muy unida y responsable.
texts.en:
Both Ismael and his wife are distinguished clients of our institution who have had loans with us in the past to pay for medical expenses. Currently, they are requesting funding to complete construction of a wall on the rear of their home to provide better security and protection to the family and to the home. He works for a medical laboratory and his wife works in an optician's office as a salesclerk. They are a young but very united and responsible family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete construction of rear wall.

loans.name: Mi Fortaleza En Cristo Group

texts.en:
Jose is the coordinator of his group Mi Fortaleza en Cristo (My Fortress in Christ), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago - DRs second largest city, and famous for its beef and tobacco production - where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his wife and daughter.

Jose is excited to be taking out his first loan with Esperanza and views this as a great opportunity to grow his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his barber shop by purchasing a refrigerator so that he can sell cold drinks to his clients as they wait to be served, as they have their haircut or if they are just hanging around the barber shop. He plans to use the profits to invest in his business, purchase his own home and eventually save enough to send his daughter to school to be a nurse. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for his barber shop

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
La persona que aparece es la esposa del señor Ignacio A. S..

El señor A. es una persona que piensa en el bienestar de sus hijos para cuando sean grandes; es por ello que el desea ampliar su casa para brindarles la mayor comodidad. El todas las mañanas sale a trabajar para conseguir el pan de cada día, el se dedica a impartir la noticia por radio, para conseguirla tiene que salir por las calles para estar actualizado de cada hecho que pasa en el día. El pide el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto de construcción.
texts.en:
The person who appears in the phono is Ignacio A. S.'s wife. Mr. A. is a person who is always conscious of providing well-being for his children as they grow up. For this reason, he would like to enlarge his house to provide better comfort. Every day he goes out to work to earn his daily bread. He is a radio newsman. In order to get the news he must roam the streets in order to be up to date on daily occurences. He asks for help in order to complete his construction project.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es: Dalia A. hace tiempo quedo viuda donde a su cargo quedaron 2 hijos a los cuales quiere darle mejor calidad. Ella comenta que el hijo mayor  esta creciendo y quiere que el tenga su propios espacio. La casa donde viven es de interés social por lo que es muy pequeña es por ello que quiere brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos para cuando sean grandes sean un hombres bien educados y con buenos principios.
texts.en:
Dalia A. became a widow some time ago and was left with two sons to whom she wants to give a better quality of life. She says that her older son is growing, and she wants him to have his own room. They live in publicly subsidized housing, which is why the house is very small. She wants to provide something better for her children so that when they are grown they are well educated men with good values.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction material for a bedroom

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia Terán es casada con el señor Erasto Hipólito y ya anteriormente le habíamos otorgado un crédito para unos gastos personales y su crédito siempre fue pagado con puntualidad, ahora nuevamente están tramitando este crédito para la mejora de su vivienda ya que están levantado las bardas de de alrededor de su casa para mayor protección de su familia.
texts.en:
Alicia Terán is married to Erasto Hipólito. She has had a previous loan with us to pay for personal expenses and her repayments were always on time. Now, they are requesting a new loan to do some home improvements since they are building walls around their house to increase security and protection for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish construction of a wall around the house.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo C. A. es un señor que vive en un ejido cerca de la ciudad, como se encuentran a varios kilómetros las tiendas quedan lejos y es por ello que desde hace 15 años puso un negocio de abarrotes llamado “Mini Súper C.” donde se puede encontrar variedad de mercancía como refrescos, botanas, comida enlatada, carnes, artículos para el hogar, regalos y más. En este momento el quiere invertirle mas a la tienda para tener mas ingresos y brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes vecinos.
texts.en:
Rodolfo C. A. lives in an ejido (piece of land farmed/owned by a cooperative) near the city. Because they are located several kilometers away, stores are far. Therefore, 15 years ago he opened a small grocery store called "Mini Súper C.” where one can find a variety of products like soft drinks, snacks, canned food, meats, home supplies, gifts, etc. Currently, he needs to invest more in his inventory in order to increase sales and offer better customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchando Contra La Pobreza Group

texts.en:
Yenny, a 25-year-old woman from Puerto Plata, is the coordinator for the group Mujeres Luchando Contra la Pobreza (Women Fighting Against Poverty). Her story is representative of the other members in this group. Yenny lives with her husband and three young children in Puerto Plata, a port town in northern Dominican Republic. Puerto Plata, a tourism-based area, experiences constant economic volatility, lacks access to potable water, has unreliable electricity, and inadequate sanitation and health care.
Yenny sought a loan from Kiva partner, Esperanza, to help expand her store 'Fantasia', which sells women's items, perfumes and cosmetics. Yenny will use the money from this loan to purchase dozens of undergarments and cosmetics.
Yenny also hopes to use the success of her business for the benefit of her home and family. "I would like to put a new floor in my house and purchase the pens, notebooks and books my children need for school," she says. Yenny dreams of expanding her business one day into the international arena, and is grateful for the support of Esperanza and the opportunities she has to turn her dreams into reality. Thank you for lending to Yenny and Mujeres Luchando Contra la Pobreza.

loans.use: To purchase panties, bras and cosmetics

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: La señora Sandra es cliente nueva, se dedica a la elaboracion de tarjetas de navidad y un sin fin de adornos utilizando goma eva, pintura, escarcha y cartulina, esta actividad no solo la realiza por la epoca de navidad sino tambien para fiestas infantiles y otros acontecimientos, en realidad esta actividad la realiza todo el año con distintas actividades.  Ademas dicta clases particulares en su domicilio donde enseña todo este tipo de trabajos manuales, para estar al dia en todo lo concerniente a su actividad trata siempre de estar al dia con nuevas tecnicas y diseños tratando siempre de tomar cursos de actualizacion. La cliente vive en casa familiar junto a sus dos pequeños niños y a su mama quien es dueña de la casa.
texts.en:
Sandra is a new client. She makes Christmas cards and a multitude of decorations using goma eva (Ethylene Vinyl Acetate glue), paint, glitter, construction paper. She doesn't just do these crafts during the Christmas season but also for children's parties and other events. Actually, this is a year-round activity for her. Besides, she teaches all kinds of crafts classes in her home. In order to be up-to-date on everything concerning her line of work she always strives to be current on new techniques and designs by taking training courses to stay current. She lives with her two small children and her mother, who owns their house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres De Amor Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres de Amor (Women of Love), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town with a tourism-based economy where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her longtime partner and her three children.

Maria is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing sales business by purchasing a dozen pairs of panties, a half dozen bras and a half dozen blouses in the main market in Santiago, then returning to her neighborhood to sell them to her clients at a profit. She will also use the loan to purchase a sewing machine, so that she can customize her clothes. She will use the profits to invest in her home by replacing her wood walls with concrete, purchasing a telephone, purchasing a computer for her children's education, purchasing school supplies for her children and paying tuition for herself to attend English classes. Obviously, not all these thing may be possible at first, but she believes they are achievable in the long term, along with her ultimate goal of owning her own store and "being my own boss." She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for resale and a sewing machine

loans.name: Mujeres Esforzadas Group

texts.en:
Horimena, a 28 year old woman, is the leader of the group Mujeres Esforzadas (Hard-working Women), and her story reflects those of the other women in her group. She is a single mother of two children living in Puerto Plata, a port town in the northern Dominican Republic. It is a tourism-based area which experiences constant economic volatility, lacks access to potable water, and has unreliable electricity and inadequate sanitation and health care. 

Horimena has sought a loan from Esperanza to help expand her street vending business, which provides a variety of goods. She will use the money from this loan to buy five pots, four quilts, four pairs of pants, and various other household and clothing items. 

Horimena wants to continue meeting and working with Esperanza to further develop and expand her business. She dreams that the long-term success of her business will enable her to buy a home, and eventually a television, for her and her two children. She is grateful for the support of Esperanza and their involvement in the realization of her dreams. Thank you for lending to Horimena and Mujeres Esforzadas!

loans.use: to purchase pots, quilts and pants

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Ernestina de 31 años vive con  su madre y su pequeño hijo Giancarlo de 10 años, en una modesta casa que es propia.Desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura; siembra  alverjas, habas, zanahorias, cebollas, y otras verduras pequeñas, que comercializa a los mayoristas que le compran toda su  producción; aunque la labor es ardua,porque  debe pasar varias horas en sus tierras bajo las inclemencias del tiempo; según dice  esta actividad  le ha permitido acostumbrarse y no le parece difícil,  también  le gusta porque obtiene buenas ganancias, en el futuro dice que le gustaría sembrar en mayor cantidad, porque es un sueño que persiguen todos los campesinos para llegar a ganar mas.Es la sexta vez que Ernestina tiene un préstamo con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para devolver de alguna manera la confianza depositada en ella.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes para el cuidado de la tierra, además también quiere invertir en la apertura  de la tienda de abarrotes que hace tiempo no puede concretar y con una parte del préstamo empezará a surtirla.
texts.en:
Ernestina is 31. She lives with her mother and her ten year old son, Giancarlo. They live in a modest house, which is her own. She has been working in agriculture for several years. She plants peas, beans, carrots, onions and other small vegetables. She sells them to wholesalers who buy all of what she produces. Even though the work is arduous because you must spend several hours on the land with the inclement weather, she has become accustomed to it, and it is does not seem difficult to her. She also likes it because she gets good earnings. She says that in the future she would like to plant in greater quantity because her dream is the dream that all agricultural workers have, to come to earn more. This is the sixth time that Ernestina has had a loan with MFP. She is prepared to make all of her payments on time in order to return, in some form, the confidence placed in her. She plans to use the loan to buy various sacks of chemical and natural fertilizers to take care of her land. She also wants to invest in opening a grocery store. She has not been able to finalize that yet, but she will use part of the loan to start stocking it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chemical and natural fertilizers and to stock her store

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga tiene 36  años y junto a ella vive su esposo y sus hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace más de 13 años, ella y su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de tejas y ladrillos, y cada madrugada empieza su labor, primeramente calientan el horno durante dos horas, previos para prepararla la cocción de los moldes que ya están listos, este proceso de cocción dura de dos a tres días aproximadamente. El gran esfuerzo que realizan tiene su recompensa cuando ven logran vender por millares su producción en las ferias de construcción de su ciudad. En el futuro Dominga espera su  propio terreno para poder instalar su fábrica de tejas y ladrillos de manera permanente. Este es su catorceavo crédito con MFP, y siempre ha demostrado ser una persona muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, además que es muy apreciada por sus compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de los insumos y materiales para la fabricación de sus ladrillos, como leña, y aserrín.
texts.en:
Dominga is 36. She lives with her husband and their children in her own house. She and her husband have been making tiles and bricks for over 13 years. Every morning they start their work by first heating the oven for two hours. They do this to prepare it for baking the molds when they are ready. The baking process lasts for approximately two or three days. The great effort they put forth has its recompense when they sell their production by the thousands at the construction fairs in their city. In the future Dominga hopes to have her own land to be able to set up a tile and brick factory in a permanent manner. This is her fourteenth loan with MVP. She has always shown herself to be a very punctual person with her payments. Also, she is greatly valued by her colleagues in her communal bank. She will use the loan to buy supplies and materials like wood and sawdust to make her bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make bricks

loans.name: Franz

texts.en: Franz is a self-employed truck driver who was referred by a friend. He drives locally, picking up and delivering empty boxes to leave at train stations. Franz came to ACCION USA for a loan after he incurred an extra household expenses due to his wife's premature labor. This caused a shock to their household financials. He needs a loan to cover some repairs on his truck, which is a 1982 model and needs to be repaired frequently. Franz and his family depend upon his business entirely and this loan will impact his business tremendously. Learn more about Franz in this Spanish language interview: “Franz-- A micro loan recipient at ACCION USA”. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy new tires, drums, brakes, and a radiator for his truck

loans.name: Jesus Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Miledy is the coordinator of her group, Jesus Nuestra Esperanza (Jesus is our Hope), and her story is representative of both her group and, more generally, of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a northern port town economically focused on tourism where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and four children. 

Miledy is excited to be taking her fifth loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small colmado (corner store); she will purchase two sacks of rice, three cans of cooking oil, two pounds of salami, and three cartons of eggs, among other things. She will use the profits to continue supporting her children’s college education, as well as to continue saving toward the day when she is able to open her own supermarket. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her business

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Reyna es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Reyna tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Reyna junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con el cual trabaja su esposo.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Reyna son mejorar su casa, y aperturar un hospedaje y restaurante.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the Obreras Communal Bank. Reyna is married (common law), is 30 years old and has 1 child. Reyna runs a store out of her house where she sells general goods, vegetables, and meat. She runs this business every day. Along with her husband, Reyna also has a motorcycle which her husband uses to provide transportation services. Reyna needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Reyna's dreams are to improve her house and open a bed and breakfast with a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Susan Gabriela

texts.es:
Susan es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Susan es casada, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Susan junto a su esposo tienen un taller mecánico en un local alquilado en donde realizan trabajos de reconstrucción de piezas, accesorios para puentes.
Susan necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros y planchas de metal.
Los sueños de Susan son tener un local propio y que Susan pueda tener un trabajo propio.
texts.en:
Susan is a member of the Obreras Communal Bank. Susan is married, is 25 years old, and has two children. Susan and her husband have a mechanic's workshop in a rented space where they work on the reconstruction of spare parts and accessories for bridges. Susan needs this loan of 1000 soles, which she will use for the purchase of metal pieces and metal irons. Susan's dreams are to own her space and to have a business of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of metal pieces and metal irons.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha Elena Gómez Rodríguez tiene una pulpería  en el casco urbano de Condega.

Ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento y Zinc para el techo para construir un lugar más amplio y situar ahí la pulpería. Ella empezó este negocio con muy pocos productos para ofertas a los clientes, este fue creciendo a medida que aumentaba la demanda por su buena atención. A tenido este negocio desde hace unos 7 años y lo atiende todos los días desde la 7 de la mañana  hasta las 8 de la noches y le ayuda su esposo también, antes de tener este negocio se dedicaba alas labores del hogar y al cuido de el hijo que ella tiene.

La Sra. Martha Gómez espera que con la compra de los materiales de construcción empiece rápido la construcción del nuevo local donde estará ubicada la pulpería y tener mejor condición y espacio en su casa de habitación donde esta actualmente la pulpería.

Martha Gómez es casad y tiene un solo hijo el cual cursando los estudio primario y a través de su negocio costea los gastos del estudio de su hijo.

Este es el crédito numero 7 que ella a tenido con Ceprodel en un periodo de 5 años. los cuales le han beneficiado positivamente ya que le ha ayudado a aumentar su inventario de productos y tener una mejor oferta a sus cliente y así aumente los ingresos familiares y que mejore su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Elena Gómez Rodríguez owns a general store in the urban zone of Condega. She is seeking a loan from Ceprodel for the purchase of construction materials like cement and Zinc for the roof, in order to construct a larger location for the general store. She initiated this business with a limited inventory, offering very few products to her clients. Her inventory has been increasing, however, because she saw increasing demand due to her good service. She has running this business for 7 years, opening it every day from 7 in the morning until 8 in the evening. Her husband helps her also. Before she had this business, she spent her time doing housework and taking care of her son. Mrs. Martha hopes that with the purchase of these construction materials the construction will soon start for her grocery store's new location, leaving more space and better conditions in her home where the store is currently located. Martha Gómez is married and has just one son who is currently in elementary school. Through her business's profits, she pays for the expenses of her son's studies. This is the 7th loan that she has received from Ceprodel over the last 5 years. These loans have benefited her, allowing her to increase her inventory of products and offer a better selection to her clients, which in turn has allowed her to generate greater revenues for her family and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials like Zinc and cement

loans.name: Silvia Janet

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Silvia es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Silvia tiene un cafetín en un colegio en donde vende golosinas, comida, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo y 2 personas mas.
Silvia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Silvia son tener mas capital para implementar un restaurante y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the Obreras Communal Bank. She is 36, married, and has three children. Silvia has a small café in a school where she sells sweets and food. She does this with help from her husband and two other people. Silvia needs a loan for 1,600 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Silvia’s dreams are to have more capital to set up a restaurant and to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Marco Danilo

texts.es:
Marcos O. de 32 años, vive en una casa de caña con luz como servicio básico no tiene agua ni alcantarillado su vivienda esta ubicada en Fortín de Guayaquil, su esposa le ayuda comprando los productos de su tienda tiene 3 hijos de 12 años, 7 años, 1 año dos estudian en una escuela particular.

Marcos comenzó hace ya 5 años atrás atendiendo la tienda del papa una vez que pudo reunir dinero le pudo comprar la tienda. Ahora el trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días vendiendo arroz, aceites, pollos etc. Una de las mayores complicaciones es el polvo de su sector por lo que no esta pavimentada la calle.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceites, dejas para ampliar un poco más el negocio. En el futuro quiere  agrandar la tienda  y poder hacer su casa de cemento.
texts.en:
Marcos O., 32, lives in a house made from sugar cane stalks. As far as basic services go, he has electricity, but he does not have water or a sewer system. His house is located in Fortín in Guayaquil. His wife helps him buy purchasing the products for their store. He has three children; 12, 7, and 1. Two of the children go to private school. Five years ago Marco started taking care of his father’s store. Once he was able to get together the money, he was able to buy the store. He now works from 7:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. everyday. He sells rice, oil, and chicken, etc. One of the biggest problems is the dust in his area because the street is not paved. He will use the loan to buy rice, oil, and other things to increase the business a little. In the future he wants to expand the store and be able to make his house from cement.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, oil, and chicken

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Maria es casada, tienes 53 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante llamado Marcos que esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 5 personas. Además brinda el servicio de preparado de comida para diferentes eventos.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la refacción de su local.
Los sueños de Maria son comprar una casa en la ciudad de Lima y que su ultima hija culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Obreras Communal Bank. Maria is 53, married, and has two children. Maria has a restaurant called Marcos, which is located in the center of the city of Ayacucho. She works there everyday with help from five people. She also offers catering services for different events. Maria needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to fix her place. Maria’s dreams are to buy a house in the city of Lima and that her last daughter finish her education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her place

loans.name: 14 De Agosto (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal 14 de Agosto esta formado por un grupo de Sras, que siempre buscan en la vida una oportunidad para su superación y desean que sus familia siempre tengan un poco de lo que no pudieron tener, viven en la comunidad de Zhidmad a unos 50 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, Zhidmad es una comunidad que cuenta con paisajes hermosos y la vegetación en su estado natural, en su mayor parte su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, los mas jóvenes han migrado a la ciudad en busca de una oportunidad de trabajo.

La Sra. Zoila J., es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto,  vive en sector de Guayan perteneciente a la comunidad de Zhidmad, tiene 43 años de edad, se encuentra actualmente casada, su esposo es albañil, actividad que le permite aportar económicamente al hogar y salir en adelante junto con su familia, la casa en la que habitan es propia y es el fruto y esfuerzo de años de sacrifico.

Zoila se dedica a la cría de pollos, vacas, y también a la agricultura, son tareas que su mamá le enseño desde que era niña, se lleva bien con todas sus compañeras y amigas por que se conocen desde que eran niñas, este es su 8 ciclo en la fundación y los prestamos le han servido para superarse un poco y fue la Sra. Maria B. quien la incentivo para integrarse a su bankito, nos comenta que los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en su negocio, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR, le entrega va a invertir en la compra de abono para su potrero, su gran sueño es poder terminar su casa.

La Sra. Nancy B.  vive en la comunidad de Cashapata en la parroquia de Zhidad tiene 27 años, se encuentra casada, su esposo trabaja talando madera aunque por el momento no trabaja mucho ya que tuvo un accidente en el cual casi se fractura la columna, y su brazo tuvo que ser operado y puesto platina, Nancy se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos pero también cría animalitos como chanchos, vacas, gallinas, pero la mayoría de estos son para su consumo ya que esta escaso el pasto por la sequía que existe en la región, este es su 8 ciclo en la fundación y se siente tranquila ya que los prestamos le están beneficiando en su hogar, y fue su mamá la que la incentivo para integrarse a su bankito, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR, le entrega va a invertir en comida para sus animalitos como es hierva, alimento para sus chanchos, etc., su gran sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a tener en sus estudios una carrera exitosa.
texts.en:
The August 14th Communal Bank is formed by a group of ladies who always look for opportunities to improve in life and desire for their families to have more than what little they already have. They live in the community of Zhidmad, which is 50 minutes away from the city of Cuenca. Zhidmad is known for its beautiful scenery and the natural state of its vegetation. Most of its residents and involved in agriculture and raising livestock. The majority of the young people have migrated to the city in search of job opportunities.

Sra. Zoila J. is a member of the August 14th Communal Bank. She lives in the district of Guayan which is where the community of Zhidmad is located. Zoila is married. Her husband works as a mason, which allows him to support the family financially so that they can move forward. She and her husband own their home, which resulted after many years of effort and sacrifice.

Zoila raises chicken and cows and is also involved in farming. Her mother taught her how to perform these tasks when she was a young girl. She gets along well with her friends and Communal Bank associates because they have known each other since childhood. This is her eighth loan cycle and each one has helped her improve a little bit at a time. Sra. Maria B. was the person who convinced her to join the Communal Bank. Zoila tells us that her business has greatly benefited from the loans. She will use her current loan from Fundación ESPOIR to buy compost for her pasture. Her greatest dream is to finish construction of her house.

Sra. Nancy B. lives in the community of Cashapata in Zhidad Parrish. She is 27 years old and married. Her husband chops wood for a living since he does not work due to an accident he suffered in which he nearly fractured his spine. His arm required surgery and metal plates. Nancy spends her time performing household chores, but she also raises pigs, cows, and chickens. Most of these animals are for personal consumption since there is little grass as a result of the drought in the region. She is participating in her eighth loan cycle with the Foundation. Nancy feels at peace because the loans have helped her household. Her mother was the person responsible for convincing her to join the Communal Bank. With her loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will purchase food for her animals, such as grasses, and feed for her pigs. Her greatest dream is for her children to have an education so that they can pursue successful careers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animal feed

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Antonia es casada, tiene 49 años y 1 hijos, Antonia tiene una tienda de repuestos en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Antonia vende cosméticos por catalogo.
Antonia necesita un prestado de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de focos y micas.
Los sueños de Antonia son levantar el segundo piso de su casa y que su hijo se case.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of Banco Comunal Obreras (Workers Community Bank). Antonia is married. She is 49 years old and has one child. She has a spare parts shop in a rented location, which she goes to every day. In addition, Antonia sells cosmetics by catalogue. Antonia needs a loan of $350 (1000 PEN), money which will be invested in the purchase of light bulbs and lenses. Antonia’s dreams are to raise the second floor of her house and for her son to get married.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of light bulbs and lenses.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee  tiene 26 años, es madre de un miño de 7 años y juntos viven en su  propia casa. Desde hace un año que se dedica a la agricultura,  sembrando papa, maíz y alfalfa, actividad que le ha resultado más rentable que cuando tenía su tienda, que por motivos de mala ubicación tuvo que cerrar su negocio. Ahora su tiempo lo dedica en su terrenos que sus padres le dejaron como herencia, además se dedica también a la venta de animales menores como ovejas, que son alimentados con la alfalfa que cosecha, ya que así procura una buena alimentación de estos animales y pueda venderlos a buen precio en la feria ganadera. Lo que más anhela Aydee es mejorar su actividad agrícola, extender sus terrenos de cultivo e intensificar la crianza de animales menores. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, además manifiesta estar muy contenta con sus compañeros de su grupo comunal y continuar participando dentro de su grupo y de las tareas que se le encomienden. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono, así como también ovejas para mas adelante comercializarlas.
texts.en:
Aydee, 26, and her 7-year-old son live together in their own house. For the last year she has farmed potato, corn and alfalfa. This activity has produced more profits than when she ran her grocery store which, due to its poor location, had to close down. Now, she spends her time farming the lands her parents left her. Also, she raises small farm animals, like sheep, which she feeds with her alfalfa crop. This provides good nutrition to her animals and she can then sell them for a good price at the livestock fairs. What Aydee most wants is to improve her farming activity, to extend her planted fields, and to increase the number of small farm animals she raises. This is her third loan with MFP and she tells us that she is very happy with her fellow communal bank members and looking forward to continuing to work with her group in whatever tasks are assigned to her. The funds requested will be used to buy sacks of natural fertilizer as well as some sheep to raise and later sell.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and natural fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Natividad es casada, tiene 54 años y 2 hijos, Natividad se dedica a la elaboración de panes, actividad que realiza en horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes ferias de la región.
Natividad necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Natividad es tener un horno propio y tener un Internet.
texts.en:
Natividad is a member of the Obreras communal bank. She is 54 years old, married, and has 2 children. She is a baker. She bakes in a leased oven and sells her product in various regional markets. Natividad needs an 800 sol loan to purchase flour. Natividad's dream is to have her own oven and an Intenet access service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Eulalia es conviviente, tiene 54 años y 6 hijos, Eulalia tiene una Bodega en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.
Eulalia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y leche.
Eulalia sueña con tener un nuevo negocio y regresar a vivir a la cuidad de Lima.
texts.en:
Eulalia, 54, is a member of the Obreras communal bank. She lives with her life partner and has 6 children. Eulalia sells groceries from a leased site; she sells groceries, vegetables and meats daily with her husband's help. Eulalia needs a 1000 sol loan to buy rice, sugar and milk. Eulalia dreams with having a new business and to return to live in Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Pablo Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Pablo Ramón Vílchez A., se dedica a la compra venta de ganado para desarrollarlos y después los vende, razón por la cual utiliza este financiamiento para comprar 5 toretes los cual venderá una vez que alcancen el peso necesario para poder venderlos y sacarle ganancia, este cliente comenzó cultivando granos básicos como frijol y maíz, este trabajo lo hacía con ayuda de su hijo mayor quien le ayudaba a trabajar en el campo, este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo sembrando frijol y maíz también siembra hortaliza como el cultivo de la papa.
Con la compra de estos animales él espera incrementar sus ingresos y la ganancia  la  utilizara  para comprar más ganado e  incrementar su inventario de ganadero.
Don Pablo Ramón Vílchez es casado su esposa trabajo como maestra de educación primaria en una escuela ubicada en una comunidad de Condega, tiene 4 hijos dos varones y dos mujercitas los cuales están a su cargo, don Pablo ha tenido 10 créditos  desde el año 2001 lleva 10 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar y diversificar su actividades de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener y mejorar su nivel de vida ya que antes el vivía en el campo y ahora con sus ganancias compro una casa en la ciudad donde él vive con su familia lo que le ha permitido que sus hijos puedan estudiar y tener mayores oportunidades en sus vidas.
texts.en:
Pablo Ramón Vílchez A. raises livestock. He will use this loan to buy 5 bullocks which he will later sell when they reach the required weight to sell at a good profit. He began as a basic grains farmer growing beans and corn. His eldest son helped him with the farm work. He has always worked and continues to plant beans and corn as well as some vegetables, like potato. He hopes the purchase of these animals will increase his income for he will use the profits from their sale to buy still more cattle and thus increase his inventory. Pablo Ramón Vílchez is married and his wife works as an elementary school teacher in a school located in Condega. He has two sons and two daughters who are under his care. He has had 10 loans since 2001 and has collaborated with Ceprodel for 10 years. The beneficial impact of these loans has been considerable in that they allowed him to improve and diversify his work activities which, in turn, has led to improved quality of life in that he used to live in the countryside and now, with his earnings, has been able to buy a house in the city where he lives with his family. This has allowed his children to be able to go to school and have greater opportunities in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 young bullocks to raise.

loans.name: Gloria Leida

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Gloria es soltera, tiene 46 años y 1 hijo, Gloria vende productos Unión como panes moldes, pasteles, galletas, sus productos los reparte en diferentes instituciones, además Gloria vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panes y cosméticos.
Los sueños de Gloria son terminar de construir su casa y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Obreras (Working Women) Village Bank. She's 46, single, and has one child. She sells Unión products, including loaves of bread, cakes, and cookies, which she distributes to a number of institutions. Gloria also sells cosmetics from catalogs. She needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she'll invest in the purchase of baked goods and cosmetics. Gloria's dreams include completing the construction of her house and having her daughter become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baked goods and cosmetics.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Salome es soltera, tiene 63 años y 3 hijos, Salome vende gas propano en su casa además realiza las ventas a domicilio, para lo cual cuenta con personal que se encarga del reparto, el gas lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Salome necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de balones de gas.
Los sueños de Salome son mejorar su negocio, tener mas puntos de ventas y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Salome belongs to the Obreras (Working Women) Village Bank. She is 63, single, and has three children. She sells propane gas from her home and also makes deliveries to her customers, for which she has an assistant. She gets her products from Lima. She needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll invest in cylinders of gas. Salome's dreams include improving her business, having more places to sell her products, and buying a car to transport them.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cylinders of gas.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: El señor Oscar Danilo M. S., tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y su esposa trabaja como camerciante asi mismo le apoya en la agricultura y de esos ingresos aporta a los gastos de la casa, ellos tienen 2 hijos y es por ellos que la familia M. desea trabajar ardudamente para poder ofrecerles mejores condiciones en su vivienda, ellos se dedican al cultivo de la piña y por este trabajo desean invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y fungicidas que aseguren un mejor cuido a los cultivos, esto les traeria grandes beneficios debido a que podran vender la cosecha de forma rapida y podran recuperar lo invertido, este proceso les traera beneficios y podran planificar a un corto tiempo la reconstruccion de su hogar y poder ofrecerles a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar Danilo M. S. is 32 years old and married. His wife works as a storekeeper as well as helping him with farming and these incomes take care of the living expenses. They have two children and it is for them that the M. family wishes to work hard so that they can provide them with better housing conditions. They grow pineapple and it is for this work they wish to invest in fertilizers and fungicides that will allow them to provide better care to the crop. This will bring them big profits due to the fact that they will be able to sell the crop quickly and will be able to recover the investment. This process will bring them profits and they will be able to plan in a short period of time the rebuilding of their home and be able to provide their children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricutural material for the care of the crop

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es: Milagro de 30 años vive al lado de su esposo Alexander que tiene 33 años y de su pequeña hija Kimberly de 10 años,habitan su casa que es propia.Se dedica a la agricultura, siembra diversos vegetales como alverjas, zanahorias y habas en sus fértiles tierras de cultivo; cada día debe dedicar gran parte de su tiempo a vigilar pacientemente su producción; paralelamente a la actividad agrícola también trabaja preparando  pan y pasteles  en una panadería que le paga por sus servicios, desde hace 9 años ;así siempre esta buscando actividades en que desempeñarse ,como si fuera poco también cría cerdos y los sacrifica para comercializar su carne, todas estas actividades  le son muy rentables y le gustan, porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y quiere darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija; como es una mujer emprendedora tiene planeado para el futuro sembrar en mas cantidad para aumentar su producción y así obtener mayores ganancias.Este es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y esta segura de ser responsable y puntual en cada pago, además manifiesta que esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque todos son muy organizados y solidarios.El dinero del préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semilla de arveja, zanahoria y también pagará el arriendo de sus tierras ya que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Milagro is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her 33 year-old husband, Alexander and their young, 10 year-old daughter, Kimberly. They run an agriculture businesses and grow a variety of vegetables like peas, carrots and lima beans in their fertile fields. Every day she dedicates the majority of her time to carefully tending their crops. Parallel to her farming, she works preparing bread and pastry in a bakery that has paid for her services for the last 9 years. She is always looking for ways to pay her debts. For example, if she had the means she would also raise pigs and sell their meat. All of her activities are profitable and she likes doing them since she greatly wants to move forward and provide the best for her young daughter. As a hard-working woman she has plans for the future. For instance she wants to plant more and increase her production and her earnings. This is the fifth time she has had a loan with MFP and it is certain that she is responsible and every payment is punctual. Also, its clear that she is very satisfied with her village bank since everyone is very organized and committed. Since she really wants to move forward, she will invest the money from this loan in pea and carrot seeds and will pay the lease on her land.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and pay the lease on her land

loans.name: Melida Victoria

texts.es:
Melida M. de 54 años, vive en una casa de cemento con agua y luz como servicios básicos su vivienda esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, esta casada pero su esposo es incapacitado tiene con el 3 hijos solo uno estudia en la universidad leyes.

Melida comenzó a los 26 años aprendiendo a coser así poco a poco lo hizo un medio para vivir. Ahora ella con los ingresos que tiene ayuda a sus hijos en los gastos, trabaja todos los días pero no tiene horario fijo por lo que trabaja en su casa. Una de las mayores complicaciones son los racionamientos de electricidad y tiene que esperar para trabajar en la noche.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tela, flecos y otros implementos para la costura y poder tener más variedad. En el futuro quiere tener su propia empresa de costura con muchas maquinas.
texts.en:
Melida M. is 54. She lives in a cement house with basic water and electricity that is located on the edge of Guayaquil. She is married but her husband is disabled. She has 3 children but only one is studying and he is in law school. Melida began learning to sew when she was 26, and little by little this became her way to earn a living. Now she uses her profits to help her children with expenses. She works every day but she doesn’t have a set schedule because she works at home. One of the biggest problems is the rationing of electricity so she needs to wait and work at night. With the loan she wants to buy fabric,fringe, and other supplies she needs for sewing, and to be able to have more variety. In the future she would like to have her own tailoring business with many sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, fringe

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es: Nerida tiene 44 años y vive con su esposo Guillermo de 43 y su única hija Ángela de 11 años, en su casa que es propia.Con la ayuda de su hermano y su esposo, desde hace 20 años  se dedica a sembrar papa, arveja, habas, maíz y flores de gladiolos de diferentes colores, los que  después comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad, su actividad es rentable porque le permite costear los gastos de sus casa, brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida  a su hija y ahorrar para comprar más chacras; para el futuro ha planeado terminar de construir su casa,  sembrar en mayor cantidad, además de aperturar un negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios en la capital del Perú , también desea comprar un moto carro que brinde servicio público en la ciudad.Es el noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP y sabe que debe ser puntual en sus pagos para acceder a otros créditos, además esta satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque los integrantes son muy unidos.El dinero del préstamo, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para el techado de su vivienda, también comprará varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes para asegurar una buena producción y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nerida is 44 years old and lives with her husband, Guillermo, 43, and their only daughter Ángela, 11 years old, in their own house. With the help of her brother and husband, she has been growing potatoes, beans, peas, corn and various colors of gladiola flowers for 20 years, which she sells in the city market. Her business is profitable, and she is able to cover her household costs, offer a suitable quality of life to her daughter and accumulate savings to buy more farmland. In the future, she would like to finish building her home, grow in larger quantities, and open a business selling cellular phones and accessories in the capital of Peru. She also would like to buy a motorcar with which to offer public service in the city. This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she knows that she must be punctual in her payments to access more loans. She is satisfied with her communal bank, because the members are unified. She will invest the loan in the purchase of construction materials for the roof of her home and to buy various bags of fertilizer to ensure a good crop and obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer and improve her home

loans.name: Elena Micaela

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Elena Micaela B. tiene 59 años de edad es casada, con 3 hijos todos mayores de edad, es de la etnia creole y pertenece a una familia muy conocida en el barrio Santa Rosa, esta señora tiene desde hace aproximadamente 6 años una pulpería en donde vende varias clases de productos incluyendo granos básicos, gaseosas y otros.

Cabe señalar que la microempresaria B. es miembro de la iglesia Verbo desde hace algunos años en donde participa activamente en las actividades de la iglesia. La señora B. esta solicitando apoyo para que se le financie la suma de US 900 dólares para comprar productos en general para surtir su pulpería. 

La microempresaria B. considera que con este préstamo podrá mejorar su negocio y obtener mayores ingresos ya que le permitirá diversificar sus ventas.
texts.en:
This businesswoman is Elena Micaela B.. She is 59, married, and has three grown children. She is of Creole ethnicity, and she belongs to a well known family in the Santa Rosa neighborhood. For approximately six years she has had a mini market, where she sells various types of products including basic grains, soft drinks, and others. Please note that businesswoman B. has been a member of the Verbo church for some years, and she actively participates in church activities. Mrs. B. is asking for a loan for 900 US dollars to buy general products to stock her mini market. Businesswoman B. feels that with this loan she will be able to improve her business and get greater income because she will be allowed to diversify her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and various products

loans.name: Gladys Del Carmen

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Gladys del Carmen T. tiene 61 años de edad es casada, con 5 hijos todos mayores de edad, es de la etnia Mestiza y tiene un tramo de venta en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad de Bluefields, desde hace mas de 3 años en donde vende verduras tales como: papas, cebolla, tomate, chiltoma, yuca, quequisques, chayote, naranjas, limones y otros

Señalamos que la señora T. es miembro de la iglesia Verbo desde hace algunos años en donde participa activamente en las actividades de la iglesia. La señora T. esta solicitando apoyo para que se le financie la suma de US 900 dólares para comprar verduras como las mencionadas en el párrafo anterior y poder ofertar a sus clientes más productos. 

La microempresaria T. agradece de antemano por el apoyo que se le dará con este préstamo y asume la responsabilidad de su pago en las cuotas que se acorden entre los prestamistas y ella.
texts.en:
This businesswoman is Gladys del Carmen T.. She is 61, married, and has five grown children. She is of Mestiza ethnicity. She has a sales stall in the municipal market in the city of Bluefields. For over three years she has been selling vegetables like potatoes, onions, tomatoes, sweet peppers, yucca, “quequisques” (a root vegetable), “chayote” (a plant from the gourd family), oranges, lemons, and others. Mrs. T. has been a member of the Verbo church for several years. She actively participates in church activities. Mrs. T. is asking for a loan for 900 US dollars to buy vegetables like the ones mentioned in the previous paragraph. Then she will be able to offer her customers more products. Businesswoman T. thanks you ahead of time for the support that the loan will give her. She assumes the responsibility for making her payments as agreed upon by the lenders and herself.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables like potatoes, onions, tomatoes, sweet peppers, yucca, “quequisques” (a root vegetable), “chayote” (a plant from the gourd family), oranges, lemons, and others

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando tiene 44 años y esta casado con Marlene de 36 años; con quien tiene tres hijos, Yerson de 21, Yudy de 18 y Marita de 14 años; esta familia vive en  su pequeña casa que es  propia.Desde hace 24 años se dedica a la agricultura siembra  alverja, maíz, papa (tubérculo peruano) y diferentes colores de flores de gladiolos, en los terrenos que le heredaron sus padres y que su esposa junto a sus hijos le ayudan a cultivar; lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar las papas y flores que vende rápidamente en el mercado mayorista de la  ciudad ; esta actividad le permite vivir cómodamente y brindar una adecuada educación a sus hijos, también con las ganancias que obtiene puede adquirir animales como ganado, caballos y asnos que facilitan sus labores agrícolas, sus deseos de progresar han hecho que para  el futuro piense en comprar terrenos y siembre  en mayor cantidad, pero sobre todo arveja ya que invierte poco y obtiene buenos ingresos económicos  en menor tiempo.Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP y sabe que será puntual y responsable como siempre.Con el dinero del préstamo ha pensado comprar bolsas de semilla de arveja, abono orgánico y fertilizantes para cuidar sus tierras; esta inversión asciende a dos mil quinientos soles aproximadamente.
texts.en:
Orlando is 44, and he is married to 36 year old Marlene. They have three children; Yeson is 21, Yudy is 18, and Marita is 14. This family lives in a small house, which is their own. For 24 years he has been cultivating peas, corn, potatoes (Peruvian tuber), and different colors of gladiola flowers. He inherited the land from his parents. His wife and children help him cultivate the land. What he likes best about his work is harvesting the potatoes and flowers, which sell rapidly in the wholesale market in the city. This activity allows him to live comfortably and to provide an adequate education for his children. With the earnings he also is able to get animals like livestock, horses, and donkeys. These make his farming work easier. His desires to progress have made him think of buying more land and planting in greater quantity in the future. Most of all, he will do this with peas because he invests a small amount and gets good earnings in less time. This is his ninth loan with MFP, and he knows that he will be punctual and responsible as always. He will use the money from the loan to buy bags of pea seeds, organic fertilizer, and chemical fertilizer to take care of his land. This investment comes to approximately 2,500 PEN.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and organic and chemical fertilizers for his land

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es: Elmer tiene 38 años y cuya familia esta constituida por su esposa y sus tres hijos, y juntos viven en su propia casa. Desde hace 8 años que se dedica a cultivar la alfalfa, papa y maíz, y al cabo de un tiempo luego de la cosecha son comercializados en el mercado de sus ciudad. Diariamente Elmer observa sus plantaciones en desarrollo y crecimiento, y en lo posible cuida de ellas para evitar las infecciones ocasionadas por plagas o enfermedades que puedan afectar sus cosechas. De esto depende para que pueda comercializarlos a buen precio, siendo más rentable la venta de alfalfa. En adelante espera adquirir más extensiones de terreno e intensificar el cultivo de la alfalfa. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y manifiesta que trabajar en equipo es una buena opción de desarrollo, por lo que esta muy contento de trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sus próximos cultivos.
texts.en:
Elmer is 38 years old and his family is composed of his wife and their 3 children, They live in their own house. For the last 8 years he has been dedicated to cultivating alfalfa, potatoes and corn. After harvests, he sells his crops in the city market. Daily, Elmer observes his plantings growing and developing, and as much as possible, he cares for them to avoid infections from plagues or illnesses that might affect harvests. This is necessary if he is to sell them at a good price. Alfalfa is his most profitable to sell. In the future he hopes to acquire greater extensions of land and intensify cultivation of alfalfa. This is his 3rd loan with MFP. He says that to work as a team is a good option for development and for this reason, he is very content to work with his communal group. He will invest this loan in purchasing sacks of manure for his next plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MORE MANURE FOR HIS CROPS

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Marlene del Socorro O. M., tiene 38 años de edad es comerciante y se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de abarrotes ropa y zapatos, ella vive en una zona muy humilde es donde la inseguridad ciudadana asecha dia a dia, ella es una mujer trabajador que con su trabajo a conseguido el sustento de todos los dias es por este esmero que solicitó un prestamo con la intencion de invertir en su pequeño negocio y aprovechr la temporada para ofertar a un buen precio y recuperar lo invertido de  forma rapida, esto le traeria beneficios que le asegurarian a corto plazo una mejor estabilidad económica para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Marlene del Socorro O. M. is 38 years old and works in retail trade. For 6 years she has sold groceries, clothing and shoes. She lives in a low-income neighborhood where crime lurks daily. She is a hardworking woman who, with her work, has managed to make a living each day. She is requesting a loan to invest in her small business, taking advantage of the season to offer good prices and thus recoup her investment quickly. This would bring her benefits that would ensure a better short run economic stability for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries, shoes and clothing

loans.name: Dos De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “DOS DE MAYO” y viven en la ciudad D. Cusco D. departamento D. Cusco. Los socios se reúnen cada 30 días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa y esta conformado por 13 socios.

Algunos de nuestros socios tienen pequeños negocios como por ejemplo: Richard vende libros, Presentación vende auto partes de automóviles, Erika vende accesorios para celulares, Wilfredo vende comestibles, Juan Carlos vende ropa, Luzgarda vende productos nutricionales y Miriam vende productos de belleza. Los demás socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo: el socio Mario Antonio trabaja como empleado en el Instituto Nacional de Cultura, Aydee es Secretaria de una empresa de turismo, Juan Pablo es policía y Rosendo hace servicios funerarios. Los socios Sarayda y Yerco  son esposos y se dedican a la fotografía.

Los socios que tienen negocios requieren el préstamo para comprar mas productos como libros, auto partes de carros, accesorios de celulares y comestibles. Los socios que brindan servicios necesitan el préstamo para el gastos familiares o para empezar un pequeño negocio.   

La socia Martha tiene 43 años es madre soltera pues es madre y padre para sus dos hijos. Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades D. hogar con la atención de su funeraria donde ella vende ropa para difuntos y ataúdes. Ya son 10 años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Martha requiere el préstamo para comprar más ropa y ataúdes. 

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “Dos de Mayo” communal bank and they live in the city of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. The group meets every 30 days in the main office of the Asociación Arawia [Kiva Field Partner] and it is made up of 13 members. Some of our members have small businesses, such as: Richard sells books, Presentación sells car parts, Erika sells cellular phone accessories, Wilfredo sells food products, Juan Carlos sells clothing, Luzgarda sells nutritional products, and Miriam sells beauty products. The remaining members work in services, such as: Mario Antonio works as an employee of the National Institute of Culture, Aydee is a secretary for a tour agency, Juan Pablo is a policeman, and Rosendo provides funeral services. Sarayda and Yerco are spouses and they work as photographers. The members who have businesses need the loan to buy more products such as books, auto parts, cell phone accessories, and food products. The members that work in services need the loan for family expenses or to start a small business. Martha is 43 years old and is a single mother to her two children. She alternates her domestic activities with tending to her funeral supplies business, where she sells clothing for the deceased and coffins. She has been in this business for 10 years and it has gone well for her because of the effort she puts into her work. She needs the loan to buy more clothing and coffins. The members value and appreciate the loan granted to them through this program and they are committed to making their repayments in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members who have businesses need the loan to buy more products such as books, auto parts, cell phone accessories, and food products. The members that work in services need the loan for family expenses or to start a small business.

loans.name: Ovi

texts.es: Ovi de 29 años vive con su pareja Arcángel de 32, con quien tiene 3 hijos, Yerson de 10, Nicol de 5 y Wedner de 1 año, juntos viven en una casa alquilada.Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura, con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo mayor siembra papa (tubérculo peruano)  y algunas verduras pequeñas, paralelamente cría animales como  ovinos, porcinos y cabezas de ganado, que cuida con dedicación, pues le gusta atenderlos como se merecen, ambas actividades le  son rentables porque le generan buenas ganancias económicas, luego de las cosechas lleva sus productos agrícolas al mercado mayorista donde tiene un puesto, ahí vende a buen precio todos sus productos y cuando se encuentra en apuros económicos oferta sus ovinos o porcinos entre sus vecinos; como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro planea sembrar en mayor cantidad.Este es el tercer  préstamo que tiene con MFP y siente que económicamente progresa por lo que desea acceder a más créditos, además paga puntualmente sus cuotas.Con el dinero del préstamo, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes para cuidar sus cultivos de papa porque desea tener mas cosechas fructíferas.
texts.en:
Ovi is 29 years old and lives with her partner Arcángel, age 32, with whom she has three children: Yerson, age 10; Nicol, age 5; and Wedner, age 1. They live together in a rented house. For the past five years, Ovi has worked in agriculture. With help from her husband and her oldest child, she plants Peruvian potatoes and a few other vegetables. She also raises animals such as sheep, pigs and cattle, which she tends with dedication, since she likes to give them the treatment they deserve. Both activities are profitable for her because they generate good economic returns. After harvesting her crops, she takes them to the wholesale market where she maintains a stand. She sells all of her products there for a good price, and when she finds herself in economic difficulties, she offers her sheep or pigs for sale to her neighbors. Since she is an enterprising woman, she plans to plant larger quantities of crops in the future. This is her third loan with MFP, and she feels that she is making economic progress, so she would like to continue having access to credit, and she is punctual with her payments. With the funds from this loan, she will purchase several sacks of organic compost and fertilizers for her potato plants, because she would like to have more abundant harvests.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sacks of compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 45 años,vive con su pareja Juan de 47 años, ambos tienen 2 hijos pero viven sólo con Mirco de 23 años, en su casa que es  propia.Desde hace 25 años se dedica a sembrar zanahoria, papa (tubérculo peruano), arveja y flor de gladiolos de diferentes colores, en las tierras que compró con la ayuda de su esposo y sus hermanos Jesús y Rubino, quienes en la actualidad todavía cultivan las chacras junto a ella, pese a los años se mantienen unidos; considera rentable su trabajo porque con las ganancias pudo construir su casa, brindarle una adecuada  calidad de vida a su familia; dentro de sus planes futuros, tiene pensado  aperturar una tienda de fertilizantes en la localidad donde vive ya que  estos insumos son muy cotizados entre sus vecinos, asimismo se dedicará también a la compra y venta de maquinaria pesada.Este es el noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP y desea continuar trabajando con los integrantes de su banco comunal  porque son personas bastante confiables y responsables.El dinero del préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de arveja, varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes  para sus tierras de cultivo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and lives with her partner, Juan, age 47. The couple has 2 children, but they live with only one, Mirco, age 23, in a house that they own. For the past 25 years, Rosa has cultivated carrots, Peruvian potatoes, peas and gladiolus flowers of various colors, on land that she purchased with the help of her husband and her brothers Jesús and Rubino, who currently still cultivate the fields along with her. Although many years have passed, they remain united. Rosa considers her work to be worthwhile, because the profits from it have allowed her to build her house and provide an adequate standard of living for her family. Among her plans for the future, she is thinking about opening a fertilizer store in the community where she lives, since her neighbors buy a lot of these supplies. She would also like to buy and sell heavy machinery. This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she would like to continue working with the members of her communal bank, because they are very trustworthy and responsible people. She will invest the funds from this loan in purchasing pea seeds and several sacks of organic compost and fertilizers for her cultivated fields.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, organic compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Filomeno

texts.es: Filomeno tiene 49 años y junto a él vive con sus hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace mas de 5 años decidió vender autos usados, adquiridos por amistades que  desean vender sus carros y cada venta que realiza obtiene una comisión, y con dicho capital compra carros usados y luego venderlos. De esta manera se dedica a este trabajo en sus tiempos libres, ya que su profesión es de docente de grado primario. Lo que más desea Filomeno es tener más capital de trabajo para poder comprar más carros. Este es su primer crédito con MFP,  por lo que esta muy ilusionado de concretar sus objetivos y pueda dar bienestar a sus hijos ya que su esposa viajo al exterior. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará un carro usado para venderlo a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Filomeno is 49 years old, and he lives with his children in a rented house. More than five years ago, he decided to start selling used cars, which he acquires from friends who want to sell their cars. He earns a commission on each sale, and with this capital, he purchases more used cars to sell. He dedicates himself to this work in his spare time, since his main profession is teaching primary school. What Filomeno desires most is to acquire more working capital in order to buy more cars. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is very enthusiastic about reaching his goals so that he can provide for his children's well-being, since his wife has gone abroad. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy a used car in order to sell it for a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a used car to repair and sell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao V., 26, is married and lives with her one-year-old child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Her husband works as a construction builder, earning an income of 5 USD per day.

V. is engaged in a business selling groceries, boiled duck eggs and fried meatballs at her home from which she is able to earn an an income of 50 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been in this business since 2008. She always travels everywhere in the town of the province to sell her food.

V. and her husband try to work hard and help each other ensure a good standard of living for the family and are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, V. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase cows, a motorbike, and more meatballs to expand her business. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy cows, a motorbike, and more meatballs to expand her business

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita D. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Anecita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as sugar, sardines, eggs, candies, coffee (sachet), shampoo, soap (bath and laundry), toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Anecita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene P. is from the village of D'ban Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Arlene is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene raises pigs for sale. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arlene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Lowelyn

texts.en:
