Ali is speciA. in his work because he knows how to cook his chicken and he is known for that; apparently, he has a sort of a secret homemade cooking recipe for his chicken which gives it a speciA. taste and that’s why his clients like going to his restaurant. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. Ali decided on this business because he learned it when he was young with his uncle. In the future, he plans on improving his business and maybe opening a second restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase chicken for his restaurant.

loans.name: La

texts.en:
Mrs. La C., age 44 (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Chork Kao, age 44, married in 1982 and have four children. The eldest son is a chef, another one is a security guard, and the other two attend school. They live in a small village off of National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

La has been selling vegetables and groceries for ten years. Her husband is a rice farmer and raises cows at home. She is requesting her first loan of $300 to add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for commuting. She also will use a part of her loan to buy a water pump machine.

loans.use: To add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Zauja

texts.en: Zauja K. is a business man. He is married with 2 kids, who are both in school. He operates a retail shop in Nakifuma. He is using the loan to purchase retail items such as drinks, cooking oil, sugar, salt and so forth for sale. His dream is to finish his house so that he can relocate and stop paying rent.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as drinks, cooking oil, sugar, salt and so forth for sale.

loans.name: Allahyar

texts.en: Allahyar G. is married and has 2 children. He was born in 1965. G.'s family live in Fuzuli region. He has been in this business for 5 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 4 calves to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves.

loans.name: Enhebat

texts.en:
Enhbat is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called "ger". All her three children attend a local secondary school.

She operates a small cafe with the help of her husband and mother in her town. Her cafe serves a variety of traditional Mongolian dishes. Enhbat started her business in 2003 by renting a room and has grown a successful operation over the years. In 2006 she received a loan worth of 3,000,000 tugrugs in order to buy her own working place, and in 2007 she managed to extend her working place with the loan of 4,000,000 tugrugs. She is very hardworking and is known for her good personality and positive attitude. Enhbat has many hopes for the future and hopes to expand her business soon. She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase potatoes and meat for her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and meat for her cafe.

loans.name: Phall

texts.en: Mrs. Phall K. is a villager in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile and it is far from an irrigation system. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Phall K. decided to ask for a third loan to buy fertilizers and fuel to support the rice field and water machine, and the rest of the loan will be used to buy rice seeds and plow the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Reat Pan, has a rice mill so he can earn a little money to support the family. This couple has two children, one of whom is a laborer in a garment factory and the other is studying at a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Ahmad has been selling used metA. and aluminum since 1998. He also sells old and used spare parts and accessories.

Ahmad requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a car for his work which will facilitate his transportation. This is his fourth loan and he has always repaid on time. His previous loans helped him increase his stock.

Ahmad is speciA. in his work because he is a hardworking man. His clients are his family members, friends and neighbors, as well as traders. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash but decided on doing his businesses because he wanted to improve his family’s income. Also, he realized that it was work that was in demand in his region.

In the future, Ahmad plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car for his work

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
N. Christine M. is a businesswoman and is married with three children, all school-going. She lives at Kigunga and her business is situated in Kigunga Trading Centre.

Christine is using the loan to purchase garments or clothing material for making designs for her customers, hence expanding her business. Her future dream is to expand her business and try her best to have all her children complete their education successfully.

loans.use: To purchase garments or clothing material to expand her business

loans.name: Galbadrah

texts.en:
Galbadrah is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Gobi-Altay province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His son and daughter both attend a local secondary school while his wife is a food technician who works for a private company.

Galbadrah operates a business in his town making wooden products, designing and producing a variety of wooden furniture. He started his business in 1995 after graduating from college as a carpenter. Using his experience, he has built a stable business over the years, and his many customers are very satisfied with the quality items he produces.

As a young, business-minded entrepreneur, Galbadrah has developed a good taste in making unique and stylish furniture that is in demand. He is focused on the future and wants to open his own workshop. He is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan to purchase wood, glue, lacquer and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood, glue, lacquer and other necessary materials

loans.name: Gunsel

texts.en:
Gunsel is a 46-year-old single mother who lives with her five children in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her oldest two children, 20 and 21, are in university, the following two are in a local secondary school, while the youngest is in kindergarten. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent.

With the help of her children, Gunsel operates a business in her town selling coal and wood. She purchases coal directly from local mines and sells it to residents of her province. Gunsel has operated this business since 1997 and has gained much experience over the years. She has a large customer base with many loyal clients and hopes to continue to maintain her business for the future.

Gunsel works as a cleaner in order to supplement her earnings. She says, "I am working hard to help my children to better their lives." She is requesting a 450,000 tugrug loan to buy more coal and wood to sell.

loans.use: To buy more coal and wood to sell

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 38-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their child. Ayman has owned and operated a mini-market since 2007 where he sells canned food, candies, beverages, home cleaning products, shampoos, toys and lots more.

Ayman requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his mini-market so as to expand his stock. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Ayman is speciA. in his work because his business is well located and, more importantly, you can find all you want in his market. He does his best to suit his clients’ demands and offers them the best. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists.

When he first started his business, Ayman didn’t have a lot of clients because he wasn’t known by the public, but he knew how to improve his networking. He decided on doing his business because that is what he always wanted to do since his youngest age.

In the future, Ayman plans on improving his business by always having the best materials for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his mini-market

loans.name: Etab

texts.en:
Etab is a 24-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their three children.

Etab has owned a clothing shop since 2008 where she sells used clothes, as well as shoes and accessories like belts, handbags and more. She decided on doing her business because she realized that it was better using the used clothes than throwing them out.

Etab requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that she has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

Etab is special in her business because she sells good quality used clothes at a cheap price. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She decided on doing her business to supplement her husband’s income.

When she first started her business, Etab didn’t receive a lot of clients because people didn’t like the idea but, once they realized that she sells clean and good quality clothes, she enlarged her customer base.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Hila

texts.en:
Hila is a 47-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their seven children.

Hila has been working in agriculture since 2006, owning a small dairy farm. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to increase the number of her livestock. This is the first time that Hila has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

Hila is speciA. in her business because she produces good dairy products and is known in her region for her good production. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Hila decided on doing her business to supplement her husband’s income since they passed through some financiA. issues.

In the future, Hila plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To increase the number of her livestock

loans.name: Seun

texts.en:
Mrs. Seun N. is 48 years old and lives with her husband, Mr Sorn Yel, and their three children in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. Her oldest child is a laborer in a garment factory and the other two are attending public school. Her husband is a fisherman who helps support his family‘s living expenses.

Mrs. Seun N. is a famer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. In this business, she faces an obstacle because her field has a lot of insects. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy pesticides to kill the insects. She needs the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer and to fix her water pump.

loans.use: To pesticides and fertilizer and to fix her water pump

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
NawA. is a 57-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their two children.

NawA. has owned a store selling home product since 2007. She sells perfumes, beauty products, shampoos, soap and lots more. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that she has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

NawA. is speciA. in her business because she knows how to treat her clients and has a good reputation. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have a lot of merchandise. She decided on doing her businesses to supplement her husband’s income.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Roeung

texts.en:
Mr. Roeung Y. is 64 years old and lives with his wife, Mrs. Thon Hai, in Chambak Trab village in Kandal province. He is shown with his wife in the photo. The couple has four children, two of whom are laborers in a garment factory while the other two are construction workers.

Mr. Roeung Y. and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation they earn less income than needed to support their family. Thus, Mr. Roeung Y. decided to apply for a second loan to buy a cow to use to plow his field to improve his rice yield. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family living with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing his field

loans.name: Savilla

texts.en:
Savilla D. C., 55, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Benjamin D. C., a company driver, and they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been direct-selling branded clothes for seven years.

Savilla has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than six years now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently.

Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, Savilla was able to borrow several times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used almost all the money she borrowed to increase the stock of her product line. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 28,000 per month.

Now, with your help, Savilla would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of added capital for her expanding business and used to buy assorted clothes and shoes to sell.

Savilla dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have enough money for her children’s schooling.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy assorted clothes and shoes for her direct-selling business

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim T., 53 years, lives in Boeng K'aek village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Met Mort, are farmers who own pieces of land where they cultivate rice to support their family. Though she tries to save some money for her family expenses, Sim still does not have enough money left to pay for everything. She has decided to ask for  a loan to buy two cows for breeding. This couple has seven children, two of whom are garment factory workers while two others are laborers and the others are attending public school near their home.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda D. C., 51, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She has been selling cooked food for ten years. Married to Arnel D. C., a driver, they are blessed with one child who is in grade school. 

Erlinda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than five years. She regularly attends weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow 20 times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She has used almost all the money she has borrowed for buying ingredients for her cooked food business. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 120,000 per month. Now with your help, Erlinda would like to apply for a PHP 22,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying ingredients for her food vending business.

Erlinda dreams that their family will continue to have a better life and that her child can finish his studies for a brighter future. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Ndeye Sine

texts.fr:
Madame Ndeye Sine D.  est une femme de 35 ans qui habite aux HLM Grand Médine, une cite située a 2 kilomètres du village de Yoff d’où elle est originaire. Elle est mariée, mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 4 et 15 ans, aussi elle supporte la charge de ses 2 sœurs qui vivent avec elle. Elle capitalise une expérience  de plus de 20 ans dans la commercialisation de tissus teintes (thioubs).En plus elle vend du parfum et de l’encens. C’est par passion qu’elle a épousé l’activité de commerçante. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans ce qu’elle fait c’est la réalisation de profits et la satisfaction des besoins de la clientèle. Par conséquent elle emprunte 300 000 frs qui seront affectes a l’achat de thioubs en vue de compléter une commande qu’elle a reçue pour une valeur de 600 000 frs. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices  lui permet de participer a l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités 
 lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye Sine D. is a 35-year-old woman who lives in the HLM Grand Medine, a housing project located two kilometers from the village of Yoff from which she originates. She is married and mother of three children whose ages vary from 4 to 15 years. She also has two sisters under her care, who live with her. She has accumulated over 20 years experience in selling dyed pieces of cloth (thioubs). She also sells perfume and incense. She went into the retail business by passion. What interests her most in her activity is the profit-making aspect and the satisfaction of customer needs. Consequently she is borrowing 300,000 francs that will be used to purchase thioubs, so that she can complete an order received for an amount of 600,000 francs. Increasing her profits allows her to help improve the family's living conditions. Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting communities to carry out lucrative revenue-generating activities, which in turn contributes to a welcome socio-economic development.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase capital

loans.name: Bayramov

texts.en: Bayramov M. was born in 1956. He is married and has 4 children. He and his family live in Khachmaz town. Three years ago, he started a cattle breeding business.Now Bayramov is asking for  a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 5 calves to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy 5 calves

loans.name: Samia

texts.en: Samia has owned an accessories and beauty shop since 2003. A mother of three, she opened this business to help her husband with the family's income. Over the years, she has had to have a growing number of clients frequent her shop. Today, Samia is requesting a loan of$1,200 to buy a large quantity of accessories to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of accessories

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en: Kamel is a 19-year-old single man. In 2007,after 4 years of experience, this young man decided to work on his own as a home electrician taking on small projects.  Today, Kamel is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy additional tools in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more tools

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret N. is a businesswoman. She is married to Katende Ibrahim and they are blessed with three children, all of whom are in school. Her business is situated in the Mukono trading center. She is using the loan to acquire first-hand clothing for sale, that is to say shirts, trousers, suits and so forth. Her ambition is to expand the business.

loans.use: To acquire first-hand clothing for sale, such as shirts, trousers, suits and so forth

loans.name: Serigne Babacar Sy No. 1 Group

texts.en: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is an association of female commercantes (vendors) working in Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar. The association, named after an important marabout (a religious leader in West African Islam), was founded in 2006 by a group of entrepreneurial women from the Cité Lamy neighborhood. The aim was to help the members finance their small businesses through a revolving savings fund called a tontine, in which members contribute a small amount to the pot each month to finance one member's activities. Today, the association has evolved to secure group loans for its members through cooperation with UIMCEC, a Kiva partner. Groups of five are financed through 10-month loans in which each member receives an equal amount. On the 20th of each month, the members of the association hold a meeting to collect the repayments. CurrentL., there are 14 groups of women financed through UIMCEC. Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is headed by Ms. Coumba Faye, the president, and Ms. Oumu Ngom, the treasurer. Ndeye Fatim P. heads group No. 1. She is partners with her older sister, Arame P., who is also in the group. Together, they take turns making the trip to their aunt's farm to purchase peanuts to sell in the market of Grand Thies, a neighborhood in the middle of the city. They have been in the business for some six years. Ndeye also sells breakfast to her neighbors, mainL. sandwiches with niébe (bean spread), mayonnaise or tuna. The other three members are: Coumba L., who also sells peanuts; Mame Saye D., who sells Marmite cooking pots; and Diarra D., who sells detergents and soaps. Each member of the group receives 100,000 CFA francs to finance their activities.

loans.use: Bolstering each member's small business

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group No. 2

texts.en:
Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is an association of female commercantes (vendors) working in Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar. The association, named after an important marabout (a religious leader in West African Islam), was founded in 2006 by a group of entrepreneurial women from the Cité Lamy neighborhood. The aim was to help the members finance their small businesses through a revolving savings fund called a tontine, in which members contribute a small amount to the pot each month to finance one member's activities.  

Today, the association has evolved to secure group loans for its members through cooperation with UIMCEC, a Kiva partner. Groups of five are financed through 10-month loans in which each member receives an equal amount. On the 20th of each month, the members of the association hold a meeting to collect the repayments.  Currently, there are 14 groups of women financed through UIMCEC. Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is headed by Ms. CoumB. F., the president, and Ms. Oumu Ngom, the treasurer.  

Awa N., the mother of six, is the head of group No. 2. One could say she is an international businesswoman: She travels several times per year to neighboring Mauritania to purchase shoes, fabrics and incense, bringing it back to Thies to sell door-to-door. She makes the journey most often at night, when there is less traffic. The small bus leaves Thies around 2 a.m., arriving just across the border around 8 a.m. Awa then takes the day to find the best deals, returning once again in the evening. The whole excursion typically takes about 24 hours. She says the prices in Mauritania are much lower than in Senegal.

Issane F., another member of the group, agrees. She makes the same trip, often buying mobile phones, which can sell for double the price back in Thies. The other three group members are: Aissatou D., who sells guedia (dried fish); Codou Kairé, who sells fresh fish; and Awa B., whom sells monkey bread (baobab fruit), perfumes and other diverse items.  Each group member receives a 100,000 CFA franc credit to finance their activities.

loans.use: Bolster each member's small business

loans.name: Saida

texts.en: This young lady is married and has one child. She was born in 1983. Dunyamaliyev lives in Fuzuli region. She has been in this business for two years. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy chickens and ducks to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy chickens and ducks

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a 52-year-old woman who has three children. Her husband is in the printing business and one of her children is studying at the university. She has a business in a busy market in Gikomba where she sells clothes and provides tailoring services. She employs two people and has been in the business for less than one year. Previously she was involved in computer typesetting. With loan of Kes 20,000, she hopes to buy more clothes such as skirts and shirts. Thanks to Faulu, she is focused and well informed in business matters. She wants to expand her business to employ more people and economically empower them. She hopes to buy her own plot of land in the future to build residential houses. Veronica describes herself as friendly and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy stock in clothes

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: N. Joyce, 28 years old, is a widow with five children all in school. She owns a retail shop business. She has operated this business for over two years. She is a permanent resident of Baggala zone. She is using the loan to acquire items (drinks, rice, maize flour, beans, bread, soap, salt, sugar, and so forth) in order to expand her business. Her dream is seeing her children finish their education and getting good jobs.

loans.use: To acquire retail items for her store

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group No. 3

texts.en:
Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is an association of female commercantes (vendors) working in Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar.  The association, named after an important marabout (a religious leader in West African Islam), was founded in 2006 by a group of entrepreneurial women from the Cité Lamy neighborhood.  The aim was to help the members finance their small businesses through a revolving savings fund called a tontine, in which members contribute a small amount to the pot each month to finance one member's activities.  Today, the association has evolved to secure group loans for its members through cooperation with UIMCEC.  Groups of five are financed through 10-month loans in which each member receives an equal amount.  On the 20th of each month, the members of the association hold a meeting to collect the repayments.  Currently, there are 14 groups of women financed through UIMCEC.  Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is headed by Ms. CoumB. Faye, the president, and Ms. Oumu Ngom, the treasurer.  

Awa B. heads group No. 3.  She has been selling perfumes and cosmetics for about four years.   Awa chose perfume sales as they sell quite quickly - currently, the Casablanca and Aqua de Gio scents are the best sellers, she says.  Awa is married and the mother of two children, aged 2 and 6.

The other groups members are: Mareme D., who sells detergents and soaps; Gnangna D. who has a small kiosk selling small items from perfumes to candies; Maimouna F. who has a small vegetable stall in the market of Grand Thies; and Aly T. who sells marmite cooking pots in the same market.  Each group member receives 100,000 FCFA in loan financing to bolster her respective activity.  This is the second loan for the group.

loans.use: To finance each member's small business

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en: N. Proscovia is a single lady. She is 27 years old with no children. She sells stationery. She has been in the business for over two years. She is using the loan to purchase books, paper, cartridges, pens and pencils, crayons, and so forth. She is a hardworking businesswoman who acquired the loan in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase books, papers, cartridge, pens and pencils, colors, and so forth.

loans.name: Ibrahim Abdalah

texts.en: Ibrahim Abdalah is 29 years old and married with five children who are in primary school. He is looking after three dependents, two of whom attend school. He has had a grocery store business for more than nine years now. He will use the loan to purchase and stock more items, such as rice, posho (maize flour), beans and cooking oil for sale. He is an ambitious business man whose dream is to expand his business so that he may be able to obtain better monthly profits.

loans.use: To purchase and stock rice, maize flour, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift is 32 years old, married, blessed with a two-year-old child and caring for one dependent in school. He has a restaurant and pub business where he sells soda, food and other items. He has been in this business for over four years. He will use the loan to purchase crates of sodas and different food products for his business. He is a hardworking business man whose dream is to grow his business so that he will be able to provide accommodations to his clients for better profits.

loans.use: To purchase crates of sodas and food products for his business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with four children who attend school, and she cares for two dependents who are in school, too. She has a grocery business dealing with green peppers, tomatoes, onions, garlic, and so forth. She will use the loan to purchase grocery items, such as green peppers, tomatoes, onions and garlic in large quantities. Her dream is to obtain a restaurant for more income.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, such as green peppers, tomatoes, onions and garlic

loans.name: Nohra

texts.en: Nohra is a 33-year-old single man. He has been working as a DJ since 1998. With the help of the first loan, he managed to expand his business by buying new sound equipment. Today, Nohra is asking for a new loan of $1,200 to buy more music equipment.

loans.use: To buy more music equipment

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: La Sra. Yessica vive en el domicilio de su Madre, tiene un hijo, es madre soltera, y con esta  actividad sustenta a su familia, la Sra. Yessica es una persona responsable y muy dinamica, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería  por las fiesta de fin de año, vive en la localidad del el torno barrio naciones unidas, se siente satisfecha con nuestra institución por haber confiado en su persona.
texts.en:
Yessica lives with her mother and has one son. She is a single mother and supports her family with her work. Yessica is a responsible and very dynamic person. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for the New Year's celebrations. She lives in the El Torno area of the Naciones Unidas neighborhood of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. She is very satisfied with the field partner institution for having confidence in her.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate his shop and to buy more vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Jobran

texts.en: Jobran has owned a car painting shop in his town since 1992. He's 48 years old, married, and the father of 3 unemployed children. There is great demand for his services, and he wants to buy more tools in order to maintain this demand. In addition to tools, Jobran wants to use his loan of $1,200 to buy more specialized car painting supplies. He would like to make a good income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more tools and specialized car painting supplies

loans.name: Andre

texts.en: Andre has been working as a taxi driver since 2000, when he first introduced his transportation services to his town and its surroundings. He is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children who still go to school. He profited from his first loan, and is now asking for a new loan of $1,200 to perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Francois

texts.en: Francois is a 31-year-old married man with 2 young children. He owns a jewelry shop where he makes and repairs jewelry. Today, Francois is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy tools and appliances needed to make a greater variety of products and thereby increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase tools and appliances for his business

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 1 2 Group

texts.en:
Edlina is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres en Accion (Women in Action), and her story is representative of her group's members and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a northern port town which is economically-focused on tourism. In Puerto Plata, running water (which is not potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure, and she lives with her long-term partner and their child.

Edlina is excited to be seeking her third loan through Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. To earn a living, she sells clothing and food; more specifically, she purchases pants, polo shirts, sheets, curtains, rice, sugar, flour, oil, and cups, and she either sells these goods (in the case of the clothes) or cooks with them (in the case of the food, which she later sells). She will use the profits generated as a result of the loan to invest in her home and her family. In particular, she would like to purchase chairs for her home and a backpack, shoes, and clothes for her child. Her long-term goal is to save enough money so that she can send some money home to Haiti to finish building her home. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional goods and food supplies

loans.name: Aychi

texts.en: Aychi is a 44-year-old single woman living with her parents. Since 2007, she has been working as a saleswoman, though she specializes in selling cosmetics and beauty products. Notably, she already received a prior loan, which she was very thankful for.  Now, Aychi is seeking to borrow a second loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy more products so that she can satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To expand her business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional products

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a married woman with two children.  Since 1999, Nadia has been working as a home-based tailor to help her husband cover their family's living expenses and to pay for her children's school fees.  Now, Nadia is seeking a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing a new sewing machine

loans.name: Yerson

texts.es: Yerson  de 33 años esta casado con Nelly que tiene 40 años, por ahora vive en una acogedora casa alquilada.Desde hace 25 años se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que desarrolla con mucho empeño, siembra habas, cebolla, arveja, espinaca y zanahoria, con la ayuda incondicional de su querida esposa; lo que más le gusta de su ardua labor es ver la calidad y cantidad de sus cosechas, puesto que le deja buenas ganancias al comercializar sus productos  en la ciudad; paralelamente también cría cuyes y conejo, los que vende de vez en cuando.En el futuro Yerson ambiciona comprar más terrenos agrícolas, una casa propia y además sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener una mejor productividad que le dará la oportunidad de alcanzar sus metas.Es la quinta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y promete ser puntual en cada uno de sus pagos.Con el dinero del préstamo tiene pensado comprar semillas de arvejas para sembrar en mayor cantidad, y así seguir saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Yerson is 33 years old and married to Nelly who is 40. For the present, he lives in a sheltering rented house. For 25 years he has dedicated himself to agriculture, an activity which he pursues with much effort. He sows beans, onions, green peas, spinach and carrots, with the unconditional help of his dear wife. What he likes most about his arduous labor is to see the quality and quantity of his harvests. This results in good earnings when he sells his produce in the city. On the side, he also raises guinea pigs and rabbits that he sells from time to time. In the future, Yerson wants to buy more agricultural land, and a house of his own, and, in addition, he wants to plant in larger quantity in order to obtain greater productivity, which will allow him to reach his goals. This is his 5th loan with MFP, and he promises to be punctual with each of his payments. With these loan funds he will buy green pea seeds to sow in greater quantity, and thus continue to forge ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SEEDS IN ORDER TO PLANT IN LARGER QUANTITY

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Benita, es una cliente que se dedica a la venta de sombreros, mantas y joyas para las señoras de pollera (las Cholitas), es cliente antigua, tiene cuatro hijos varones, quienes ya trabajan independientemente, ella por ahora se encuetra dedicada a la crianza de su pequeño nieto de un año, quien quedo huérfano de madre, es una persona muy trabajadora, ya que desde que se separo del esposo ella controla a sus hijos, quienes trabajan en las movilidades que les dejó el Papá y la que compraron con el trabajo de la Mamá y de ellos, la Sra. Benita es una persona muy responsable y puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Benita sells hats, shawls, and jewelry for the “Cholitas” (women who wear typical regional skirts). She is a long time client. She has four sons who work independently. She also is now raising her small one year old grandson who was left without his mother. She is a hard-working person. Since she separated from her husband, she has been in charge of her sons. They work in the vehicles their father left them and the one they bought through their work and their mother’s work. Benita is a very responsible person who is punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
For the past ten years, Kamal has operated a business providing garden maintenance and pesticide application. He's a 32-year-old single man.

Today, Kamal is asking to borrow $1,200 to purchase a lawnmower and supplies for his business.

loans.use: To buy a lawnmower and supplies for his business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old engaged man. In 2006, he opened a vegetable shop in his town as his own business. Over the years, he was able to have a growing number of clients pass by his shop.

Today, Ali is requesting $1,200 to buy more inventory so as to continue to cater to his clients.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: We Too Can Do Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'We Too Can Do' group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the city of Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. These women want a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to boost their businesses. With such a loan, they can add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make better sales, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is 27-year-old Rosaline M. Z., in the middle of the photo. This mother of 3 is single and was born in Pujenjun, in southern Sierra Leone. Two of her children are attending primary school and one is a baby. Rosaline has been selling shoes and rich cakes for 6 months now. With her share of this loan, she can expand her business. She will use the loan to buy several dozens of shoes. She will also use the remainder of the money to invest in her rich cake business by buying working materials – rice, plantains, bananas, oil, and so on.

loans.use: To buy dozens of shoes and invest in her rich cake business

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en:
Suzanne is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. She has worked as a home-based hairdresser since 2007. This young woman caters to a wide range of clientele in her village and its neighborhood.

Today, Suzanne wishes to rent a shop and buy specially designed barber chairs and products. In order to do so, she is requesting $1,000.

loans.use: To rent a shop and buy specially designed barber chairs and products

loans.name: Teko Sanda Traders Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Teko Sanda' Traders group from Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They are local, small-scale entrepreneurs who want a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to boost their businesses. 

The woman second from left is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She is Marie K., a 35-year-old mother of 3 children.  Her husband is a farmer; 2 of their children are attending secondary school and 1 is in primary school. Marie has been selling fish and cigarettes for 7 years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy a basketful of fish and a carton of cigarette in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy a basketful of fish and a carton of cigarettes to sell

loans.name: Victoria Natividad

texts.es:
Victoria P. de 37 años, vive en una casa de cemento con agua luz y alcantarillado su casa esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su esposo trabaja como electricista con el tiene 2 hijos uno de ellos es un niño down tiene 7 años.

Victoria se dedicaba solo a estudiar y la solvencia de su familia era el sueldo de su esposo pero eran muchos gastos y opto por tener otro ingreso ya hace 4 años atrás  comenzó como vendedora Yanbal. Ahora Victoria trabaja por pedidos vendiendo perfumes, maquillajes, cremas etc. Una de las mayores dificultades es cuidar a su hijo down con las terapias.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar maquillajes, shampoo, cremas, perfumes para tener un poco más de variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere ser directora Yanbal y tener más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria P. is 37. She lives in a cement house with water, light, and a sewer system. It is located in the Perimetral area of Guayaquil. Her husband works as an electrician. She has two children. One child is seven and has Down’s. Victoria devoted herself solely to education, and her husband’s salary was for the family’s solvency. However, there were a lot of expenses, and she decided to have another income. Four years ago she started as a Yanbal salesperson. Now Victoria works by orders selling perfume, make-up, and creams, etc. One of the major difficulties she has is using the therapies to take care of her child with Down’s. She will use the loan to buy make-up, shampoo, cream, and perfume to have a little more variety in her products. In the future she would like to be a Yanbal manager and have more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make-up, perfumes, and creams

loans.name: La Unión Del Progreso Group

texts.es:
UBICADO A 6KM APROXIMADAMENTE  DE LA CIUDAD DE CUAUTLA SE ENCUENTRA LA LOCALIDAD DE APATACO, PERTENECIENTE AL MUNICIPIO DE AYALA MORELOS.
LA FORMA MAS FACIL PARA LLEGAR ES POR LA AVENIDA DEL SR. DEL PUEBLO TODA DERECHA PASANDO EL PUENTE DE APATLACO SE ENCUENTRA LA COMUNIDAD DE CUAHUIXTLA EN LA CUAL SE ENCUENTRA LA UDE LA UNION DEL PROGRESO LA CUAL SE HA CARACTERIZADO POR SU PUNTUALIDAD EN SUS PAGOS.
TODOS LOS INTEGRANTES DE LA UDE SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO Y AL SERVICIO LA SRA. VERONICA SE DEDICA A VENDER FUNDAS PARA LICUADORAS Y LAVADORAS, LA SRA. FRANCISCA D. SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE CHILES ENVINAGRE Y ENSALADA DE NOPALES, DOÑA MARGARITA VENDE POR CATALOGO Y TAMBIEN VENDE BUÑUELOS, NOHEMI ES DIRECTORA DE MERY KAY Y TAMBIEN VENDE POR CATALOGO, FLOR VENDE POR CATALOGO Y UN POCO DE ABARROTES CUANDO HAY OFERTAS EN LA TIENDA QUE TRABAJA, CARLOS, GENOVEVA Y MAGDALENA TIENEN COMBIS DE TRANSPORTE PUBLICO, SOFIA Y ERIKA VENDEN POR CATALOGO Y ERICK VENDE PRODUCTOS DE HERBALIEF.
Y POR ULTIMO LETICIA B. B. ELLA SE DEDICA ALA VENTA DE CATALOGO Y DE LA CUAL HABLAREMOS AHORITA.
ELLA SE ENTERO DE ESTE CREDITO POR UNA PRIMA LA CUAL LA INVITO A ELLA Y A SU MAMA SE FORMO EL GRUPO PERO TUVIERON ALGUNOS PROBLEMAS CON SU PRIMA DEVIDO A QUE SE QUERIA AGARRAR ALGUNAS BASES NADAMAS TERMINARON EL CREDITO Y DESCANSARON 2 MESES DE AHÍ LETI SE COMUNICO A LA EMPRESA YA QUE QUERIA FORMAR UN GRUPO PERO CON DIFERENTES PERSONAS SE FORMO Y AHORITA YA ESTAN EN EL TERCER CICLO EL CREDITO QUE TIENE ES DE $8000 EL CUAL LO VA A INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO YA UQE VENDE DE TODO UN POCO TOPPER, PERFUMES, CREMAS, ROPA INTERIOR, ETC. ELLA ES CASADA TIENE 2 HIJOS UNO ESTA EN CUARTO AÑO DE PRIMARIA Y EL OTRO TIENE CUATRO MESES DE NACIDO.
NOS COMENTA QUE CUANDO ELLA SE CASO SUFRIO MUCHO YA QUE ELLA TRABAJABA DESDE QUE ESTABA JOVEN Y LE GUSTABA TENER DINERO PROPIO PERO CUANDO SE CASO TODO CAMBIO POR QUE SU ESPOSO NO LA DEJO SEGUIR VENDIENDO. UN TIEMPO SU ESPOSO SE FUE A E.U. EN EL CUAL ELLA APROVECHO PARA VENDER DE TODO Y CUANDO EL LE AVISABA QUE YA IBA A REGRESAR ELLA SE DESHACIA DE TODO  PARA QUE EL NO NOTARA NADA PERO UN DIA LA CACHO Y EL SE PELEO CON ELLA PERO DESPUES HABLARON Y EL COMPRENDIO QUE YA IBA A HACER UNA AYUDA MAS LO QUE ELLA APORTARA PARA SUS GASTOS Y ASI PODER SACAR A SUS HIJOS ADELANTE Y DARLES TODO LO QUE SE MERESCAN.
POR ULTIMO AGRADECIO A LA EMPRESA DE FUNDACION REALIDAD POR EL APOYO BRINDADO PARA SEGUIR ADELANTE CON EL PRESTAMO Y PODER CONTINUAR CON SU NEGOCIO YA QUE HAY VECES EN LAS QUE NO SE CUENTA CON LOS SUFICIENTES RECURSOS PARA SURTIRSE Y ASI LO VAN ADMINISTRANDO PARA QUE LES ALCANSE Y PUEDAN VENDER SU MERCANCIA POCO A POCO
Y A KIVA POR CONFIAR EN FUNDACION REALIDAD Y DARLES LA OPORTUNIDAD DE CONOCERLOS Y CONOCERNOS POR MEDIO DE LA ENTREVISTA Y LA FOTO.
texts.en:
The village of Apataco, which is located approximately 6 km from the city of Cuautl, is part of the municipality of Ayala Morelos. The easiest way to come to that place is to go straight ahead on Avenida del Señor del Pueblo. The community of Cuahuixtla, which belongs to the village bank "La Unión del Progreso", is situated right behind the Apatlaco bridge. Their members are known for the punctuality of their repayments. All the members of the village bank are active in trade and services: Mrs Verónica sells protective covers for blenders and washing machines,Mrs Francisca Díaz prepares pickled peppers and nopal salads,Doña Margarita sells via catalog and also sells buñuelos,Nohemi is a manager with the cosmetics company Mary Kay and also sells via catalog,Flor sells via catalog and some groceries when there are bargains in the store where she works,Carlos, Genoveva and Magdalena operate public transport minibuses,Sofía and Erika sell via catalog,Erick sells nutrition products from Herbalife, and finallyLeticia B. B. sells via catalog; a detailed account of her story follows. Leticia initially was a member of a loan group to which she and her mother were invited. The group was created, but had problems with the repayments. There was some fighting, but finally the loan was repaid. Leticia waited for two months and then informed the microfinance institution that she wanted to set up a new group with other members. This group was created and is now in its third loan cycle. Leticia's share of the loan amounts to 8,000 pesos, which she will invest in her store where she has a highly diversified inventory: sportswear, perfume, creams, lingerie, etc. She is married and the mother of two sons: one is in fourth grade and the other is four months old. She told us that when she married, she suffered a lot. The reason is that she had been working since she was very young and she liked having her own money. However, when she married, everything became different, because her husband would not let her continue selling. There was a time when her husband was in the United States. She grasped the opportunity to open a store and sold anything she could. When her husband informed her that he was about to come home, she got rid of her entire inventory, so that he shouldn't notice anything. But soon he learnt the truth and had a fight with her. Finally, they talked about it and he understood that her contribution might help him to support his sons and give them everything they were entitled to. Finally Leticia thanked our microfinance institution for its support and continued lending. She was able to continue her business, because at times she did not have the necessary resources to restock her store. She used the loans to reach her goal and be able to keep selling her merchandise. She is grateful to Kiva to trust our microfinance institution and to give the lenders the opportunity to get to know the institution and the entrepreneurs through this interview and this picture.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfume, deodorants, creams, etc.

loans.name: Mourad

texts.en: Since 2000, Mourad has owned and operated a computer shop in his town.  He proudly explains that students visit his shop to do research and that the local children also like to play games at his shop.  Currently, Mourad is seeking a loan in the amount of $700 to buy internet cards and new game programs to attract more customers.

loans.use: To attract additional customers by purchasing internet cards and games

loans.name: Ballay Group

texts.en:
Ballay T., second from right, is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. They are residents of Makeni city, northern Sierra Leone, where they also own small-scale businesses. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT/Kiva Borrowers in order to enable them to expand their businesses. 

The group's 45-year-old leader is married to a driver and they have 7 children. One of her children is in college and 6 are already grown-ups. Ballay has been selling head ties (head scarves) for 5 years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy dozens of a wide variety of head ties.

loans.use: To buy dozens of head ties (head scarves) to sell

loans.name: Ngwa

texts.en:
Ngwa S. is a widowed mother of seven currently living in Ntasen, Cameroon.  Ngwa S. is currently requesting her eighth loan from GHAPE.  She has been with GHAPE since 2000 and has demonstrated a creditworthy character exemplified by her repayments, consistent attendance at meetings and support of her borrowing group.  

With this latest loan, Ngwa S. is hoping to continue the business practices supported by her prior loans.  She has requested 500,000 CFA in order to purchase a few pigs, feed for her pigs, and a fence to keep her livestock.  She will also be using the funds to purchase chickens and feed for her chickens.  She believes that her business will succeed because of her experience working in this industry.  She is confident in the expertise she has gained after years of refining her trade.  

Ngwa S. hopes to use the profits from her business to provide for the various needs of her family.  As the sole provider for her family of eight, Ngwa S. hopes to increase her profits in order to have enough to provide her family with sufficient nourishment and hopefully put some of her funds in savings.  

Ngwa S.’s loan would be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy pigs, chickens, feed and a fence

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena de 48 años, tiene  3 hijos; Alex de 23, Elmer de 18 y Cristian de 14 años, con quienes vive en una  acogedora vivienda propia.Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la agricultura siembra  alverja y papa (tubérculo peruano), zanahoria, flores de gladiolos, con la ayuda de sus hijos, además de algunas verduras pequeñas, según sus propias palabras esta actividad le resulta bastante rentable porque le permite pagar los gastos de la casa, pagar la educación de  sus hijos, además de ahorrar ya que en el  futuro tiene planeado  construir una casa en la ciudad y aperturar una tienda de comidas, pues después de la agricultura lo que más le gusta es cocinar platillos típicos de la zona.Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y cuenta que ha notado un progreso económico, además le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal por la responsabilidad que demuestran cada uno de los miembros.Piensa invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de papa, abono,  fertilizantes y botellas de insecticida para cuidar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Elena is 48 years old and has three children, Alex, 23, Elmer, 18, and Cristian, 14. They live together in their own home. For 12 years, Elena has been working in agriculture. She grows peas, potatoes, carrots, gladiola flowers, and some other small vegetables with the help of her children. She says that this business has been profitable and has allowed her to pay for household expenses and her children’s education, as well as some savings. In the future, Elena would like to build a house in the city and open a restaurant. After agriculture, the thing she likes most is cooking the traditional dishes of the region. This is Elena’s third loan with MFP and she says that she has made economic progress. Also, she likes working with her communal bank because of the responsibility demonstrated by each of the members. This loan will be invested in the purchase of bags of seed potatoes, manure, and fertilizer, and bottles of insecticide for the care of her fields.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed, manure, fertilizer, and insecticides

loans.name: Teko Sanda Group

texts.en: Here are members of the 'Teko Sanda' group. Jane D., second from right, is the leader of the group. 30-year-old Jane is married to a soldier and they have 1 child. Jane sells rice, mints, cigarettes, gum, drinks, and so on. She has been a businesswoman for 5 years now. Jane wants a SLL 500,000 loan in order to expand her business. Thus with her share of this loan, Jane is going to buy a bag of rice, a carton of cigarettes, packets of mints and chewing gum to add to her business inventory. Consequently, Jane will be able to make better sales and earn more profit so that she can repay her loan and look after her only child who is attending primary school.

loans.use: Buy a bag of rice, a carton of cigarettes, packets of mints and chewing gum to sell

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria  Es la presidenta del Banco de Emprendimiento San Isidro, actulamente vive en la ciudad de Santa Cruz por la zona del plan 3000, cuenta con casa propia, vive con su esposo el Sr. Cecilio, La Sra. Victoria se dedica a la venta de abarrotes aproximadamente desde hace 2 años, es una persona que le gusta trabajar en grupo; es una de las fundadoras de este banco de empredimiento, el monto que solicita es para la compra de mercaderia para su puesto de venta de abarrotes.						

La Sra. Laurita es una de las integrantes del Banco de Emprendimiento San Isidro es muy trabajadora que a pesar de ser joven es muy dedicada al trabajo y al estudio. Esta integrante se encuentra en su segundo ciclo trabajando con EMPRENDER, vive en la casa de sus padres, se dedica a la venta de comidas por la mañana hasta las 13:00pm. y a las 14:00pm. va camino a clases de la universidad. el monto que esta solcitando es para el aumento de capital de trabajo, quiere ampliar su pension.        
                                                                                               La Sra. Elsa es la jefe de grupo de uno de los grupos dentro del Banco de Emprendimiento San Isidro, la Sra. Elsa de igual manera que la primera se encuentra en su segundo ciclo es una persona muy trabajadora se dedica a la venta de jugos de frutas hace aproximadamente unos 10 años, lo cual trabaja con esta actividad, ella vive en el barrio San Isidro de la zona del plan 3000, vive en casa alquilada junto a sus cuatro hijos. el monto que esta solicitando actualmente es para la compra de licuadoras y aumento de capital en su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is the president of the San Isidro Community Bank. She lives in the city of Santa Cruz in the Plan 3000 zone. She has her own house, and she lives with her husband, Cecilio. Victoria has been selling groceries for approximately two years. She is a person who likes to work in a group. She is one of the founders of this communal bank. The money she is requesting is to buy merchandise for her food selling stand. Laurita is one of the members of the San Isidro Community Bank. She is a very hard-worker. In spite of being young, she is very devoted to her work and her education. This member is in her second cycle of working with Emprender. She lives in her parents’ house. She sells food in the morning until 1:00 p.m. At 2:00 p.m. she heads towards her classes at the university. The money she is requesting is to increase her work capital. She wants to increase her service of making daily meals. Elsa is the head of one of the groups within the San Isidro Communal Bank. Elsa, like the first person, is in her second cycle. She is a very hard-working person. She has been selling fruit juices for approximately ten years. She lives in the Plan 3000 zone in the San Isidro neighborhood. She lives in a rented house with her four children. The money she is currently requesting is to buy blenders and increase the capital in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Amistad Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMISTAD MILAGROSA” y son 11 miembros. Ellos viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Los socios se reúnen cada 30 días en la casa de la señora Ruth como se ve en el video. El socio Gorki es el presidente del banco comunal y da unos saludos por navidad y año nuevo a sus compañeros.  

Algunos de nuestros socios tienen pequeños negocios como por ejemplo: Martha tiene una tienda de abarrotes, Margarita vende artesanía, Celia vende cosméticos, Marina vende jugos y Elvis vende artículos de bromas. 

Los demás socios  brindan servicios o son empleados en una institución privada como por ejemplo, Alva trabaja como empelada en el Hotel “Monasterio”, Reyna Milagros es profesora en una academia de música,  Aura es supervisora de ventas y José Gorki es docente del colegio San Francisco de Borja. 
  
Los socios que tienen negocios requieren el préstamo para comprar más productos como comestibles, cosmético, artesanía y muchas cosas más. Los socios que brindan servicios requieren el préstamo para el gasto familiar o para abrir un pequeño negocio.     

Nuestra Ruth, es casada,  tiene 49 años y tiene 3 hijos, ella tiene un pequeño cafetín en la Plaza principal del distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Ruth requiere el préstamo para comprar productos para tu tienda como pasteles, dulces y gaseosas.     

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Amistad Milagrosa Communal Bank; there are 11 members. They live in the city of Cusco in the Cusco department. The members meet every 30 days in Ruth’s house, as can be seen in the video. Gorki is the president of the communal bank, and he is giving Christmas and New Year’s greetings to his colleagues. Some of our members have small businesses. For example, Martha has a grocery store, Margarita sells handicrafts, Celia sells cosmetics, Marina sells juice, and Elvis sells humorous items. The rest of the members offer services or are employees in private institutions. For example, Alva is an employee in the Monasterio Hotel, Reyna Milagros is a teacher in a music academy, Aura is a sales supervisor, and José Gorki is a teacher at the San Francisco de Borja School. The members who have businesses need the loan to buy more products like food, cosmetics, handicrafts, and many other things. The members who offer services need the loan for family expenses or to open a small business. Our member, Ruth, is 49, married, and has three children. She has a small café in the main plaza in the Santiago district in the city of Cusco. She has been in the business for various years, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Our member, Ruth, needs the loan to buy products like pastries, sweets, and soft drinks for her store. The members are grateful for and value the loan, and they promise to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products like food, cosmetics, handicrafts, and many other things- The members who provide services need the loan for family expenses or to open a small business

loans.name: Kolo-Kolo Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Kolo-Kolo group from the northern city of Makeni. They are petty traders who have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to expand their businesses. With the help of this loan, these petty traders will be able to add more goods to their business inventories so that sales and profit-to-sales-margin will increase. In this way, they can easily repay the loan and better look after themselves and their children. 

The leader of this group is Mayalley K. in the middle of the photo. The 39-year-old mother of 3 has been selling bread, rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) and groundnuts/peanuts for 13 good years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy gallons of palm oil, dozens of loaves of bread, and bags of groundnuts in order to expand the size and quality of her business.  Mayalley’s husband too sells bread; one of her children is in college, and the others are in secondary and primary schools respectively.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil, dozens of loaves of bread, and bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de 46 años, vive con su esposa Antonia que tiene  51 años y con sus 2 hijas; Sonia de 27 y Daysi de 21 años, juntos viven en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 28 años siembra  alverja, papa, maíz y sobre todo flores de gladiolos, pues apenas sale  la cosecha,traslada sus productos agrícolas a la capital, donde tiene un puesto en un mercado, según refiere transportar  lo cosechado hasta Lima es bastante rentable ya que el precio de sus productos se eleva al 100 %, lo que le permite ahorrar y vivir cómodamente; también dice que al principio  no le gustaba la agricultura, pero cuando empezó a formar su propia familia la necesidad hizo que trabaje en las tierras; en el futuro le gustaría sembrar en mayor  cantidad, sobre todo flores de gladiolos pues invierte poco y gana regular.Es el octavo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas.Con el dinero del préstamo comprará una bolsa de semilla de  alverja, varios sacos de abono, fertilizantes y botellas de insecticidas y fungicidas.
texts.en:
Samuel, 46, lives with his wife Antonia, 51, and their two daughters, Sonia, 27, and Daysi, 21. They live together in their own house. For 28 years, Samuel has grown peas, potatoes, corn, and above all, gladiolas. Just after the harvest, he takes his products to the capital where he has a market stall. He says taking his harvests to Lima is profitable, as the prices there are 100% higher. This permits him to save and to live comfortably. Samuel says that at first he did not like agriculture, but when he started his own family, he began to work the fields out of necessity. In the future, he would like to grow more, especially gladiolas, which bring good returns on a small investment. This is Samuel’s eighth loan with MFP and he promises to be punctual with each of his payments. With this money, he will buy a bag of pea seeds, several bags of manure, fertilizers, and bottles of insecticides and fungicides.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pea seeds, manure, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Faithful Traders Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Faithful Traders' group from Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty traders who want a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to improve their businesses both in size and quality. In this way, these entrepreneurs will be able to attract many more customers, make more sales, and earn more profit. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Aruna Banra who is second from right. The 31-year-old is the father of one primary school going child. Aruna is a carpenter by profession, working for 3 years now, and his wife is a businesswoman. Aruna has applied for this loan in order to buy working materials like lumber, nails, polish, glue and so on.

loans.use: Buy working materials like lumber, nails, polish, glue, and so on

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana B. de 47 años, vive en una casa de cemento con agua y luz como servicio básicos su vivienda esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, esta divorciada tiene 3 hijos uno de 22 años, 19 años y 17 años dos estudian en un colegio fiscal.

Ana comenzó criando pollos y chanchos para venderlos por su sector pero como no le fue muy bien decidió retirarte de eso y comenzar la actividad de comerciante. Ahora ana vende perfumes, cosas para la cocina, ropa entre otras cosas. Una de las mayores dificultades es la cobranza que hace a sus clientes ya que no quieren cancelar.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa y más utensilios para el hogar y así tener más variedad en lo que vende. En el futuro quiere tener un gabinete de belleza y hay vender también todos sus productos.
texts.en:
Ana B. is 47. She lives in a cement house that has basic services like running water and electricity. Her house is located in the Perimetral sector of Guayaquil. She is divorced, and has three children. The children are 22, 19, and 17; and they go to a public school. Ana started raising chickens and pigs to sell in her sector. But, that did not go well for her. She decided to stop doing it, and she became a businesswoman. She now sells perfumes, things for the kitchen, and clothes, among other things. One of the biggest difficulties is collecting from her customers who do not want to pay. She will use the loan to buy clothes and household utensils. That way she will have a greater variety to sell. In the future she wants to have a beauty shop and also sell all of her products

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Utensils for the home and clothes

loans.name: Nevados De Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es: “Nevados de Huayna Potosí”  es un grupo de 7 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “German Busch”,  se agruparon hace poco por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo. Todas tienen diversos negocios como la costura de faldas, venta de ropa de muñecas, venta de frutas, producción de archivadores, venta de plásticos y venta de comida. Una de las integrantes de este grupo es Jhenny Lizethe C., una joven de 20 años, ella se animó a formar parte del grupo a invitación de una amiga, Jhenny elabora ropa de muñecas de barby  hace 3 años, tuvo la iniciativa porque a su madre vende juguetes y muchas de las clientas le pedían ropa para las muñecas, entonces empezó a confeccionar. Con el préstamo piensa comprar tela y encajes.
texts.en:
The Nevados de Huayna Potosí group is comprised of seven women and one man. They attend meetings at the German Busch community center. The group formed recently from the necessity of accessing a loan. All of them need to increase their working capital. They all have different businesses like making skirts, selling doll clothes, selling fruit, making filing cabinets, selling plastics, and selling food. Jhenny Lizethe C. is one of the members of this group. She is 20, and she was motivated to join the group by an invitation of a friend. Jhenny has been making Barbie doll clothes for three years. She took the initiative because her mother sells toys, and lots of her customers asked her for doll clothes. So, she started to make them. She will use the loan to buy fabric and lace.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Flora Isabel

texts.es:
Flora Isabel M. es socia activa del Banco Comunal Avenida del  Ejército en la ciudad de Portoviejo, ella es oriunda del cantón Junín en la provincia de Manabí pero se radicó en esta ciudad,  está casada y tiene tres hijos,   ella junto al esposo tienen  una volqueta que la alquilan para hacer fletes de arena, ripio y piedras recorriendo varios lugares dentro y fuera de la provincia desde hace diez años.
 
Para ella lo más importante es que la familia esté unida,  y su sueño  es poder compararse otra volqueta para seguir trabajando e incrementar su negocio, por ahora no ha quedado mal con los pagos a la Fundación y espera poder seguir siempre así.

Con el  préstamo solicitado a  la Fundación va a  invertir en el mantenimiento de su volqueta, cambio de aceite y compra de  llantas.
texts.en:
Flora Isabel M. is an active member of the Avenida del Ejército Communal Bank in the city of Portoviejo. She is from the Junín canton in the Manabí province, but she settled in this city. She is married and has three children. She and her husband have a small truck, which they rent out to take loads of sand, stone chips, and rocks. They travel to various places in and out of the province, and they have been doing so for ten years. The most important thing to her is that the family is united. Her dream is to be able to buy another small truck to keep working and increasing her business. Up until now she has done well with the payments to the Foundation, and she expects to be able to always continue this way. She will use the loan she is asking the Foundation for to invest in maintenance on her truck, change the oil, and to buy tires.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on her truck, change the oil, and buy tires

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia de  27 años vive al lado de su esposo Amarildo de 29 años, con quien tiene 1 hijo Miguel de 4 años, además también vive con su otro hijo, Robert de 9 años,producto de su primer compromiso,juntos  habitan  una modesta casa propia.Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura , inicia sus labores desde tempranas horas de la mañana y se prolongan  hasta el anochecer ; los terrenos donde cultiva papa (tubérculo peruano), alverja, habas y flores de gladiolos, fueron heredados por sus padres para que los trabaje junto a su esposo y así puedan salir adelante, la  actividad que desempeña le resulta rentable y la anima a continuar trabajando con dedicación; como anhela una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos tiene pensado en el futuro comprar un auto  para trasladar las flores de gladiolos ,desde la zona donde vive  hasta algún  mercado de flores en la capital ,también desea sembrar en mayor cantidad sus demás productos.Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y dice que pagará puntualmente porque desea progresar, además esta contenta de trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son puntuales y honestos como ella.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de alverja, 7 sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes con los que  cuidará adecuadamente sus sembríos en busca de una cosecha productiva.
texts.en:
Sonia is 27 years old and lives with her husband Amarildo, who is 29. They have a son, Miguel, who is 4 years old, and they also live with her other son from a previous relationship, Robert, who is 9. They all live together in their own modest home. For 5 years she has worked in agriculture. She starts work early in the morning and works until dusk. The land where she cultivates Peruvian potatoes, peas, beans and gladiolus flowers was inherited from her parents so that she could work with her husband and in this way manage to get ahead economically. This activity has been profitable, so she is motivated to keep working with dedication, as she desires a better quality of life for her children. In the future, she is thinking of buying an automobile to use in transporting the gladioli from the area where she lives to the flower market in the capital. In addition, she would like to plant an increased quantity of the rest of her products. This is her 4th loan from MFP, and she says that she will make her payments on time because she wants to get ahead. In addition, she is very content working with the members of her communal bank, who are punctual and honest like she is. She will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of 2 bags of pea seeds and 7 sacks of organic and chemical fertilizers, which will allow her to care for her plantings so that she can have a productive harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pea seeds, and organic and chemical fertilizers for her fields

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Maria de la Concepcion F. G. tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el reparto Juan Ramos Padilla es casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, ellos tienen 3 hijos entre las edades de 33, 30 y 15 años de edad los mayores son independientes y la menor actualmente estudia la escuela secundaria, el mayor logro que la familia visualiza seria el poder brindarle a su hija los recursos necesarios para que ella estudie su carrera profesional, la señora F. labora como conserge desde hace 3 años pero por sus bajos inrgesos se les ha dificultado la idea de poder reconstruir su vivienda con este prestamo tiene planeado comprar materiales de construccion con el fin de comenzar la primera etapa de reconstruccion del hogar, esto les daria mejores comodidades para su familia y podrian ofrecerle a su hija un espacio mejor que le procure mas seguridad, armonía y comodidad.
texts.en:
Señora Maria de la Concepcion F. G. is 51 years of age. She lives in the Juan Ramos Padilla neighborhood. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. They have 3 children ages 33, 30 and 15 years. The oldest are independent and the youngest one at present is a student in secondary school. The major achievement that the family visualizes is to have the ability to give their daughter the necessary resources so that she can study her professional career. Señora F. has worked as a consierge for 3 years, but her low income has complicated their ability to reconstruct their home. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials in order to begin the first phase of reconstruccion of the home. This would provide better comfort for her family and she would be able to give her daughter a better place with more security, harmony and comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Frnacisco Benito

texts.es: Francisco Benito tiene 51 años de edad, este Señor se dedica a la actividad económica de elaboración de tornos, hace más de 28 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que cuando inicio fue muy difícil el no contaba con los ingresos necesarios además de esto tenia ciertas herramientas pero no eran suficientes para elaborar las piezas que le solicitaban, pero esto no esto no detuvo a Francisco pues el busco ayuda por medio de los financiamientos y han sido estos los que le han dado la ayuda necesaria. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materiales para realizar piezas. Su deseo es seguir con la actividad económica ya que de aquí depende su estabilidad.
texts.en:
Francisco Benito is 51-years-old. For the past 28 years he has been in business making parts with his lathe. It was very hard when he started out because he didn't have enough income, and while he did have some of the tools he needed, he didn't have enough to make the parts people were asking for. This didn't discourage Francisco, though, and he sought help through loans, which have given him just the help he needs. He is currently requesting a loan for working capital, so he can buy materials to make parts. His wish is to continue with his work because his stability depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John owns and operates a general store with his wife Martha out of an all-purpose structure immediately adjacent to his house.  This is John's first loan from Kiva field partner LEAP.  John plans to use the 67,000 Liberian dollar loan to buy inventory for his general store.  He says some of his best-selling items are candles and batteries -- there is no electric utility that serves his neighborhood -- and foodstuffs such as rice and cooking oil.

John and Martha live in a suburb of Liberia's capital, Monrovia, and have six sons.  During the Liberian civil war, John had to flee to neighboring Côte d'Ivoire and was separated from his family for several years.  John and Martha's oldest son is now 25, and the youngest is eight. The older boys have completed high school, and John expects that the younger ones will too.  If he is able to afford it, John would like to be able to send some of his boys to university one day.

John's store started small, as a stall out in front of his house on land he owns.  As his store was the only one of its kind in his neighborhood, his business prospered.  He decided to build a freestanding storefront a few years ago and now hopes to expand further by building a separate rice store, and a cement shop.

loans.use: To buy items for resale at his general store.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia de 38 años, es madre soltera y vive con  su hija María de 14 años, con quien habita  su vivienda propia.Desde hace 28 años, se dedica a  sembrar papa (tubérculo peruano), alverja y flores de gladiolos, también en su casa tiene  una pequeña tienda de comestibles; lo que más le gusta de su trabajo según manifiesta es recibir la recompensa de tantos días de sacrificio, pues Sonia se despierta desde  muy temprano para  atender su negocio , después se dirige a cuidar y limpiar sus sembríos hasta altas horas de la noche; para el  futuro planea sembrar en mayor cantidad, además de hacer crecer su tienda surtiéndola de productos de primera necesidad.Es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP, y su pequeño negocio es el resultado de  su responsabilidad, además le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal porque sus miembros son bastante activos.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero del préstamo en comprar bolsas de semilla de arveja, sacos de abono y botellas de insecticidas, también desea hacer alcanzar el dinero para invertirlo en mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 38 year old single mother. She lives with her 14 year old daughter, María, in her own house. She has been planting potatoes (a Peruvian tuber), peas, and gladiola flowers for 28 years. Also, she has a small food store in her house. What she likes best about her work is receiving the recompense for so many days of sacrifice. Sonia gets up very early to take care of her business. She later takes care of and cleans her fields until late in the evening.
