In the future she plans to plant in a larger quantity, and she will also make her store grow by stocking it with basic needs items. This is her sixth loan with MFP. Her small business is the result of her being responsible. Also, she likes to work with her communal ban because the members are very active. She plans to invest the money from the loan in buying bags of pea seeds, sacks of fertilizer, and bottles of insecticide. She also wishes to have enough money to buy merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
A business-minded woman, Emily L., 50 years old, is a mother of three children. She is also a woman of strong faith to overcome all challenges to achieve her dreams. She is married to Eusebio L., a company driver.  She lives in Tanay, in the province of Rizal, Philippines. 

With her faith to get out of poverty, in 1999 she decided to join ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), a microfinance institution and KIVA partner in the Philippines, for a chance to get start-up capital for generating income. During her previous loan with ASHI, she carefully invested in the sewing business. The profit is what she uses for daily expenses and for her children's education.

Now on her eighth loan, she proposes a loan of PHP 40,000.00 pesos for a broader business. Specifically, the amount will be use to purchase an overlock sewing machine (serger), a high-speed sewing machine, assorted cloth, threads and other supplies. She is very disciplined in using the money that was lent to her in her previous loans from ASHI. 

She still dreams of the best for her family:  to provide the best education for her children and to have a happy family. During almost 10 years in ASHI, Emily has shown herself to be hard working and strong-minded to make her dreams come true. She hopes that her business will expand so she can save for the future. Now, she is happy seeing that the loans from ASHI change their lives and accommodate their financial means needed to support her family. She wishes ASHI and all lenders all the best and want them to keep on supporting her family and other families who want to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a serger, a high-speed sewing machine, assorted cloth, thread and other supplies.

loans.name: Giachina

texts.es: Giachina tiene  28 años, y cuya familia esta conformada por su esposo y su hijo y juntos viven en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de animales en la principales ferias ganaderas, y más los fines de semana, en donde tiene más ventas. Además obtiene otros ingresos adicionales por parte de sus vecinos quienes le solicitan un animal en venta.  Paralelo a esta actividad, Giachina también se da tiempo a vender comida por las tardes, y mas cuando es temporada de celebración de la comunidad y ofrece a los turistas sus potajes. Es así que administra su tiempo para dedicarle a la ganadería, a su venta de comida y sin olvidar también su hogar. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es percibir los ingresos continuamente y eso le ayuda en el sostenimiento de su hogar. En el futuro tiene planeado comprar un terreno donde pueda poner a sus animales de venta, por le momento alberga su ganado en el establo de su de su madre. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, además esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su ser grupo comunal ya que todos son muy solidarios y cumplidos en las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicitó, lo invertirá en la compra de más animales como ovejas, cerdos y un toro pequeño.
texts.en:
Giachina is 28, and her family is made up of her husband and her son. They live together in a rented house. For 4 years she has been selling animals in the main livestock fairs, mostly in the weekends when she makes more sales. As well she earns other additional income on behalf of her neighbours who ask her to sell an animal. Alongside this activity, Giachina also spends time selling food in the afternoons, and more when it is the community's celebration season and she sells tourists her vegetable soups. So it is in this way that she arranges her time to focus on her livestock and her food sales without also forgetting her home. What she likes best about her work is to continually receive income and this helps her in running her household. In the future she has plans to buy land where she can put her animals for sale, at present she houses her livestock in her mother's barn. This is her third loan with MFP, what's more she is very happy to be a member of her communal group since everyone is very supportive and meets their payments. With the loan she is asking for, she will invest in the purchase of more animals like sheep, pigs and a young bull.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more sheep, pigs and a young bull.

loans.name: Qhantati Group

texts.es:
Martha Q. Integrante del grupo Qhantati que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Los Andes, se dedica a la producción de chajchas (pesuñas de animales secados y unidos por un cordel), ella trabaja con este negocio hace 30 años aproximadamente, vende sus productos  en la ciudad de La Paz y Cochabamba, con estos ingresos ha podido sacar adelante a sus  5 hijos, actualmente trabaja con ayuda de su nieto. Con el préstamo  comprará pesuñas viajando a diferentes pueblos.
Las demás integrantes del grupo también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de chamarras, tejido y trenzado de mantas, bordados de ropa, venta de fruta y otros.
texts.en:
Martha Q. is a member of the Qhantati group, which belongs to the Los Andes community center. She makes “chajchas” (ribbon to which there are tied several goat or pig hooves, and when shaken, the sound produced suggests that of wind and falling rain). She has been working in this business for approximately 30 years. She sells her products in the city of La Paz and Cochabamba. With these earnings she has been able to get her five children ahead. She currently works with help from her grandson. She will use the loan to travel to different pueblos to buy hooves. The other members of the group also have their own businesses like selling jackets, weaving, braiding blankets, selling embroidered clothes, and selling fruit and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es:
El banco comunal Loma de la Cruz esta formado por un grupo de mujeres que buscan un mejor futuro para sus familias, y con el trabajo diario lo están consiguiendo poco a poco sintiéndose orgullosas por sus logros, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta es una ciudad que guarda los encantos de su centro histórico y también su combinación de tres culturas ricas en simbolismos, tradición y arte: Cañari, Inca y Española.

La Srta. Ana P. es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por el sector de Miraflores, tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres ayudando un poco en los gastos de la casa, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Ana trabaja en un cyber café siendo su horario de  8 y 30 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. labora en este local 11 meses y le va bien, también labora en la venta de productos para el cuidado de la mujer como son los productos de Yanbal, retomando su negocio hace 3 meses ya que antes vendía los productos a sus amigas del colegio, nos comenta que le va bien por lo que sus clientas le pagan puntal, y también para este nuevo año se a propuesto la meta de retomar sus estudios, tiene se lleva bien con todas sus compañeras de la banca comunal, se encuentra 2 años realizando los prestamos en la fundación y le han ayudado para comprar los productos de Yanbal y para pagar los arriendos de su casa, y fue su mamá que le incentivo a que forme parte del bankito, con el nuevo préstamo que realiza lo va a invertir en la compra de productos Yanbal, como son perfumes, cadenas, maquillajes, etc., su meta es de llegar a ser doctora.
texts.en:
The Loma de Cruz communal bank is made up of a group women who seek a better future for their families. Through their daily work, they are reaching this goal and little by little feeling proud of their accomplishments. They live in the city of Cuenca which is a city noted for its charming historic downtown as well as its combination of three cultures rich in symbolism, tradition and art: Cañari, Inca and Spanish. Communal bank member Ana P., 20, lives in the Miraflores section of the city. She is single and lives with her parents, helping them meet household expenses; they do not own their home, they lease. Ana works in an Internet café from 8:30am until 7pm; she has worked there for 11 months and has done well. She also sells women's beauty products of the Yanbal brand. She began this work again 3 months ago; she had previously sold these products to her school friends. She tells us that she does well because her customers pay on time. Her goal for this new year is to start her studies again. She gets along well with all the other members of the communal bank. She has been managing her loans with the institution for 2 years now and they have helped her to buy Yanbal products and to help with the family rent payment. She was encouraged to join the communal bank by her mother. The new loan will be used to buy Yanbal products such as: perfumes, chains, make-up, etc. Her goal is to become a physician.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the same brand cosmetics like perfumes, make-up and costume jewelry

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder  de  26 años vive con sus padres, Leonardo de 66 y Epifanía de 54 años, juntos habitan una casa alquilada.Desde hace 4 años cultiva papa, alverja y flores de gladiolos de  diferentes colores, esta actividad le permite mantener los gastos de la casa, cubrir las necesidades de sus padres  y principalmente ahorrar, lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es cultivar y cosechar las flores de gladiolos con delicadeza, porque puede ver su intenso color ,además la comercialización le resulta bastante rentable porque durante las temporadas de cosecha sus ingresos económicos se duplican devolviéndole de alguna manera el esfuerzo que realizó; en el futuro quiere sembrar  en mayor cantidad todos los productos agrícolas que pueda, para seguir progresando.Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y esta contento de trabajar en su banco comunal porque los integrantes son responsables.Con el dinero del crédito comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, fertilizantes y bolsas de semilla de alverja, esperando obtener una cosecha productiva.
texts.en:
Wilder, age 26, lives with his parents, Leonardo, age 66, and Epifanía, 54. They live together in a rented house. For 4 years he has grown potatoes, peas, and gladiolas of different colors. This activity has allowed him to keep up with household expenses, cover the needs of his parents, and, most importantly, to save money. What he likes most about his work is the delicate cultivation and harvesting of gladiolas because he can see their intense color. In addition, the marketing of this product turns out to be rather profitable because during the harvest season his income doubles, giving him a return on the effort that he puts in.

In the future, he wants to plant a greater quantity of all the agricultural products he can in order to continue progressing. This is the fourth loan that he has had with MFP, and he is happy to work in his communal bank because the members are responsible. With the money from the loan he will buy several sacks of organic compost, fertilizer, and bags of pea seeds, hoping to obtain a productive harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy compost, fertilizers, and pea seeds

loans.name: Maria Felipina

texts.en:
Maria Felipina O. is a 39-year-old married woman from Jala-jala, Rizal. She and her husband are blessed to have five children. She is a member of the Sipsipin center in Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) Rizal East Branch. She is a very determined woman, and she notes that she works hard to better her life. Despite hardships brought about by poverty, Maria Felipina remains strong and dedicated in her pursuit to improve her family’s standard of living. The love and support of her husband makes her life quite meaningful.

To earn a living, she buys and sells rice. She has been engaged in this business for five years. She joined ASHI, a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 1999. During the course of her membership, she has been an excellent performer with respect to her attendance at meetings, loan repayment, and projects. She is now seeking her fifth loan, this time in the amount of 40,000 PHP ($875) to purchase additional sacks of rice. She is positive that, with access to additional working capital through ASHI and Kiva, her dreams of sending her children to a university so that they can complete their college degrees will be achieved. Her desire to give her children a brighter future is what drives her each day.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional rice

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: EL señora Javier Antonio C., tiene 41 años de edad, es soltero y habita en el barrio San Pedro, tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 8 años los dos actualmente estudian el señor C. trabaja arduamnete para poder ofrecerles a sus hijos la educacion, el señor es agricultor desde hace 6 años, el señor comenzo trabajando en este rubro gracias a la ayuda que su patrona le ofrecio él le cuida el cultivo y con su trabajo honrado y responsable se  ha ganado su confianza tanto asi que la señora le ofrecio unas tierras para que él las trabaje y se sustente, con el tiempo se ha visto con dificultades de plagas que amenazan con su cosecha, es por esta razon que solicita esta ayuda y con ella comprara fertilizates y fungicidas que le aseguren la produccion de limon, tiene pensado que esta inyeccion de capital a largo plazo le traera los recursos necesarios para comprar su propio terreno y poder birndarles la estabilidad necesaria a su familia.
texts.en:
Javier Antonio C. is 41 and single. He lives in the San Pedro neighborhood. He has two children, 15 and 8, who go to school. Mr. C. works arduously to be able to give his children an education. He has been a farmer for six years. He started working in this field thanks to help that his boss offered him. He takes care of the crops. Through his honorable and responsible work he has won her confidence. She offered him some land so that he could work it and support himself. With the passage of time he has seen some difficulties from plaques that threaten the harvest. That is the reason he is asking for help. With the loan he will buy fertilizers and fungicides that will assure the lemon production. He thinks that in the long run this injection of capital will bring the necessary resources to buy his own land. Then he will be able to provide his family with the necessary stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural materials

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia tiene 26 años, esposa y madre de una niña de 6 años, y juntos viven en casa de sus suegros. Desde hace 3 años y medio, le enseñaron el arte del bordado y del tejido artesanalmente, es entonces que produce bellos trabajos y por lo que tiene mucha demanda en temporadas festivas. Como las danzas típicas de su ciudad, en donde elabora hermosos vestimentas representativas de su ciudad. De esta manera su trabajo le genera ingresos económicos y eso le ayuda para aportar con los gatos de su hogar y pueda solventar la educación de su hija. Es por ello que Lilia trabaja de manera independiente, administrando su tiempo, por lo que ahora tiene la ilusión de producir en número sus fustanes bordados ya que se acerca la temporada festiva de navidad. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que esta muy contenta, además se le considera ser una compañera muy trabajadora y activa con su grupo comunal. Con el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de hilos, lana y telas para continuar elaborando sus tejidos y bordados.
texts.en:
Lilia is the 26 year old wife and mother of a six year old daughter. They live together in her mother and father in-laws’ house. Three and a half years ago, they taught her the art of embroidery and weaving by hand. She produces beautiful works, which are in great demand during seasonal festivities like her city’s typical dances. She makes lovely garments that represent her city. This way her work generates economic income, and this helps pay the household expenses and the educational expenses for her daughter. That is why Lilia works independently, managing her time. She is now excited to produce embroidered typical skirts because the Christmas season is getting close. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is very happy. She is considered to be a very hard-working and active colleague in her communal bank. She will use the loan she is asking for to buy thread, wool, and fabric to continue making her weavings and embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread, wool, and fabric to continue making her weavings and embroidery

loans.name: Rina Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Rina  S. forma parte del Banco Comunal Avenida del Ejercito en la ciudad de Portoviejo,  está casada tiene seis  hijos su esposo trabaja como chofer de un bus interprovincial y  ella desde hace diez  años se dedica a la venta de comida en su restaurant ubicado en el  terminal terrestre de la ciudad, sus actividades  inician a las 4 de la mañana ya que desde esa hora empieza a  atender en su negocio  y cierra a la 5 de la tarde todos los días,  además tiene unas cabinas telefónicas en otro local dentro del terminal.

Para Rina atender su negocio es muy importante porque le ayuda en su estado emocional, además  ella cuenta con la ayuda de una señora en el restaurant y un chico atiende en las cabinas,  gracias al trabajo de su esposo y el de ella han logrado  salir adelante y cumplir con los pagos a la Fundación. 

Con este nuevo préstamo ella comprará  productos como arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite, carne, pescado y más productos para preparar los alimentos en su restaurante y para comprar tarjetas de recargas electrónicas de sus cabinas.
texts.en:
Rina S. is part of the Avenida del Ejercito Communal Bank in the city of Portoviejo. She is married and has six children. Her husband works as a driver of an inter-provincial bus. For ten years she has been selling food in her restaurant, which is located in the city’s bus station. She starts her work at four in the morning, and she closes at five in the afternoon everyday. She also has some telephone booths at another location in the station. Tending her business is very important to Rina because it helps her emotional state. Also, she has the help of a woman in the restaurant, and a boy tends the telephone booths. Thanks to her work and her husband’s, they have been able to get ahead and make their payments to the Foundation. She will use this new loan to buy products like rice, sugar, salt, oil, meat, fish, and many other products to prepare the food in her restaurant. She will also buy calling cards for her phone booths.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, salt, oil, meat, and fish for her restaurant and calling cards for her phone booths

loans.name: La Camacha Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama LA CAMACHA   porque asi  se llama  la población donde viven.  Está ubicado en el municipio de Tlalixcoyan en el estado de Veracruz.  El grupo está conformado por   5  integrantes que se conocen desde hace tiempo pues viven en la misma comunidad.  Éste es su primer  préstamo con Fundación Realidad.

La representante del grupo se llama  Reynalda L. L.,  es soltera, tiene 50 años, estudió  la universidad, y tiene en total 5 hijos 3 mujeres y 2 varones.  Ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdas para la cría y alimento para mantenerlos. Ella tiene sus cerdos en el patio de su solar.  Reynalda L. L.   desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, para así obtener una ganancia mayor y volver a invertir en mas cerdos.

Rusbelly L. L. también está en el grupo LA CAMACHA  Ella tiene 39 , estudió hasta la universidad , y tiene en total 2  hijos 1mujer y 1 varon.  Ella  se dedica a la cría de cerdos y necesita el préstamo para comprar alimento para  mantener sus cerdos .  Rusbelly mantiene sus cerdos en el patio del solar de su mama  con quien vive.
Rusbelly desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio,  para que con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar  un terreno para construir su casa ya que actualmente ella vive con su mama.

Los otros 3 integrantes se llaman Fabian H. L. , Hector  M. E. y Alejandrina E. Raygoza, y quieren préstamos para invertir en sus negocios como son, venta de abarrotes , y la cria y engorda de cerdos.
texts.en:
This group is called "La Camacha" because this is the name of the town where they live. It is located in the municipality of Tlalixcoyan in the state of Veracruz. This group is formed by 5 members who know each other since they have lived in the same community for a long time. This is their first loan with the Realidad Foundation. The representative of the group is named Reynalda L. L.. She is single, 50 years old, and studied at the university. She has a total of 5 children: 3 daughters and 2 sons. She raises pigs and needs the loan to buy pigs to raise and food to maintain them. She keeps her pigs in a yard on her property. Reynalda L. L. wants this loan to increase her business, in order to obtain higher earnings and be able to reinvest in more pigs. Rusbelly L. L. is also in the group La Camacha. She is 39, and studied until the university. She has 2 children: a son and a daughter. She raises pigs and needs a loan to buy food for her pigs. Rusbelly keeps her pigs in a yard on her mother's property where she lives. Rusbelly wants the loan to increase her business, so that with the earnings she can buy a plot of land where she can build her house, since she currently lives with her mother. The other 3 members of the group are named Fabian H. L. , Hector M. E. and Alejandrina E. Raygoza. They want loans to invest in their businesses: they sell groceries and breed and raise pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento LAS EMPRENDEDORAS viene trabajando con nuestra Institución hace 2 años, la principal caracteristica D. este banco es que con el tiempo a llegado a consolidase como grupo, creando lazos D. amistad.

La Sra Olga tiene a su cargo la presidencia, ella se dedica a la venta D. diferentes productos en un lugar muy centrico D. la ciudad, con el prestamo a comprado juguetes,agendas y ropa, diversificando sus productos y mejorando así sus ingresos.

La Sra. Beatriz iene a su cargo la secretaria, tiene una familia númerosa y se dedica a la elaboración D. masitas y pan, con el prestamo a comprado por cantidad harina, azúcar, logrando D. esta forma que la alza D. precios en estos productos no le afecte en sus ingresos.

La sra. FABIANA ocupa el cargo D. secretaria, tiene un kiosko en el aeropuerto y con el prestamo a logrado comprar diferentes golosinas para diversificar sus productos y contar con mejores ingresos y D. esta manera mejorar su calidad D. vida D. ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The Las Emprededoras Communal Bank has been working with our Institution for two years. The main characteristic of this bank is that in time they became strong as a group and created ties of friendship. Olga is the president. She sells different products in her place in the center of the city. With the loan she bought toys, agendas, and clothes. This diversified her products and improved her earnings. Fabiana is the secretary. She has a kiosk at the airport. With the loan she bought different sweets to diversify her products and get better earnings. This way she improved the quality of her life and that of her family’s.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Edison Juan

texts.es:
Edison V. de 34 años, su casa esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil es de cemento tiene solo agua como servicio básico, su esposa es ama de casa con ella tiene 2 hijos uno de 14 años y de 8 años ambos estudian en  establecimientos particulares cercanos a su domicilio.

Edison empezó desde los 18 años trabajando en una empresa de costura poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo salir de la empresa con los conocimientos adquiridos y se independizo ya hace 8 años. Ahora el trabaja sin horario fijo por lo que labora en su domicilio en conjunto con su esposa haciendo bolsos, maletas, carteras. Una de las mayores complicaciones es trasladar los pedidos sin vehiculo propio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar lonas, forros, cierres para agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar otra maquina de coser y comprar un vehiculo para poder trasportar la mercadería.
texts.en:
Edison V., 34, lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil. His house is cement and only has running water as a basic service. His wife is a housewife and they have two children, a 14-year-old and an 8-year old; both are enrolled in private schools near their home. Eighteen years ago Edison began working for a sewing company and, little by little, he was able to leave the company 8 years ago with knowledge and skills that allowed him to become independent . Now, he works with a set schedule, from home with his wife, making purses, luggage and wallets. One of his greatest obstacles is not having his own vehicle to transport his orders. He will use the funding to buy canvas, lining material and clasps in order to increase his business. In the future, he would like to buy an additional sewing machine and a vehicle to transport his goods.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Canvas, Lining, Clasps.

loans.name: Rosa Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Rosa V.  es socia del  Banco Comunal Avenida del Ejercito en la ciudad de Portoviejo desde hace ocho ciclos, ella es  madre soltera de cuatro hijos que ya son casados e independientes,  a sus 50 años Rosa  se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, su  negocio lo tiene en su propia casa  aquí ofrece  carne, alitas de pollo asadas, sanduches y colas, este negocio lo inició hace cuatro años,  pero también vende  confites en una escuela cerca de  su casa durante la mañana y por las tardes se dedica a su negocio de comida rápida.

 Rosa es independiente puesto que sola se encarga de su negocio, a pesar de su edad ella tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y  su mayor sueño es mantener una  buena salud para seguir adelante,  nos comenta que su negocio  se mantiene estable gracias  a los créditos recibidos de  la fundación y  con este nuevo préstamo surtirá sus negocios con  pan,  colas, confites y carnes para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que ella invierte  diario 20 dólares o más.
texts.en:
Rosa V., 50, has been a member of the Avenida del Ejercito communal bank in Portoviejo for 8 cycles now. She is a single mother of four children, all of whom are married and independent. She sells fast food from her home. She offers meat, broiled chicken wings, sandwiches and colas. She began this work four years ago but she also sells sweets at a school near her home during the mornings and in the afternoons she tends to her fast food business. Rosa is independent in that she alone tends to her business. Despite her age, she is eager to continue working and her greatest wish is to maintain good health so that she can carry on. She comments that her business has persevered thanks to the loans she has received from the Foundation. This new loan will be used to stock her business with such items as: bread, colas, sweets and meats so as to provide better customer service; she invests 20 or more dollars into her business daily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, colas, sweets and meats to stock her store.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.en: Ms. Fatou N. participates in the weekly markets around Bambey, a town about 100 km from Dakar. UIMCEC opened a branch in the area in July, 2009 to better serve its rural clients. She sells mainly cereals, such as couscous, though over the past twenty years she has sold a variety of different products. She says that she relies on her small business to meet her family's needs, especially since her husband has passed away. She hopes to diversify into other products once again so as to increase her income. This is the first loan for Ms. N. and it will allow her to replenish her stock of cereals.

loans.use: To replenish her stock of cereals.

loans.name: Arcelia Ysallana

texts.es: Arcelia tiene 36 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general.  Este negocio surge como una alternativa de ingreso para su familia  ya que tenían que mantener a su familia tambien se dedica a la elaboracion de reposteria. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, Su esposo la apoya en lo que puede para mantener este negocio activo. En sus desafíos se encuentra la competencia ya que muchas veces es muy difícil porque no tiene el capital suficiente para cubrir todo lo que sus clientes le solicitan. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo como ropa, perfumes, colonias, cremas entre otras cosas. El sueño de ella es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Arcelia, 36, has two children under her care. She sells general merchandise. This commercial activity is in addition to their main work, which is pastry making. She needed to increase her family's income so she started this new line of work 7 years ago. Her husband is as supportive as possible in helping her to keep this business going. One of her challenges is the amount of competition she must face. Sometimes this is very difficult because she lacks sufficient capital to stock all the items her customers request. The funding will be used to buy clothing, perfumes, colognes, creams, etc. Her dream is that her children become professionals and that her business grows.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy tiene 24 años, y con ella viven su esposo y sus dos hijos, en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 2 años vende comida en una calle principal de su localidad, es así que todos los días se dedica a esta actividad, generando recursos a su familia recién formada. De esta manera su ritmo de vida es muy activa ya que empieza en la mañana preparando el almuerzo y además que cuida de sus hijos y por las tardes sale a vender lo que preparó y al termino del día a poner en orden y limpieza toda su vajilla. Lucy trabaja todos los días para lograr una meta que se ha propuesto, que es la de tener un restaurante donde pueda ofrecer variedad de platos típicos a sus fieles comensales. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos  y se compromete nuevamente a serlo. El crédito que solicita, será destinado en la compra de más ingredientes para preparar sus comidas, además de una carpa para brindarles comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucy, 24, lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. For the last 2 years she has sold prepared food on one of the main streets of her location. She works at this task daily generating income for her newly-formed family. Her pace of life is very active in that she begins early in the morning preparing lunch while caring for her children. In the afternoons, she goes out to sell what she has prepared. At the end of the day, she must clean and organize all of her cooking utensils. Lucy works every day to reach the goal she has set up for herself, which is to have a restaurant in which she can offer a variety of typical dishes to her regular customers. This is her third loan with MFP and she has been very punctual with repayments during all this time; she commits to be so again. The funds she requests will be used to buy more ingredients for meal preparation as well as for a tent to offer her customers added comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria sells various breads, sweet breads and regular bread. This business began as an idea in 2001 and today is now is a functioning business. Maria has had previous loans that initially helped her to establish her business and then to improve her bread project. She will use this loan to buy ingredients for her breads: flour, butter, oil, salt etc. Her dream is to continue growing her bakery. It is challenging when employees don’t show up and replacing them is difficult. Maria is not married and has two teenage daughters who are both in school.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her baking.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is divorced. She has a grown daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, where she sells clothing merchandise in one of the local marketplaces. Nina is an experienced entrepreneur. She has been in this business for 12 years. Lending assistance has benefited her business a lot. Currently, she has about 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly gross income amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas.  

Nina is seeking a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to increase the variety of assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her kiosk. She is hoping to continue developing her business to ensure a stable future for her family. Nina hopes her business keeps a stable standing so that she could continue supporting her daughter and a grandson, as well as her elderly father who is 90 and lives with her.

loans.use: To increase the variety of assorted merchandise

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is single. She runs a small business selling women’s clothing items in the central market of her hometown of Korolyovo. Tetyana doesn’t face fierce competition, which gives her business a chance to grow and flourish. She started this venture two years ago. Presently, Tetyana has 40,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Tetyana is seeking a 5,000 Grivnya loan to diversify her assorted merchandise. She always has high demand for this type of inventory. Tetyana is hoping to see her business expand and remain sustainable in the future.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Adita Alicia

texts.es:
Adita P. de 46 años, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos  esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo es taxista tiene 4 hijos de 28, 24, 20,17 años de edad. 

Adita comenzó entregando comida a domicilio y poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo incrementar el negocio poniéndolo en un local y convirtiéndolo en asadero de pollos. Ahora Adita empieza a  trabaja desde las 06h00 con su esposo y uno de sus hijos. Una de las dificultades que tiene  es la delincuencia varias veces le han querido robar en el local.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pollos y arroz para agrandar más el negocio. En el futuro quiere mejorar el negocio comprando mesas y silla de mejor calidad y agrandar mas la cocina.
texts.en:
Adita P., 46, lives in a cement house, that has all the basic services, in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her husband is a taxi driver and they have four children, who are 28, 24, 20, and 17-year-old, respectively. Adita began home delivery of prepared meals and, little by little, with effort and dedication, was able to enhance her business. She is now situated in a fixed site and has converted it into a roasted chicken establishment. Now, Adita starts her work day at 6am with her husband and one of her sons. One of the challenges she faces is the level of delinquency in the area; there have been several robbery attempts. She wants to use the funds to buy chickens and rice to enlarge her business. In the future, she would like to further enhance the business by buying tables and chairs in order to improve quality; she also wants to enlarge the kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, Chicken and Meats.

loans.name: Irineo

texts.es:
El Sr.  Irenio nació en Chuquisaca (Sucre capital de Bolivia) tiene su esposa la señora Maria  tienen 3 hijos y actualmente viven en la comunidad de Espejos a 4 Km. De El Torno viven aproximadamente 21 años en el lugar el solo mantiene el hogar.
El cliente trabaja de agricultor siembra arroz, maíz y yuca  tiene su propia camioneta donde su segunda actividad es el servicio de trasporte publico y con su camioneta lleva a vender sus productos en el mercado de la zona.
El señor esta agradecido con la institución por el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Irenio was born in Chuquisaca (Sucre capital of Bolivia). He has a wife, Maria, and three children. They currently live in the Espejos community at kilometer 4 of El Torno. They have lived there for approximately 21 years. He is the sole support of the household. He works as a farmer, and he plants rice, corn, and yucca. He has his own small truck, which he uses as a second job to provide public transportation. He uses his truck to take his products to the area market to sell. He is grateful to the institution for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Norma Argentina

texts.es: Her business began 34 years ago when Norma wanted to find a way to contribute to the household income when the father of her children left them. Norma sells a variety of merchandise, but principally cosmetics, on foot. Once a week she travels to Honduras to sell items like powdered milk, feminine products and other items on hand. Upon her return she brings the cosmetics that she sells. Norma has six children between the ages of 38 and 16, only the youngest is in her care. Norma is an excellent client of Fundación León 2000 with a very good credit history. Her dream is to be able to afford home improvements. She will use this loan to buy more inventory, mainly perfumes.

loans.use: She will use this loan to buy more inventory, mainly perfumes.

loans.name: Elizabeth Genoveva

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth  tiene como actividad la venta de pollos broaster en su snack donde vende tambien almuerzos, hamburguesas y salchipapas, su snack esta ubicado en la zona de Miraflores, esta atividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su hija quien estudia y a la ves ayuda a su mamá, el destino del credito es para pagar un saldo que tiene de la compra de un vehiculo, que trabaja como radio taxi constituyendose en otro ingreso para su hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Elizabeth sells Broaster chicken at her stand, in which she also sells lunches, hamburgers, and "salchipapas." Her stand is located in the Miraflores district. This is the main source of income for her and her daughter, who both studies and helps her mother. This loan will be used to pay the balance on a vehicle, which she uses as a taxi for secondary income.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying off auto payment for use as taxi service

loans.name: Yolaina Isabel

texts.en: Yolaina is 27 years old. She has one child who is only 10 months old. For nine years, she has sold cosmetics. She learned the business from her mother and began selling through her mother’s business. Since beginning on her own, Yolaina now sells a variety of merchandise but does not have a fixed location. She does maintain a display of cosmetics in her house. Her goal is to one day have a store that sells all kinds of merchandise. Yolaina has a good credit history with Fundación León 2000, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. H.” y son 20 socios. Ellos viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Los socios se reúnen cada 30 días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa. El socio Eusebio es el presidente del banco comunal y da unos saludos por navidad y año nuevo a sus compañeros y a los inversionistas D. kiva.  

Algunos D. nuestros socios tienen unos pequeños negocios como por ejemplo: Yeni, Erika, Yanet, Magali, Giovanna, Sandro,  Edgard y Pilar trabajan haciendo fotocopias al frente D. la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco, Andrea y Yaneth tiene una carpintería, Wilbert es técnico electricista y también hace llamadas e impresiones,  Flora venD. cueros y Yeny es  guia D. turismo en el centro arqueológico D. Moray. 

Los socios requieren el préstamo para aumentar su capital D. negocio comprando más productos como papel, madera y muchas cosas más.  

Margarita es casada y tiene 44 años y venD. comida, su restaurante se llama “El burrito amigable”. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como carne, verduras, arroz, papas y muchas cosas más.
   
Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(En el video el presidente dice que son 21 socios pero una socia se retiro del banco comunal a ultima hora)
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Señor D. H. Communal Bank; there are 20 members. They live in the city of Cusco in the Cusco department. The members meet every 30 days in the Arariwa Association’s central office. Eusebio is the president of the communal bank, and he is giving Christmas and New Year’s greetings to his colleagues and the Kiva investors. Some of the members have small businesses. For example; Yeni, Erika, Yanet, Magali, Giovanna, Sandro, Edgard, and Pilar make photocopies in front of the San Antonio Abad National University of Cusco. Andrea and Yaneth have a carpentry shop. Wilbert is a technical engineer and also makes calls and recordings. Flora sells leather, and Yeny is a tour guiD. in the archeological center of Moray. The members need the loan to increase their business capital by purchasing more products like paper, wood, and many other things. Margarita is 44 and married. She sells food. “El Burrito Amigable” is the name of her restaurant. She has been in the business for ten years, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to buy more supplies like meat, vegetables, rice, potatoes, and many other things. The members appreciate and value the loan, and they promise to pay it on time. (In the video the president says there are 21 members, but one member withdrew from the bank at the last minute.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products like paper, wood, and many other items

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: LA SRA. SOFIA SE DEDICA LA ARTESANIA EN MACRAME DE CARTERAS, MANTAS Y OTROS PRODUCTOS LOS MISMOS QUE REPARTE  Y VENDE POR TODA LA ZONA SUD, LA ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZA LA AYUDA A PODER SOSTENER SU HOGAR COMFORMADO POR 2 HIJOS UNO DE ELLOS ESTUDIA EN COLEGIO Y EL OTRO EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, TAMBIEN SE PUDO VERIFCAR QUE LA CLIENTE VIVE MODESTAMENTE YA QUE NO TIENE MUCHOS MUEBLES Y ENSERES EN EL CUARTO DONDE VIVEN, EL ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA CARPINTERIA Y HACE TRABAJOS EVENTUALES QUE NO LE PERMITE SER DE MUCHA AYUDA EN LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR PERO JUNTOS TRATAN DE SACAR A LA FAMILIA ADELANTE CON MUCHO ESFUERZO. ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON LA INSTITUCION POR EL FINANCIAMIENTO
texts.en:
Ms. Sofia works by crafting macramé handbags, blankets, and other related products, selling and distributing them throughout the southern district. Her work helps her to maintain her home life, consisting of two children: one in school and the other in college. It's also confirmed that this client lives modestly, since her place doesn't have much furniture or other home articles. Her husband works in carpentry and does temporary work. This doesn't necessarily allow him to provide much help with family expenses, but together they are working hard to get ahead as a family. They are very thankful for the financing provided by this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing raw materials

loans.name: Pedro Emilio

texts.en:
Pedro’s business began when he needed to support his two young daughters and his mother and the salary from his job as a guard wasn’t enough to cover the household expenses. With the help of his mother and two daughters Pedro began a small business selling candies and later included soft drinks and other similar items.

Now that he has established a good client base, Pedro wants to invest more in his business. He has had five previous loans with Fundación León and he says that they have helped him greatly in establishing his business. He dreams of building his business into a small store that is able to generate enough income so that his daughters can study and become professionals.

loans.use: To use as working capital

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: La señora Nicolasa tiene puesto fijo, es una socia antigua con Emprender, este ultimo credito lo invirtio para la compta D. arbolitos D. pino para poder vender en las fiestas D. navidad. Mientras que en otras temporadas ella se dedica a vender frutas desD. hace ya bastante tiempo. La socia ya esta con Emprender 3 secuencias donD. ha demostrado ser una buena socia, muy responsable en sus pagos,  ella vive en casa D. sus padres, tiene  una hija, ella es separada del esposa, por lo tanto ella mantiene a su hija.
texts.en:
Nicolasa has a steady job and is a long-standing Emprender client. She used this last loan to buy Christmas trees to sell during the Christmas season. The rest of the time she is a fruit seller. She has been with Emprender for three cycles now and has proven to be a good member, very responsible with her repayments. She lives in her parents' home and is a single mother of one daughter, whom she supports.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Christmas trees.

loans.name: Mujeres De Debora Group

texts.en:
Marta is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres de Debora (Debora's Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a northern port town economically-reliant on tourism. In Puerto Plata, running water (which is not potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure, where she lives as a single mother with her three children.

Marta is excited to be seeking her second loan through Esperanza after having successfully repaid her prior loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business: she operates a "fantasia," which is a variety store with merchandise geared towards women. With the loan proceeds, she would like to purchase women's underwear as well as deodorants and personal hygiene products. She plans to use the profits generated from the loan proceeds to continue investing in her business. Ultimately, she would like to have her own location for her store (as opposed to renting space) and to finish constructing her home. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional merchandise (e.g., underwear, deodorants, and personal hygiene products)

loans.name: Rosalina Elizabeth

texts.es: La joven Rosalina tiene 24 años de edad, es muy esforzada y trabajadora, vive junto con sus padres en un barrio Villa Reconciliación, desde más joven trabajaba para poder pagar sus gastos, y ayudar a sus padres, su trabajo anterior era de afanadora y con su liquidación pudo comprar ropa, zapatos, prendas y poder ganarse el sustento de cada día, no ha logrado seguir estudiando por que no ha tenido los ingresos necesarios pero sus planes es poder ingresar a la universidad como muchas jóvenes para alcanzar un sueño como un mejor nivel de vivir. Ha logrado captar cliente el cual vende al contado y da crédito a la quincena para poder aumentar las ventas accedió a hacer préstamo en Afodenic el cual logro aumentar sus ventas por eso con esta temporada de fin de año quiere comprar prendas de vestir para dama, caballero, niños, ropa interior, medias y otros productos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes lo cual espera lograr aumentar sus utilidades. Contenta y da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible el financiamiento al pequeño comerciante.
texts.en:
Young Rosalina is 24 years old. She is very strong and hardworking. She lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood with her parents. Since she was young she has worked to help pay her expenses and help her parents. Her previous work was as a cleaning person gave her the ability to buy clothes, shoes, other garments and the ability to cover her daily food. She has not been able to afford to study but she hopes to enter the university like many other young people and achieve the dream of improving her life. She has succeeded in gaining clients who pay with cash and she offers bi-weekly credit so she increase her sales. She decided to take a loan with Afrodenic so she can succeed in raising her sales since during the end of the year she wants to buy garmets for women, men and children as well as under garments, stockings and other products to offer to her clients who want to improve their own profits. She is content and gives thanks to Afrodenic for making the financing for her small business possible.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of mens, women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco tiene 25 años, y con él viven su esposa y su hija de apenas un año. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la música costumbrista, por lo que cada fiesta patronal o evento social que se presente toca su saxofón, que es su instrumento preferido. De esta manera Marco trabaja en una banda, por lo que le exige estar en constante viajes a los  distintos  lugares  de su localidad. Lo que más anhela es ser un importante músico reconocido, y para ello debe luchar día a día hasta conseguirlo, aunque a veces no hay continuos eventos sociales y para cubrir sus necesidades se dedica a vender artículos diversos de acuerdo a la temporada de manera ambulante. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, además fue invitado a formar parte de su grupo comunal por lo que esta muy contento. Con el crédito que solicitó lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su instrumento, así como también comprará mercadería en adornos para la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Marco, 25, lives with his wife and one-year-old daughter. For the last 6 years he has been a folk musician. At every patron saint day fiesta or social event that comes up, he plays his saxophone, which is his favorite instrument. Marco is in a band so he is constantly traveling to various places in his area. What he most wishes for is to become a well-known musician. To reach that goal, however, he must struggle daily, even though sometimes there aren't continuous social events at which to play. Therefore, he must find ways to complement his income in order to meet basic needs, so he peddles various seasonal articles. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to be punctual with his repayments; besides, he was invited to join his communal group for which he is very happy. The funds requested will be used to service his musical instrument as well as to buy Christmas decorations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To service his saxophone and to buy Christmas decorations to sell.

loans.name: Alba Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Alba del Carmen S. R., tiene 53 años de edad, radica en el Barrio Medardo Andino un barrio en donde sus habitantes son personas de escazos recursos que luchan dia a dia por un futuro mejor y trabajan bajo la marginacion de las sociedades mas adineradas, la señora alba es casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer ayudandole con los gastos del hogar, juntos tiene tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes, ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de frutas y tienen planes a futuro de poner una venta de comida, dentro de las principales prioridades de la familia, esta al restaurar el baño principal de su vivienda, debido a que en la actualidad no les brinda una higiene optima para los que habitan en la casa, ellos son una familia responsable con los creditos y que con este credito se le apoyara de manera social a comprar materiales de construccion para la elaboracion de una pila septica que le de un mejor aseo y les garantice la salud de todos los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Alba del Carmen S. R., 53, lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood, whose residents are low-income and daily struggle to achieve a better future. They are looked down upon by the more well-to-do segments of society. Alba is married; her husband works as a driver and helps out with household expenses. They have 3 adult, independent, children. For the past 5 years she has been a fruit merchant and they would like, in the future, to sell prepared food. One of the family's main priorities is to restore the house's main bathroom because, currently, it does not provide optimal hygiene for those who live in the house. They are a responsible family with regard to loan repayments and this funding will be used to provide social support by purchasing building supplies for a septic tank, which will provide better cleanliness and guarantee the health of all the family members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials for a septic tank.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: El señor Feliciano R. Pérez es casado con la señora Amada Aguilera y son un matrimonio muy sólido y responsable, anteriormente solicitaron un crédito para la inversión en la compra de mercancía para su negocio, donde elaboran y venden pan de dulce, ya que tiene un historial crediticio excelente están tramitando nuevamente para la inversión en la compra de materia prima tales como harina, azúcar, entre otros. Ya que en esta temporada es muy buena para la venta, porque todas las familias desean saborear de un delicioso pan de dulce suavecito y recién horneado.
texts.en:
Feliciano R. Pérez is married to Amada Aguilera. They form a solid and responsible marriage. A previous loan that they used to buy merchandise for their business, which is a bakery-they produce sweet bread, provided them with an excellent credit history. This new funding will be used to buy basic ingredients, like flour and sugar, among others, since this is a high-sales season because all the families want to enjoy delicious, sweet, freshly-baked bread.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread baking ingredients.

loans.name: Rita Mercedes

texts.es: La Señora Rita tiene la edad de 44 años. Anteriormente ya había realizado financiamientos por lo que le han sido de muy buena ayuda. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, por los que luchar diariamente. La actividad económica de ella es la venta de ropa ambulante. Ella comenzó este negocio en compañía de su Mama,  hace 7 años ya que desde muy joven  aprendió este negocio y decide seguir adelante con la actividad. Por lo que ahora solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas y camisolas. Por lo que necesita diversificar sus productos para que sus clientes tengan mayores oportunidades de comprarle su mercadería. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio de tal forma que le permita mejorar la situación económica de su familia y brindarles a sus hijos la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Rita, 44, has three children under her care so she must struggle daily for them. She peddles clothing. She began this commercial activity with her mother 7 years ago. She learned this work from a very young age and decided to continue with it. She has had previous financing which has been of great help to her. She is now asking for funds to buy shirts, pants, skirts, sport shirts in order to diversify her inventory. Her greatest wish is to enlarge her business so that she can improve her family's economic situation and provide her children with the best education possible.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: La señora Adriana es casada con el señor Javier Ramírez quien labora para una agencia aduanal. Ellos anteriormente tenían un crédito con nosotros el cual ya quedo liquidado y presentaron siempre una gran puntualidad en sus pagos, su crédito fue para la colocación del vitropiso de su recamara proyecto que ya quedo realizado, pero les falto material para la terminación de la colocación en el resto de la casa y es por ello que están tramitando este nuevo crédito. Y así dar por concluido este objetivo.
texts.en:
Adriana is married to Javier Ramírez, who is employed at a customs broker. They have had a previous loan with us which has been repaid in full; they were always very punctual with their repayments. The loan was to install tile flooring in their bedroom; this project is complete. Now, they need to tile the rest of the house and this is the purpose of this new financing. Thus, this goal will be met.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring in her home.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El señor Ramiro Rodríguez es casado con la señora Ma. D. los Ángeles Castillo anteriormente solicitaron un crédito para la terminación D. un proyecto que tenia. Crédito que fue pagado siempre con puntualidad y están tramitando nuevamente nuestro apoyo para techar el frente D. su vivienda y así darle una mejor vista y mas protección al hogar. El labora para una empresa constructora como albañil donD. tiene 6 años D. antigüedad son una familia muy unida ya que cuentan también con el apoyo D. su hijo quien labora en una empresa D. colocación D. vidrios y ventanas.
texts.en:
Ramiro Rodríguez is married to Maria D. los Ángeles Castillo. They had a previous loan to finish a project they had. This loan was repaid on time. They are negotiating a new loan to install a roof on the front of their home so that it will be more attractive as well as proviD. better protection for the home. He has worked as a laborer for a construction company for six years. They are a very unified family which also counts on the support from a son who works for a glass and window installing company.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a roof on the front of the house.

loans.name: Confianza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Confianza está integrado por Bertha Adelina U. M., Miriam del Rosario S.  e Ivania del Carmen U. quienes trabajan arduamente para que su negocio crezca.

Bertha Adelina U. M. en 1991 empezó a vender carne de res y pollo en pequeñas cantidades actualmente tiene una carnicería amplia. Mientras  Miriam del Rosario S.  desde hace 8 años tiene un pequeño cafetín e Ivania del Carmen U. vende verduras.
texts.en:
The Confianza ("Confidence") Group consists of Bertha Adelina U. M., Miriam del Rosario S. and Ivania del Carmen U., who work arduously so their businesses can grow. Bertha started selling beef and chicken in small quantities back in 1991 and currently has a large butcher shop. Miriam has had a small cafe for the past eight years, and Ivania sells vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat and other supplies

loans.name: Teresa Lucinda

texts.es:
El  Banco Comunal Jardín de la Artesanía se formo en  Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, aquí la mayor parte de su gente se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías.

Teresa esta casada desde hace veinte y cinco  años tiene tres hijos, es oriunda del cantón Santa Ana, se caso y se radicó en Montecristi,  ella junto a su familia tienen un  taller de cerrajería desde hace quince años  ubicado en su propia casa, aquí  se dedican a pintar muebles, ventanas, puertas y  todo lo relacionado con la soldadura,  el hijo se encarga de  entregar a sus clientes el  trabajo terminado.

 Con el nuevo préstamo que la Fundación le entregue  lo invertirán en comprar más materiales como pintura, hierro, suelda  y todo lo necesario para terminar los pedidos pendientes,  el material  lo compran a los distribuidores en Manta y lo hacen  todas las semanas porque es bastante la demanda que tienen.
texts.en:
The Jardín de la Artesanía ("Garden of Craftwork") community bank was formed in Montecristi, province of Manabí, where the majority of the people make a living in arts and crafts. Teresa has been married for 25 years and has three children. She is a native of the Santa Ana region, but settled in Montecristi following her marriage. She and her family have run a blacksmith workshop for the past 15 years out of their own home, where they make a living painting furniture, windows, doors and everything related to welding. Her son is in charge of delivering the finished products to the customers. With the new loan, she plans to invest in the purchase of materials such as paint, iron, welding supplies and other items necessary to completing pending orders. She buys the material from distributors in Manta, and makes purchases every week because of the demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paint, iron, welding supplies, etc.

loans.name: Salvador Group

texts.es:
El banco D. Emprendimiento "SALVADOR " es un grupo  que se encuentra en su tercer  ciclo, demostraron ser  personas responsables, puntuales  y trabajadoras, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias: Como Presidenta esta la Sra. Sonia quien es la lider y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. masitas ambulando por las calles D. la ciudad, Es casada  y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo la abandono pero ella es muy trabajadora y mantiene el hogar sola. 

Como Tesorera esta la socia Bezaida quien es soltera, tiene su Farmacia, es una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas.

La Sra. secretaria es la socia Noemi quien es soltera y no  tiene  hijos tiene su Farmacia, es una persona joven  activa, responsable y respetada por sus compañeras
texts.en:
The "SALVADOR" communal bank is a group that is currently in its third cycle. They have shown themselves to be responsible, punctual and hard-working people. The group is led by the following members: Sonia, president and group founder; she peddles masitas (little cookies) throughout the city. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband left her but she is very hard-working and supports her family alone. Bezaida is treasurer. She is single and has a pharmacy. She is a very responsible person and very punctual with her repayments. Noemi is secretary. She is single, childless, and has a pharmacy. She is young, active, responsible, and respected by her fellow group members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel C. G. tiene una pequeña panadería casera que con el tiempo la ha ido mejorando. Ella asegura que es conocida en el barrio que a temprana horas como abejas traídas a la miel así el aroma a pan recién salido del horno atrae a sus clientes que a primeras horas esperan desayunar un café  acompañado de pan.

Además ella también alquila cuartos los cuales a condicionado para prestar una mejor estadía a sus inquilinos.
texts.en:
María Isabel C. G. has a small household bakery that has been improving with time. She assures that she is well known in her neighborhood, which flocks to her like bees to honey during the early hours of the day from the aroma of her freshly baked bread, which her customers enjoy with their morning coffee. On top of this, she also rents out rooms, which have been set up to provide comfort to her tenants.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcahse flour, eggs, milk, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: El señor Isaac actualmente tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Tiene  37 años el negocio del señor Isaac es una pulpería donde vende arroz, frijoles, azúcar y otros productos para el consumo del hogar  el comenzó con un financiamiento que adquirió en una  institución y compro una parte de mercadería dando apertura de esa manera,  ya que el comercio es mucho mayor  sus ganancias incrementaron muchísimo. Y con la ganancia logro comprar más mercadería  para vender, entonces ya cuenta con un buen inventario y su negocio se ha incrementado. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos que es lo que sus clientes más solicitan. El sueño de ella es obtener una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Isaac is 37 years old and has a son under his care. He owns a convenience store where he sells rice, beans, sugar and other household products. He started with a loan from an institution and purchased some supplies to open his store. Since then his commerce has increased and his profits have greatly improved. With his earnings he has been able to purchase more products to sell, so he has a good inventory and his business has improved. He plans to use the loan he is currently requesting to purchase basic grains, which is in high demand from his customers. His dream is to obtain financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains and other supplies for his store

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.es: El señor Bismarck B. A., tiene 30 años de edad, vive en la comarca de San Ignacio un lugar humilde que no le brinda el ambiente adecuado a sus habitantes, el es soltero y se dedica al cultivo de la Pithaya (fruta que se cultiva en las temporadas de verano), desde hace 18 años se dedica a esta actividad, uno de los probelmas que le ha afectado a su cosecha han sido las emisiones de gases del volcan, por tal razon la produccion se encuentra en un estado critico y solicita este prestamo para la compra de materiales agricolas que salvaguarden la calidad de la fruta, con este prestamo Bismark solventara las exigencias del mercado con respecto a las normas nutricionales dandole la oportunidad de vender la produccion a un mejor precio y recuperar de esta forma la invercion.
texts.en:
Bismarck B. A. is 30 years old and lives in the San Ignacio region, a humble place whose environment is not kind to its inhabitants. He is single and has made a living cultivating Pithaya (a regional fruit that is cultivated in the summertime) for the past 18 years. A problem that has affected his harvest has been the emission of volcanic gases, which has put his production at a critical state. He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural materials that can safeguard the quality of the fruit. With this loan Bismark address market requirements on nutritional standards, giving him the opportunity to sell his product at a higher price and thus recover this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural materials

loans.name: Elessandra

texts.en: Originally from Brazil, Elessandra and her husband run a successful construction and roofing business. Having previously owned businesses in their home country of Brazil, Elessandra heard that roofing makes good money so she thought she would give it a try. Like many startup businesses, Elessandra’s encountered some challenges in terms of changes to her business. However after establishing a solid base of clients in the Brazilian community, business began to take off. With her loan from ACCION USA, Elessandra hopes to proviD. a cash cushion for her business. She believes that her employees are top priority. With work being slower in the winter months and some clients taking a bit longer to pay, this loan will give her the ability to keep the business running smoothly. In the future, Elessandra hopes to continue to run a successful, profitable business here in the USA just like the businesses she and her husband started in Brazil before moving here eight years ago. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and proviD. employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy roofing inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 23 años, es madre de dos hijas, ambas menores de edad.  Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, además se dedica a la venta de chupetes (helados de hielo), gelatina y hielo, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja para una empresa de seguridad. Flor forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Flores”, desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en su negocio de venta de perfumes.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 800 soles, que invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza para ser vendidos entre sus vecinos y amistades. La meta de Flor es tener un Minimarket.
texts.en:
Flor, 23, is a very dynamic woman. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She has two, minor daughters. She sells beauty products. In addition, she also sells chupetes (popsicles), gelatin snacks, and ice from her home. Her husband, who works for a security agency, supports her activities. Flor has been a member of the "Las Flores" communal bank for a year. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used in her perfume sales business. Now, she needs 800 soles to buy beauty products that will be sold among her neighbors and acquaintances. Flor's ultimate goal is to have a Minimart.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina tiene 27 años, y cuya familia esta constituida por su esposo e hijos y juntos viven en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 9 años que se dedica al cultivo de papa, actividad que labora en las tierra de su padre, y de la producción que obtiene lo lleva a vender en las principales ferias de su localidad, ofreciéndolo de manera ambulante. Sus ingresos aumentan cuando vende los fines de semana, ya que el resto de días se dedica a su pequeño hijo, por lo que sus padres y hermanas la ayudan en tal labor. Hasta el momento su trabajo le ha sido rentable, por lo que esta planeando en el futuro producir más cantidad de papas para vender al por mayor. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y esta  muy entusiasmada de continuar adelante con su  trabajo, además que esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su grupo comunal. Con el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su siguiente cultivo.
texts.en:
Rosalina, 27, lives with her husband and children in a leased home. For the last 9 years she has farmed potatoes, an activity she does on her father's land. She travels to sell her crops in the main markets in her area. Her income increases when she sells on the weekend because the rest of the week she takes care of her small son; he parents and sisters help her with her work. To date, her work has been profitable so she is planning to increase potato production in the future so as to sell at wholesale. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she is enthusiastic about continuing with her work. Besides, she is very happy to be a member of her communal bank. The funds requested will be used to buy sacks of natural fertilizer for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of natural fertilizer for her next crops.

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.en:
Rosa Luz is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank comprising of 23 members in Patria, a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest - 8 hours by rough road from Cusco.  Rosa Luz is a single mother of three children, who range in age from 10 to 23.  

Rosa Luz has a small neighborhood general goods store in Patria.  She travels to the city of Cusco every few weeks to buy merchandise.   Rosa Luz also has a plot of land where she plants yucca and rice, located about a two-hour walking distance from her home.   She raises some chickens and ducks in her backyard which she also sometimes sells to supplement her income.  Rosa Luz also makes a delicious chilled juice from the fruit of the maracuya (passion fruit) tree in her backyard which is very popular with locals during the hot afternoons.  

Rosa Luz is requesting a loan to restock her store and to help pay for day laborers who will assist her with the yucca harvest.  She appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To stock general goods store and hire help for yucca harvest

loans.name: Carmen Marina

texts.es:
Carmen P. es  nacida en Montecristi, ella  es casada y madre de  tres hijos su  esposo es artesano como la mayoría de su población mientras que  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa. Esta localidad es un sitio  que posee  muchos atractivos turísticos que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero, acota Carmen.

Nuestra socia lleva  varios años en  las ventas motivada por una amiga,  cada cierto tiempo viaja a Guayaquil  donde compra la mercadería para sus  clientes de  Montecristi y sus alrededores nos comenta que le va muy bien, ella se dedica al hogar en la mañana  y por las tardes recorre su comunidad  visitando a sus clientes,  su hija la acompaña cuando van a visitar a sus clientes en el campo y  salen en el auto  de un  hermano. 

Desde que Carmen formó parte del Banco comunal ha trabjado con  los créditos otorgados por la Fundación y con ellos ha ido incrementando su negocio, con  el nuevo préstamo ella comprará  pantalones y camisas para hombre,  pantalones, blusas, vestidos, interiores y más  ropa para damas.
texts.en:
Carmen P. was born in Montecristi, is married and a mother of three children. Her husband is an artist like the majority of her community, while Carmen has dedicated her career to selling clothing. Montecristi is a place that has many tourist attractions that attraction both local and international tourists. Carmen has been selling clothing for several years, motivated by a friend. Occasionally Carmen will travel to Guayaquil where she buys the merchandise for her clients in Montecristi and its suburbs. She tells us her business is doing well. She works in her home in the morning, and in the afternoons she travels throughout her community visiting with her clients. Her daughter accompanies her when she visits her clients in the countryside, and they travel in her brother's car. Since Carmen has joined the community bank, she has worked with the loans organized by the Foundation and with them, she has been able to grow her business. With the new loan she will buy man's pants and shirts, and women's pants, blouses, dresses, underwear and other garments.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men's pants and shirts, and women's pants, blouses, dresses and underwear

loans.name: Evila

texts.es:
Evila, es una mujer muy respetuosa, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 43 años, madre de 3 hijos, uno mayor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es trabajador independiente. Evila forma parte del Banco Comunal “Los Corazones”, desde hace ocho meses, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 500 soles, que invirtió en diversos productos para su bodega.
Ahora ella necesita 800 soles, que será invertido en bebidas gaseosas, agua mineral, néctar, refrescos y gelatina. También posee una copiadora que le genera otro ingreso diario. La meta de Evila es tener una fuente de soda y tener su bodega bien implementada.
texts.en:
Evila is a very respectable woman. She lives in the Manantay district in the Ucayali region. She is 43 years old and the mother of 3 children, one who is all grown up. She sells basic supplies from a small grocery store situated in her home. Her husband, who is an independent worker, helps her. For the past 8 months, Evila has been part of the communal bank “Los Corazones” (The Hearts). The first loan she received was for 500 Soles which she used to buy a variety of products for her store. She is now in need of 800 Soles to be used to buy carbonated beverages, mineral water, nectar, soft drinks and jello. She also has a photocopier that helps her generate additional daily income. Evila’s goal is to have a soda fountain and have her store well used.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carbonated beverages, mineral water, nectar, soft drinks and jello.

loans.name: Las 3 Barbie Group

texts.es:
El grupo las 3 Barbie está integrado por tres mujeres caritativas  que a pesar de sus precarias condiciones económicas ayudan en las obras caritativas de la iglesia. Ellas dicen que no pueden dar ayuda económica como las instituciones  pero con su gran voluntad trabajan gratuitamente para llevarles un bocado de comida a los más necesitados.

Ellas son Darling C. Gonzáles quien vende ropa y cosméticos, Miriam del Carmen P. M. tiene una pulpería y comercializa ropa y zapatos y Ana María P. vende ropa, zapatos y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The 3 Barbie group is made up of three charitable women who, despite their precarious economic situations, help in the charitable works of the church. They say that they cannot give economic help like the institutions, but with their strong will they work voluntarily to give food to those people in most need of help. The first of the women is Darling C. Gonzáles who sells clothing and cosmetics, the second is Miriam dl Carmen P. M. who has a grocery store and sells clothing and shoes, and the third is Ana María P. who sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Zila
