texts.es: Zila, es una mujer muy puntual en sus reuniones, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 35 años, es madre de dos hijos, ambos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la administración de su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a ser chofer de su propio motocarro. Zila forma parte del Banco comunal “Las Orquídeas”, desde hace seis años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en productos para su bodega, ahora ella necesita de un crédito de 3000 soles, que será invertido en la compra y venta de bebidas refrescantes y abarrotes en general. El anhelo de Zila es tener otro motocarro para darlo en alquiler y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Zila is a woman who is always on time for her meetings. She lives in the Manantay district in the Ucayali region. She is 35 years old and mother of 2 children, both grown up. She manages a small grocery store which is situated in her own home. Her husband, who is the driver of his own motocarro taxi, helps her. For the past six years, Zila has been part of the “Las Orquídeas” (Orchids) communal bank. The first loan she received was for 300 Soles which she used to buy products for her store. She is now in need of a 3000 Soles loan to be used in the buying and selling of refreshing drinks and groceries in general. Zila hopes one day to have another motocarro taxi which she will rent out and in this way increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be used in the buying and selling of refreshing drinks and groceries in general

loans.name: Julio

texts.en: Julio has owned a multi-service phone retail store for the last ten years. He believes that having his own business has helped him progress in life - there is so much that he learns from owning his own business that he applies to all aspects of his life. In addition to the success he feels from being able to provide for his family, Julio has felt a huge sense of success being able to provide a service to his community. The extra income that he earns also goes to support his aging parents back home in the Dominican Republic. With the loan from ACCION USA, Julio will use 75% to buy new cell phones and accessories and 25% on promotions. He will need the extra stock in inventory to support all of the clients that will be coming through his doors. Julio is very positive about his business and believes that this loan from ACCION USA will be a big help to his success. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy more cell phones and accessories, and to use for business promotion

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank comprised of 23 members in Patria, a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest - 8 hours by rough road from Cusco.  Elsa is married and a mother of seven children.  One of her sons is studying in Lima to become a police officer and is expected to graduate in June.

Elsa sells anticuchos (meat skewers – a popular evening snack in Peru) in the market in Patria. Her husband runs a meat distribution business.  With the loan she is requesting, Elsa will be able to buy an icebox so that she can buy meat at greater quantities and thereby lower her operating costs.  The icebox would also help her husband’s business.  She also plans to use some of the loan to help support her son until he graduates from the police academy.  

Elsa appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

Elsa is pictured with her granddaughter.

loans.use: Buy an icebox and support her son’s education

loans.name: Regina Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Regina tiene 44 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte. Ella dio inicio a este negocio  hace nueve años por lo que tenía un carro y quería aprovecharlo y empezó a realizar los trasmites para que brindara el servicio de taxi fue así que ella poco a poco fue comenzando con su pequeña actividad que le ha brindado lo necesario para proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día es por eso que todos los días lucha para obtener el pan de cada día. El deseo de Regina es brindarles la oportunidad a sus hijos de salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de llantas, forros para los asientos entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Regina is a 44-year-old single mother of two children. She makes a living providing taxi services, which she started nine years ago because she had a car and wanted to take advantage of it. She started out making taxi trips and little by little her activities granted her the necessary means to provide for her family. It's for this reason she works hard every day for her family's daily bread. Regina's wish is to provide her children with the opportunity to succeed. She plans to use the loan she's requesting for working capital to buy tires, seat covers, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires, seat covers, and other items.

loans.name: Katty Kerlith

texts.es:
Katty es una socia muy responsable, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 30 años, es madre de dos hijos, ambos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es trabajador independiente. Katty forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Flores”, desde hace un año, donde siempre se ha caracterizado por su respeto hacia las demás socias.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue utilizado para la implementación de su bodega.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 700 soles, que será invertido en la compra de panetones, leche azúcar y chocolate por fiestas navideñas. La meta de Katty es tener una tienda más grande y más implementada y dar una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Katty is a very responsible member. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the Ucayali region. She is 30 years old and mother of two children, both young. She sells basic supplies from her store which is located in her home. Her husband, who is an independent worker, helps her. For the past year, Katty has been part of the “Las Flores” (The Flowers) communal bank. She is always very respectful towards the other members. The first loan she received was for 300 Soles which she used to start up her store. She is now in need of a loan of 700 Soles to be used to buy “panetones” (cake with raisins and fruit), milk, sugar and chocolate for the Christmas festivities. Katty’s goal is to have a bigger, more established store and to give a better education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy “panetones” (cake with raisins and fruit), milk, sugar and chocolate

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
Emerita, es una mujer muy puntual y dinámica, vive en distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 43 años, madre de cuatro hijos, uno mayor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pasamanería, esta actividad la realiza en el mercado de la zona, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al oficio de estibador. Emerita forma parte del Banco Comunal “Los Corazones”, desde hace ocho meses, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 500 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de su puesto en el mercado Bellavista y su refacción.
Ahora ella necesita 800 soles, que será invertido en la compra de pasamanería. La meta de Emerita es comprar más artículos para vender y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Emerita, 43, is a very punctual and dynamic woman who lives in the Manantay district, Ucayali region. She is the mother of 4 children, one of whom is an adult. She sells various fringes and trims in the local market. Her husband, who is a stevedore, supports her work. Emerita has been a member of the "Los Corazones" communal bank for 8 months. Her first, 500 sol, loan was used to buy and refurbish her stall in the Bellavista market. Now, she needs 800 soles to buy trims. Emerita's goal is to buy more articles to sell and to enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy trim.

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.es:
Berlinda, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 40 años, es madre de cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la compra de palos de escoba para venderlos en la ciudad de Lima, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien le ayuda en la misma actividad. Berlinda forma parte del Banco Comunal “Damas del Oriente”, desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en su actual negocio.
Ahora ella necesita 1800 soles que será invertido en la compra de más palos de escoba para tornearlos y luego venderlos. La meta de Berlinda es tener una tienda de productos de limpieza.
texts.en:
Berlinda is a very dynamic woman. She lives in the Manantay district in the Ucayali region. She is 40 and has four children. Two are grown. She buys broomsticks and sells them in the city of Lima. She counts on help from her husband, who helps her in this activity. Berlinda has been part of the Damas del Oriente Communal Bank for three years. The first loan she received was for 300 PEN, and she invested it in her current business. She now needs 1,800 PEN to buy more broomsticks in order to turn them on the lathe and then sell them. Berlinda’s goal is to have a store of cleaning products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy broomsticks to turn on the lathe and then sell them in the city of Lima

loans.name: Bertha Janet

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Estrellas Solitarias” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, ambos menores de edad. Ella estudió superior (incompleta), se dedica a la compra y venta de carne.

Bertha nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar carne de cordero, alpaca, res y chancho.

Su sueño para el futuro es trabajar mejor y hacer crecer su negocio.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son reuniones con las socias con las que puede bromear y así puede distraerse.
texts.en:
Bertha, 28, has been a member of the "Las Estrellas Solitarias" communal bank for 3 years. She lives in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She lives with her life partner and has two, minor children. She did not finish college and she is a meat retailer. She tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her working capital. She now will ask for 3000 new soles to buy lamb, alpaca, beef, and pork. Her dream for the future is to work better and help her business grow. What she likes best about her communal bank is the get-togethers with her fellow members where she can joke around and entertain herself.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef, alpaca, lamb, and pork.

loans.name: Carmen Rosario

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Carmen es casada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Carmen junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, ladrillos que vende en el mismo lugar y también lleva a las obras.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en su casa que esta terminando de construir, comprara materiales para las instalaciones eléctricas.
Los sueños de Carmen son que sus últimos hijos sean profesionales y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Amor Divino (Divine Love) Community Bank. She is a 56-year-old married mother of six children. Along with her husband, Carmen makes a living making hand-made bricks in the community of Compañía. She sells the bricks in the same place and also takes them to work sites. Carmen is requesting a loan of 1200 soles, which she plans to invest in her home, which is concluding construction, by purchasing electrical installation equipment. Carmen's dreams are for her youngest children to be successful and to finish construction of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electirical installation equipment

loans.name: Sonia Del Pilar

texts.es:
Sonia, es una mujer honrada, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 52 años, es madre de dos hijos, uno mayor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y preparación de tortas, ambas actividades la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en una empresa petrolera. Sonia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en implementar su negocio con materiales de repostería.
Ahora ella necesita 2000 soles, que será invertido en implementar su negocio con más materiales de repostería ya que el negocio va bien y hay mayor demanda. La meta de Sonia es tener un taller de repostería y mejorar su negocio de restaurante.
texts.en:
Sonia, 52, is an honest woman who lives in the Callería district, Ucayali region. She has two children, one of whom is an adult. She sells prepared meals and makes tortas (a type of cake). She undertakes both activities from her home. Her husband works for an oil company and he supports her work efforts. Sonia has been a member of the “Las Orquídeas” communal bank for two years. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to get supplies for her pastries. She now needs 2000 soles that will be used to buy more materials for her pastries since the business is doing well and there is more demand for her products. Sonia's goal is to have a pastry shop and to improve her restaurant business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pastry supplies.

loans.name: Ilza Izabel

texts.en: Senora D. has a pulpería, a small general store based in her home. She sells commonly used items like rice, sugar, beans and a wide variety of other items. She has had this business for six years and now has established clients that she sells to, either accepting cash or occasionally extending credit to them. Senora D. has a very good credit history with Fundación León 2000 and plans to use this loan to buy more merchandise for resale. With the help of these loans, Senora D. says that her sales have increased and her family has seen an improvement in their income. She and her husband have a six-year-old who is in third grade. Ilza’s goal is to provide a better tomorrow for her family even in the face of the challenges of increasing prices and a poor economy.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Sixta Alejandrina

texts.es:
Sixta es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Sixta es casada, tiene 55 años y 3 hijos, Sixta se dedica a la elaboración de pasteles, actividad que realiza en un horno de leña y en los últimos meses elabora en menor cantidad y solo pedidos por que el humo esta dañando su salud, actualmente prepara gelatinas, flanes, sándwich, Sixta tiene proyectado comprar un horno a gas.
Sixta necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de insumos para preparar sus productos.
Los sueños de Sixta son construir su casa, comprar un horno y que su hija tenga una empresa.
texts.en:
Sixta is a member of the Amor Divino ("Divine Love") Community Bank. She is a married 55-year-old mother of three children. Sixta makes a living baking pastries, an activity she carries out with a firewood oven. In the past few months she has made a smaller quantity and only on orders because the smoke is harming her health. Currently she also prepares jellies, flans and sandwiches and is planning to purchase a gas oven. Sixta is requesting a loan of 3000 soles (approximately $1,050), which she plans to use to purchase ingredients to make her products. Sixta's dreams are to build a home, buy an oven and for her daughter to have a business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make her products

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es: El señor Jose F. A., tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y viven de manera independiente, el mayor logro del señor jose Felix seria el poder brindarle a sus hijos un hogar optimo donde pueda ubicarse  y que convivan como familia, el señor se dedica desde hace 30 años a la agricultura (cultivo d ela Pitahaya)uno de los principales problemas a los que se ha enfrentado, han sido las plagas y para esto, el señor F. solicitó un prestamo para darle a la cosecha un mantenimiento mas optimo invirtiendo el prestamo en la compra de fertilizante y fungizidas, esto le traeria mayores ingresos, pudiendo darle la posibilidad de visualizar a corto plazo la planificacion de la reconstruccion de su casa y asi dejarle a sus hijos su legado.
texts.en:
Jose F. A. is 54 years old, married and has four children, all who are fully grown and live on their own. Felix's greatest achievement would be to be able to provide his children with an optimal home they can move to and live together as a family. Jose has made a living for 30 years as a farmer (cultivating Pitahaya, a regional fruit). One of the main problems he has encountered has been plague, and because of this Jose is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and fungicides so he can give his crops optimal maintenance. This will bring in better profits, allowing the possibility of seeing his plans to renovate his house come to pass in short order, thus leaving his children his legacy.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and fungicides to provide his crops with better maintenance

loans.name: Juana Marina

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Juana es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Juana tiene una ferretería en su casa llamada Jesús Nazareno, también vende agregados como arena, ladrillos, sus ventas los realiza en su casa y también lleva a domicilio.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chapas.
Los sueños de Juana son ampliar su ferretería y distribuir por mayor, comprar carros para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Amor Divino ("Divine Love") Community Bank. She is a 45-year-old married mother of three children. She runs a hardware store out of her home called Jesús Nazareno (Jesus of Nazareth) and also sells accessories such as sand and bricks. She makes her sales out of her home and also takes her products to houses. Juana is requesting a loan of 900 soles, which she plans to use to purchase paneling. Juana's dreams are to expand her hardware store and distribute products wholesale, and to purchase cars to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase panneling

loans.name: Bernardina Delia

texts.es:
Bernardina es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Bernardina es casada, tiene 56 años y 3 hijos, Bernardina tiene una panadería en donde elabora panes típicos, el horno es rustico a leña, además tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y también tiene locutorios, actividades que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de sus hijos.
Bernardina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Bernardina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, seguir trabajando para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Bernardina, 56, is a member of the Amor Divino communal bank. She has three children. Bernardina has a bakery where she makes traditional breads; she uses a rustic, wood-burning oven. In addition, she has a grocery store in her home and public phone booths. Her children occasionally help her with her daily chores. She needs a 2000 sol loan to buy flour. Bernardina's dreams are that her children become professionals and to continue working to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour.

loans.name: Maria Lucila

texts.es: Maria began her business selling candy and other items from a cart, but then she and her husband switched to selling fruit which they primarily export to Honduras to supply merchants there. Maria and her husband have five children, only the youngest of the children is still in school. Maria says that her dream has always been to build her own house with the loans from Fundación León and to be able to serve her customers and improve the quality of her life. Maria says that she is grateful that Fundación León has never closed the door on her and has always served her well. With the help of these loans she has been able to grow her business. Maria says that she has always been a fighter because that is what her parents taught her. Maria says she has always lived in a humble house but her goals are to improve it and to be able to help her children.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: El señor Leonardo es un padre de familia muy dedicado y esforzado para poder lograr un techo digno para su familia. Vive en el barrio Jonathan  González de la capital de Managua, se desempeña como guarda deseguridad, para tener un ingreso fijo aunque bajo, sus intenciones ha sido cambiar de trabajo pero esta difícil, por que no hay empleo por la crisis económica, del país la sequía que hubo este año en el norte del país afecto. Gracias a los préstamo de Afodenic ha logrado hacer su casa de concreto y con el préstamo anterior compro parte de los materiales como zinc, perlines, golosos, arena y hierro el cual quería entechar y poner verjas pero no ajusto por falta de capital ya que los costos de los materiales estan alto y tampoco ajusto para la mano de obra es por eso que con este préstamo lograra comprar la soldadura, las verjas y cemento. Y tratar de terminar la obra para poder gozar de las mejoras. A futuro es poder poner un pequeño negocio y poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a dedicated and hard-working father who stives to provide his family with a proper home. He lives in Managua's Jonathan González neighborhood. He works as a security guard in order to have a secure source of income, although it is low. His intention has been to change jobs but this is very difficult because there are no jobs available in the country's current economic crisis; the drought that has affected the north part of the country this year has also had a negative effect on employment. Thanks to Afodenic's loans he has managed to build his concrete house and with the previous loan he bought zinc metal sheeting, edging, sand and iron. He also wanted to install a roof and wrought-iron grilles but he ran out of money because the prices of building materials have been rising; he also did not have enough to pay for labor costs. This new loan, then, will be used to buy solder, iron grilles and cement in order to try to finish the construction project and begin to enjoy the improvements. In the future, he would like to establish a small business and have better income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, wrought-iron grilles and solder to finish building his house.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
En el departamento de Managua, específicamente en el Mercado Mayoreo, la señora María Luisa F. se dedica arduamente a la actividad de elaboración y venta de alimentos siendo preparados por ella misma en su establecimiento donde atiende a sus clientes a diario buscando la manera de satisfacer sus necesidades.

La razón por la que ella solicita el crédito es porque requiere la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los deliciosos alimentos. Ella comprará carne de res, carne de pollo, arroz, frijoles, aceite, entre otros. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera continuar llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
María Luisa F. makes and sells prepared meals every day in Managua's Mayoreo Market in order to serve her customers and earn profits to meet her needs. She requests funding because she needs to buy ingredients to prepare her delicious meals. She will buy beef, chicken, rice, beans and cooking oil, among other items. She hopes her loan will be granted so that she can continue to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for prepared meals.

loans.name: Estelbina

texts.es: La señora Estelbina B. A., tiene 48 años de edad vive en la comarca de San Ignacio un lugar donde sus habitantes son personas humildes y que en su mayoria se dedican al trabajo de la agricultura, la señora ens casada y us esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad apoyandole en los gastos de la casa,  ellos se dedican al cultivo de la pitahaya desde hace 12 años y el mayor problema que han tenido han sido la falta de apoyo de las financieras hacia el ramo de la agricultiura, ellos se iniciaron en este trabajo, gracias al apoyo que se han brindado mutuamente. Para el futuro tiene planeado realizar trabajos de conservacion de suelo debido a que han tenido problemas con la tierra para esto han pensado en la iyeccion de capital en la compra de materiales agricolas tales como fertilizante y fungicidas esto le garantizara una buena cosecha y les traera mayores insumos que le ayudaran a estabilizarse economicamente.
texts.en:
Estelbina B. A., 48, lives in the San Ignacio settlement. Her neighbors are, for the most part, humble people dedicated to farming. She is married and her husband is employed as a security guard thus helping her with household expenses. For the last 12 years they have farmed pitahaya (dragon fruit). The greatest difficulty they have faced in the past has been the unwillingness of financial institutions to help farmers. They started in this line of work thanks to the mutual help they gave each other. For the future, she is planning to undertake soil conservation projects because they have had trouble with the soil. For this, they need an injection of capital to buy agricultural supplies, like chemical fertilizers and fungicides, to guarantee a good crop and to bring better ingredients that will help them stabalize economically.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: María Haydee

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora María Haydee se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 20 años logrando llevar el sustento a su familia.

El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de los productos de la pulpería entre ellos comestibles lácteos como queso, cuajada, crema y otros productos como detergentes, jabones, entre otros. La señora S. espera que su crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente y así mejorará las condiciones de vida propia y las de su familia.
texts.en:
For the last 20 years, María Haydee has dedicated herself to her business in Managua's Mayoreo Market, in order to support her family. The funds will be used to buy items for her grocery store among them: dairy products, like cheese, cuajada (milk curd), cream and other products like detergent and soap, among others. Mrs. S. hopes that her loan will be granted satisfactorily so that she can improve her own and her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Lina Amely

texts.es:
Lina es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Lina es soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Lina vende materiales de construcción, cuenta con un local para almacén y sus ventas los realiza a domicilio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su papá.
Lina necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arena.
Lina sueña con aperturar una ferretería y tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Lina is a member of the Amor Divino communal bank. Lina is 27 years old, single, and has a son. She sells construction materials and has a space for a warehouse. She makes her sales door-to-door with the help of her father.

Lina needs a loan of 1750 PEN that she will invest in the purchase of sand. Lina dreams of opening a hardware store and having a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sand

loans.name: Erick Ernesto

texts.es:
Erick es socio del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Erick es soltero, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, de profesión Físico Matemático, Erick elabora libros y folletos de diferentes áreas de matemáticas, que vende en las diferentes academias de la ciudad, además Eric dicta clases particulares.
Erick necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papeles e impresiones.
Los sueños de Erick es tener una empresa.
texts.en:
Erick is a member of the Amor Divino ("Divine Love") communal bank. Erick is 27 years old and single, and he has 1 child. His profession is mathematical physics. Erick prepares books and pamphlets about various areas of mathematics, which he sells at a range of academies in the city. He also gives private classes. Erick needs a loan of 1000 soles, which he will invest in paper and printing services. Erick's dream is to have his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing paper and printing services

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Consuelo es divorciada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Consuelo tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además cada 15 días vende comida típica en la feria de comida típica.
Consuelo necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
El sueño de Consuelo son ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a member of the Amor Divino ("Divine Love") communal bank. Consuelo is 42 years old and divorced, with 3 children. She operates a store in a rented building, where she works every day selling general grocery items. In addition, every 15 days she sells traditional foods at the traditional food market. Consuelo needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in purchasing rice and sugar. Consuelo's dream is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice and sugar

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Maritza es soltera, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Maritza trabaja como asistente de Gerencia, además vende cereales, lácteos, y en asociación con sus papas tienen un restaurante.
Maritza necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lácteos.
Los sueños de Maritza son ampliar sus negocios y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the Communal Bank “Amor Divino” (Divine Love). She is 30 years old, single, and has one child.

She works as an assistant manager, but she also sells grains and dairy products. In addition, she and her parents operate a restaurant. Maritza is requesting a loan of 900 soles to purchase dairy products. She dreams of expanding her businesses and opening a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy products

loans.name: Karin

texts.es: Karin, es una mujer muy solidaria, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 33 años, es madre de tres hijos, todos menores de edad, ella se dedica al servicio de costura y a la venta de productos de belleza, sale a ofrecer sus productos en los mercados e instituciones de esta localidad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es personal de seguridad. Karin forma parte del Banco Comunal “Damas del Oriente”, desde hace ocho años.  El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en telas para la confección de prendas interiores, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1500 soles, que utilizará en la compra de prendas de vestir y en telas para confeccionar. La meta de Karin es tener un negocio estable y una tienda de productos de belleza y prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Karin, 33, is a very cooperative woman who lives in the Callería district, Ucayali region. She has three, minor children. She is a seamstress and sells beauty products. She goes out to the various markets and institutions in the city to offer her wares. Her husband, who is a security guard, supports her work efforts. Karin has been a member of the "Damas del Oriente" communal bank for 8 years. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy fabric to make underwear. Now, she needs 1500 soles to buy articles of clothing and fabric to sew. Karin's goal is to have a stable business and a store where she can sell beauty supplies and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing and fabrics for dressmaking.

loans.name: Doris Yessenia

texts.es:
Doris Gurdian se dedica a trabajar muy arduamente como maestra de un pequeño colegio en el municipio de El Sauce en León con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda porque lo ha requerido así y por esto es que ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener los materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo esta obra de construcción y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia en su municipio. Espera fielmente que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera mejorará su nivel de vida y el de su amada familia.
texts.en:
Doris G. works hard at being a teacher at a small high school in the town of El Sauce, department of León. Her job enables her to support her family.

She has started to improve her living conditions at home, so she is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL so that she can purchase materials needed for the construction work required to make these improvements for her family. Doris waits faithfully for her loan to be granted so that she can improve the standard of living for the family she loves.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Jovanny Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Jovanny Janeth F.  es otra socia activa Banco Comunal Jardín del Artesano en el cantón  Montecristi,   aquí la mayor parte de su gente se dedica a la elaboración de  artesanías que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero.

Nuestra socia   es de profesión profesora    en un colegio de Manta, está casada  y tiene cuatro hijos, a sus 61 años se da tiempo para dar clases y dedicarse a su negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.

Con el préstamo solicitado a la Fundación va a comprar principalmente pantalones, camisas, blusas,  pijamas para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Sra. Jovanny Janeth F. is an active member of the Artisan’s Garden Communal Bank in the region of Montecristi. Most of the residents in the area make handicrafts that are sold to both domestic and foreign tourists.

Sra. Jovanny is a high school teacher in Manta. She is married and has four children. At 61 years of age, she devotes her time to teaching classes and operating her retail business selling clothes for women, men, and children.

With this loan she is requesting from the Foundation, Jovanny will buy trousers, jackets, blouses, and pajamas for women, men, and children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, jackets, blouses, and pajamas

loans.name: Juan Tomás

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce en el departamento de León, el señor Juan C. con mucho esfuerzo se desempeña en la actividad de venta de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, sorgo los cuales son comercializados al por mayor en diferentes pulperías del municipio.
La situación que actualmente atraviesa es que no posee los granos básicos para realizar las ventas y por este motivo es que solicita un crédito para la compra de dichos granos básicos para dar lugar a la respectiva venta y así obtener sus ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan C. lives in the town of El Sauce in the department of León. He works very hard at selling dry goods such as rice, beans, sugar, corn, and sorghum. Juan sells these products in bulk to different grocery stores in town.

The situation he is facing is that he does not have enough merchandise to sell. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy basic grains in order to continue making sales and earning income to maintain his household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Rebeca Sobeyda

texts.es:
Con una gran sonrisa siempre, en el municipio de El Sauce en León, la señora Rebeca T. se dedica a elaborar alimentos los que son comercializados por ella misma a sus clientes que le compran dichos alimentos.

Ella ha logrado llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y la razon por la que está solicitando el crédito hoy en día es para la compra de materia prima como arroz, pollo, carne, verduras, etc. para la elaboración de la comida que ofrece a los pobladores. Es por este motivo que el crédito le ayudará grandemente y así logrará suplir las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
In the town of El Sauce in the department of León, Sra. Rebeca T. works preparing food with a big smile on her face. She sells to customers who are looking for the types of dishes she cooks.

She has managed to sustain her household, so she is requesting a loan today in order to buy ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, vegetables, and other items needed for preparing her dishes to offer to the local residents. This loan will help tremendously in meeting the needs of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: 8 De Setiembre Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 8 D. Setiembre, inicia su octavo ciclo con  21 socias. Las socias son del distrito D. Acosvinchos que se ubica a 1 hora D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, golosinas, abarrotes en general, panes, calzados, carne, animales menores, comida y también se dedican a la agricultura y la elaboración D. tejas.

Como es el caso D. la señora Alejandrina que es la presidenta del Banco Comunal, que es casada, tiene 54 años y 8 hijos, Alejandrina tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, además se dedica a la siembra D. diferentes productos.

Ricardina es casada, y se dedica a la crianza D. animales que venD. en la feria D. su distrito, también se dedica a la agricultura.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles, haciendo un total D. 13,800 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, trigo, cebada, harina, zapatos, golosinas, animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una casa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
texts.en:
The September 8th Communal Bank is starting its eighth loan cycle with 21 members. They are from the district from Acosvinchos, which is located an hour away from the city of Ayacucho. The members operate different businesses such as selling grain, candy, groceries, bread, shoes, meat, small animals, and food. They also engage in farming and the production of tiles. This is the case with Sra. Alejandrina, who is the president of the Communal Bank. She is 54 years old, married, and has eight children. Alejandrina manages a grocery store in her home and also raises different types of crops. Ricardina is married and raises animals to sell at the district fair. She also engages in farming. The members need different loan amounts ranging from 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, to 750 soles for a total of 13,800 soles to the entire Communal Bank. Their loans will be used to buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, wheat, barley, flour, shoes, candy, and small animals. The dreams of the members incluD. expanding their businesses, seeing their children become professionals, and owning a home in city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, wheat, barley, flour, shoes, candy, and small animals

loans.name: Salvith

texts.es:
Salvith, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 38 años, es madre de tres hijos, todos menores de edad, está separada.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, tiene una bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa. Salvith forma parte del Banco Comunal “Los Corazones”, desde hace ocho meses, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 500 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de repuestos de motocarro.
Ahora ella necesita 800 soles que será invertido en su bodega, comprará varios productos de primera necesidad. La meta de Salvith es tener una tienda bien surtida y seguir trabajando para Salir adelante.
texts.en:
Salvith, 38, is a dynamic woman who lives in the Manantay district, Ucayali region. She has three, minor children and is separated. She sells basic needs items in a small grocery store she has set up in her home. Salvith has been a member of the "Los Corazones" communal bank for 8 months. Her first, 500 sol, loan was used to buy vehicle replacement parts. She now needs 800 soles to invest in stock items for her store. Salvith's goal is to have a sell-stocked store and to continue to work to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items to stock her store.

loans.name: Luis Ivan

texts.es:
Luis es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Luis es soltero, tiene 24 años y vive con sus padres, Luis junto a su mama tienen un molino en su casa en donde procesan cereales, productos que comercializan en los mercados de la ciudad.
Luis necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo y cebada.
Los sueños de Luis son terminar sus estudios de Administración de Empresas y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is a member of the Communal Bank “Tulipanes” (Tulips). He is 24 years old, single, and lives with his parents. Luis and his mother operate a mill out of their home where they process grain and then sell their goods at the city markets.

Luis is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to purchase wheat and barley. He dreams of finishing his studies in business administration and improving his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat & barley

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora  es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Flora es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 1 hija, Flora vende sandalias por mayor, sus productos los reparte en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y Huanta, además Flora tiene un carro que realiza transporte de pasajeros a las ciudades de la Selva Ayacuchana.
Flora necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sandalias.
Los sueños de Flora es tener una tienda de sandalias y que sus hijos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the Communal Bank “Tulipanes” (Tulips). She is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a daughter.

Flora is a wholesale retailer of sandals. She sells her products at the markets in the cities of Ayacucho and Huanta. In addition, Flora has a car that is used for transporting passengers among the cities in the Ayacuchan jungle.

Flora is requesting a loan of 1050 soles to purchase more sandals. She dreams of having a store where she can sell her sandals and seeing her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sandals

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza E. de 46 años de edad, vive en un barrio que se llama Memorial Sandino. Es una mujer muy trabajadora durante cinco años se ha dedicado a administrar su negocio la alquiler de cuarto, alquiler de teléfono y venta de helados para mejorar los ingresos y poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos básicos de agua, luz y otros, y a
 Sus hijos los cuales cursan la secundaria, su esposo se desempeña en servicios de seguridad y su salario es bajo. Con el préstamo anterior logro construir un muro en la parte de enfrente para mejor seguridad de su familia todo gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic ha apoyado. Con este préstamo seguirá haciendo mejoras para el futuro de su familia, construirá otro cuarto en la parte de atrás del solar para poder alquilarlo también. Para esto comprara piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc y otros para comenzar la obra. Muy contenta ya que gracias al financiamiento ha logrado las expectativas en las mejoras de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Esperanza E. is 46 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Memorial Sandino. She is a hardworking woman and has been managing her businesses for the past five years. These include renting out rooms, renting out telephones, and selling ice cream so that she can improve her income and help her husband with basic expenses such as water, electricity, and other necessities.

Her children attend high school. Esperanza’s husband works as a security guard, but his salary is low. With her previous loan, she was able to build a wall in front of her house to provide better security for her family. She thanks AFODENIC for providing financing and assistance. With this new loan, she will continue making improvements for her family’s future. She will build another room on the back of her property that she can also rent out as well. In order to do this, she will purchase stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and other materials to begin work. Esperanza is very happy because the financing has met her expectations in helping improve her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and other materials

loans.name: Deonisia

texts.es:
Deonisia es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Deonisia es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Deonisia junto a su esposo tienen una tapicería para carros en su casa, actividad que realizan con la ayuda D. 1 personal y todos los días.
Deonisia necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. esponjas y pegamento.
Los sueños D. Deonisia es que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Deonisia is a member of the Communal Bank “Tulipanes” (Tulips). She is 42 years old, married, and has four children. Deonisia and her husband manage a car upholstery shop out of their home. They operate their business every day with the help of one employee.

She is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy sponges and glue. Deonisia dreams of seeing her children become professionals and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sponges & glue

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Marisol es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, de profesión Enfermera, Marisol tiene un molino en su casa en donde procesa cereales variados, sus productos los comercializa en los mercados y tiendas.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quinua y haba.
Los sueños de Marisol son tener una empresa grande y vender al mercado local y regional.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of the Tulipanes ("Tulips") communal bank. Marisol is 35 years old and has a common-law husband and 2 children. She is a nurse by profession. Marisol has a mill in her home, where she processes a variety of foods. Her products are sold in markets and stores. Marisol needs a loan of 750 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in purchasing quinoa and dry beans. Marisol's dream is to have a large business and sell her products on the local and regional market.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing quinoa and dry beans

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Martha es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Martha vende repuestos en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días, además en el mismo lugar se encuentra el taller mecánico de su esposo. También vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Martha necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios de carros y lateria.
Los sueños de Martha son tener sucursales, vender mas variedad de repuestos y que su hija ingrese a la universidad.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Tulipanes ("Tulips") communal bank. Martha is 38 years old and married with 3 children. Martha works every day selling spare parts in rented business space. The same location also includes the mechanic's workshop operated by her husband. Martha also sells cosmetics out of catalogs. Martha needs a loan of 3000 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in purchasing car accessories and metal parts. Martha's dreams are to have a chain of shops, sell a broader variety of spare parts, and see her daughter enter the university.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing car accessories and metal parts

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: El señor Dionisio B. A., tiene 47 años de edad es casado y su señora trabaja como ama de casa, ellos tienen una familia de 4 hijos los cuales son mayores y en los tiempos libres ayudan a las responsabilidades domésticas, el señor Dionisio B. actualmente se encuentra gestionando la construcción de una vivienda para brindarsela a sus hijos y darle mejores comodidades, tiene 20 años dedicandose al cultivo de la pitahaya, el mayor problema al que se han enfretado a sido la sequia por falta de agua por que los sistemas de riego no son accesibles económicamente, ellos se iniciaron en esta actividad gracias al apoyo de sus padres, quienes le heredaron unas tierras, el plan ha futuro será la obtención de una manzana y media, con este prestamo el señor B. podrá comprar insumos de materiales vegetativos y semillas, para diversificar sus cultivos, ellos son una familia responsable y trabajadora que se les apoyará a que mejoren sus niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Dionisio B. A. is 47. His wife works as a housewife, and they have four grown children. During their free time they help with the domestic responsibilities. Dionisio B. is currently undertaking the construction of a house in order to give it to his children and provide them with better living conditions. For 20 years he has been cultivating dragon fruit. The biggest problem they have encountered is the drought. There is a lack of water because the watering systems are not economically accessible. They started in this activity thanks to the support of their parents, who left them the land. The plan for the future is to get a block and a half. With this loan Mr. B. will be able to buy supplies like vegetative materials and seeds in order to diversify his crops. They are a responsible and hard-working family, and with support they will improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetative materials and seeds

loans.name: Baby Katherin

texts.es:
La señora Baby Katherin, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Gran Pajaten”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 29 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando.

Baby Katherin, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. Poco a poco, fue ahorrando y generando su propio capital, así de esta manera decidió implementar su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos, con el que en la actualidad continua, se encuentra ubicada en un ambiente, muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,400.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes y colonias refrescantes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas. 

Baby Katherin, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Baby Katherin belongs to the El Gran Pajaten Communal Bank in the Juanjui department, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 29, married, and has three children. The children are still dependent upon her, and they go to school. Baby Katherin is a woman who has been able to overcome many difficulties on her life’s path. She is very happy with what she has achieved. Little by little she was saving and generating her own capital. This is how she decided to set up her own business selling cosmetics. She currently continues in the same business. It is in a very well set up environment in order to wait on her customers. With this loan for 1,400 PEN she will buy beauty products for her stock like perfumes and refreshing colognes for women and men, creams, powder compacts, lipstick, and nail polish. Baby Katherin, with her maturity, is an example to follow for many women who are starting in a business. With perseverance they will achieve their dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for helping her set up her own business and for helping other women grow entrepreneurially.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Marli

texts.es:
La señora Marli, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Gran Pajaten”, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 56 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella y por los que cada día se empeña en seguir adelante.

Marli, se dedica a la venta de chorizos y cecinas, lleva 20 años trabajando con este negocio, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, le va muy bien ya que tiene bastante acogida y sus clientes ya la conocen. Nos cuenta que a diario, tiene muy buenas ventas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará kilos de cecinas, chorizos y cecinas, para luego venderlos por kilos. 

Marli, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberme ayudado a salir adelante y a iniciar mi negocio con un capital, ahora me siento una mujer realizada y capaz”.
texts.en:
Marli belongs to the El Gran Pajaten Communal Bank in the San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 56, single, and has two children. One is still dependent upon her. It is for them that she makes the effort everyday to get ahead. Marli sells sausages and beef jerky. She has been working in this business for 20 years. It is located in the Central Market in her district. It is going very well for her, it is well received, and she is well known to the customers. She tells us that she has very good sales everyday. She currently continues with the same business. She personally waits on her customers with her characteristic charisma. She will use this loan for 3,000 PEN to buy kilos of jerky and sausage to later sell by the kilo. Marli is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for, “Having helped me get ahead and have some capital to start my business. I now feel like a capable and fulfilled woman.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jerky and sausage

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Gran Pajaten”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 28 años y es madre de 03  hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Nancy, es una mujer alegre, perseverante y capaz, nos cuenta que poco a poco ha ido logrando algunos de metas y sueños que quería realizar,  en la actualidad se dedica a venta de ropas usadas y le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene clientes que la conocen y saben de su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Central de su Distrito.
La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  más mercaderías de ropas como: pantalones, shorts, snikers, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para niñas. 
Ella manifiesta que siente mucho orgullo por ella misma, por lo que logro y lo hizo con mucho entusiasmo y optimismo.

Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me da el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos,  de  contar con los préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Nancy belongs to the El Gran Pajaten Communal Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 28, in a common law marriage, and has three dependent children. Nancy is a happy, perseverant, and capable woman. She tells us that little by little she has been achieving some of her goals and dreams. She currently sells used clothes, and it is going very well for her. She has customers who know her and know about her business, which is located in the Central Market in her district. The strength and perseverance that characterize her helped her to grow as an independent woman. She is very proud of what she has achieved. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy more clothing merchandise like pants, shorts, sneakers, all sizes and styles of blouses, polo shirts and clothes for girls. She is very proud of herself for what she has achieved, and she did it with much enthusiasm and optimism. She says, “I am grateful for the opportunity that the Manuela Ramos Movement gives me and to be able to count on the loans that help me develop as a woman and as a small businesswoman.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more used clothes

loans.name: Petronila Segunda

texts.es:
La señora Petronila Segunda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Gran Pajaten”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Caceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 51 años y 06 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Su fuerza y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 
Las ganancias que genera a diario, la ayuda al ingreso económico  en su familia. 

Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Petronila Segunda, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y prepararse para hacer frente a las adversidades de la vida  y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Petronila Segunda, 51, is a member of the "El Gran Pajaten" communal bank, which is in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Caceres province, San Martín department. She is married and has 6 children, two of whom still are dependent on her. Her strength and desire to see her children get ahead motivated her to set up her own grocery store in her home; she has a well-equipped area to tend to her customers. Her daily profits help support her family. From the beginning and to date she has won over regular customers who come by daily now to buy from her for it is she, herself, who tends to their requests with her characteristic charisma. With this 1500 sol loan, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of pasta, cases of milk and preserved fish of various brands, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene items to continue to provide better customer service. Petronila Segunda feels strong to continue to work and to prepare herself to face any adversity life might present. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop in their chosen lines of work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Gran Pajaten”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 44 años y 03 hijas, que aun dependen de ella.

Margarita, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, con ganas de seguir adelante, así aportar en el ingreso económico, en su hogar.
Lleva 10 años dedicándose a la venta de comidas, como vio que le genera buenos ingresos, decidió abrirse más en el campo, así que con su esfuerzo estableció un pequeño ambiente, ubicada en su misma casa, para atender a sus clientes; con ese carisma y alegría que siempre la ha caracterizado.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que es muy conocida y tiene buena acogida.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos para preparar sus alimentos  como: kilos de arroz, azúcar y papas, racimos de plátanos, pollos vivos en javas. Y algunas herramientas de cocina, para remplazar a los antiguos.

Margarita, se siente una mujer tranquila y contenta con lo logrado, y desea asegurarse una vejez tranquila por lo que agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sueños y metas, así como a otras   mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Margarita, 44, is a member of the “El Gran Pajaten” communal bank, which is in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and three daughters, who still depend on her. Margarita is a hard-working, enterprising woman, who wants to get ahead and provide income for her family. She has sold prepared meals for 10 years now. As this is a profitable enterprise, she decided to expand and set up a small eatery in her home to tend to her customers with her characteristic good humor and joy. Currently, she continues with this work and she tells us that she does very well since she is well-known and liked. With this 2000 sol loan she will buy ingredients for her meals like: kilograms of rice, sugar and potatoes, bunches of bananas, live, crated chickens as well as some cooking utensils that need to be replaced. Margarita is a tranquil woman who is happy with what she has accomplished. She wants to insure a peaceful old-age for herself so she is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to meet her goals and have her dreams come true, as well as for other women that want to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank in Patria that has 23 members. Patria is a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest, about 8 hours by rough road from Cusco. Susana and her common-law husband are the parents of five children. They live in a modest home near town.

Susana and her husband work their fields, planting rice, yucca and coca. The fields are located some distance from their home, so they cannot travel there easily every day. Susana is requesting a loan to hire day-laborers to help with the coming yucca and rice harvests. She hopes to be able to buy additional land in the future and increase her harvest. Susana appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

In the short video, Susana talks about the her agricultural activities and those of her neighbors and the importance of capital to their enterprise.

loans.use: To hire help to plant and harvest rice and yucca

loans.name: Segunda

texts.en:
Mrs. Segunda N. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba in Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with four school-age children. She owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products in the local community. In 2008, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to its programs and services. She has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years, and she earns 8,000 PHP monthly from her business. Segunda is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used for additional capital in her existing business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Segunda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for a sari-sari store (general store)

loans.name: Los Andenes Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios se reúnen cada treinta días en la ciudad D. Yucay. La ciudad D. Yucay esta a 48 kilómetros D. Cusco, es uno D. los lugares más acogedores del Valle Sagrado D. los Incas, por su clima, gratos paisajes e impresionantes andenerías. 

Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Los Andenes” D. la asociación Arariwa y esta compuesto por 15 miembros. El socio Clever es el presidente del banco comunal. 

Nuestros socios Edgar, Doris, Delia, Eveling, Gabina y Estela se dedican a la venta D. artesanía y los otros socios como Irene a la venta D. verduras, Victor y Ricardino a la venta D. carne, Clever y Jessica son docentes y nuestra socia Edid hace servicio D. transportes. 

Los socios requieren el préstamo para aumentar su capital D. negocio y compraran más materiales para hacer más artesanías y los demás invertirán para comprar más productos.

Nuestro socio Luis tiene 41 años y tiene dos hijos pero esta separado D. su esposa, el es empleado D. una empresa privada y trabaja como jardinero en Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para gasto personal.
   
Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
}
(En el video no están Victor, Yessica y Edgar pidieron permiso a la junta directiva del banco para no estar en la reunión)
texts.en:
Our members meet every 30 days in the city of Yucay. The city of Yucay is 48 kilometers from Cusco. It is one of the most welcoming places in the Sacred Valley of the Incas because of its climate, pleasant scenery, and impressive terraced agriculture. The members belong to the Los Andenes Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. It is comprised of 15 members. Clever is the president of the communal bank. Our members Edgar, Doris, Delia, Eveling, Gabina, and Estela sell handicrafts. Other members, like Irene, sell vegetables. Victor and Ricardino sell meat, Clever and Jessica are teachers, and Edid provides transportation services. The members need the loan to increase their business capital and buy more materials to make handicrafts. The others will buy more products. Our member, Luis, is 41. He has two children, but he is separated from his wife. He works for a private company as a gardener in Urubamba. He has been in this business for several years. It has gone very well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He needs the loan for personal expenses. The members appreciate and value the loan, and they promise to make their payments on time. (Victor, Yessica, and Edgar are not in the video. They asked the governing board of the bank for permission to miss the meeting.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products and materials to make handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Mrs. Letecia B. is from the barangay or village of Solinog located in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 66 years old. She is married and blessed with three adult-aged children. She gets a small income from dealing NATASHA products (apparel, beauty products, etc) to the local community but this is not enough for her to be self-sustaining or to help support her husband and family. In fact, her main source of income comes primarily from her pension, which is in the amount of P7,500 monthly. In 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to the programs and services of the Co-op. She requested her second loan in the amount of P30,000, which will be used to purchase housing materials so she can repair and renovate her house, as seen in the picture above. 
 
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For housing materials

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina W. is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old. Cristina is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Cristina owns & operates a retail store where she sells seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cristina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Cristina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a retail store where she sells slippers in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Imelda from GDMPC. About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Mangidkid Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Erlinda is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue the main source of income comes primarily from selling daily use products such as sugar, salt, shampoo, soap (bath and laundry) & toothpaste in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

To make a living, Lucresia owns & operates a retail store where she sells daily use products such as sardines, coffee, sugar, salt, dried fish, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Lucresia has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lucresia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucresia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lucresia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lucresia from GDMPC. About GDMPC:

In 2007, Isidro joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Isidro from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

Shirley P. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old. Shirley is married and has two school-aged children. loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic C. is from the village of Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Marivic is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a retail store where she sells coconut for copra (the dried white meat of the coconut) in the local community. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marivic joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marivic from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
