loans.use: To purchase additional coconut

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar is 23 years old. He is married and has two children. His family live in the Fuzuli region. This young man has been in this business for two years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy clothes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran G. was born in 1985. He is single and lives in the Fuzuli region. He teaches students to play the accordion. He has been in this business for two years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to improve his business.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase capital for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda T. is 46 years old and comes from Jala-jala, in the province of Rizal, an area that is growing in terms of livelihood enterprises. She is married to Rogelio, 48 years old, a farmer and a supportive husband. She is the loving mother of four children, the oldest being 22 years old and the youngest 2 years old. Erlinda is an optimistic mother who knows she will overcome all challenges to achieve her dreams.

The income of Erlinda and her husband is not enough to cover the expense of their family. Therefore, in 1999, she got the idea of joining ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.),  a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. Since then, she started a small farming business and it really helped them to meet their needs. She has now been in business for more than ten years. 

Currently on her sixth loan, Erlinda requests Php 30,000 as additional capital for her farming business. She believes that her proposed loan will be a big help and will contribute to the growth of her business. She has disciplined herself to use all of the borrowed capital from ASHI-Kiva for her business to gain more profit and to use that profit to support the daily expenses and education of her children.

Erlinda has been an ASHI member for eleven years. ASHI paved the way for the achievement of the dreams of her family: to send her children to school and to have them finish their studies with a degree. In addition to this, though, she didn’t stop dreaming of her children having stable and happy families in the future.

Erlinda is very thankful to ASHI for its kind-hearted support of her dreams. She is also hoping that, with the help of ASHI in their lives, it will do much to help them provide a sustainable life and have a comfortable house to live in.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her farming business

loans.name: Maria Adilia

texts.es: Doña Maria Adilia vive en un barrio de la capital de Managua Hialeah en donde logro formar su hogar. Tiene 56 años de edad,  durante veintidós años ha trabajado, ahora como jefa del departamento del sistema penitenciario, cuando comenzó era policía. Gracias  a su trabajo y ayuda de su esposo logro hacer su propia casa en donde falta repellarla y pintarla. Hace varios años su esposo murió lo cual fue muy triste y trágico para ella. Con este préstamo que esta solicitando es para construir un cuarto en donde comprara piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc para comenzar la obra,  para alquiler a los estudiantes del norte del país que vienen a estudiar a la capital. El cual será un ingreso para mejorar su estabilidad económica. Contenta por el apoyo que la institución ha dado es su quinto ciclo el cual ha invertido en infraestructura.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Adilia lives in the capital city’s neighborhood of Managua Hialeah where she built her home. She is 56 year sold and has worked for 22 years; she started as a police officer but she is now the head of the department of prison systems. Thanks to her job and her husband’s help, she was able to build her own house but it still needs to be plastered and painted. Her husband died several years ago which was very sad and tragic for her. She is requesting this loan to build a room; she will buy stone, sand, cement, wrought iron, and roof material to start building. She plans to rent the room to students from the northern region of the country that come to the capital city to study. The rent income will contribute to her financial stability. She is happy with the support from this institution (this is her fifth loan); she has invested the loans in the house’s infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stone, sand, cement, wrought iron, and roof material to start building a room.

loans.name: Erika Esperanza

texts.es:
La Srita. Erika Esperanza M. trabaja en la sección de atención al cliente en una institución en el Municipio de Condega. Ella va a usar dicho crédito en la compra de un terreno donde futuramente construirá su propia casa ya que actualmente ella reside en la casa de su mamá.

Una vez salida de la universidad  la Srita. Erika M. empezó a trabajar haces 5 años en dicha institución, trabaja de las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tardes de lunes a sábado. 

Ella espera que con la compra de dicho terreno en un futuro se le facilite las condiciones y construir su propia casa ser una persona totalmente independiente.

Erika M. es soltera graduada de la universidad, no tiene hijos y vive en la casa de sus padres.

Este es el crédito 7 que Erika M. tiene con Ceprodel en un periodo de 3 años, donde es importante mencionar que esto créditos que la favorecido muy positivamente en sus logros personales ya que le permiten hacer buenas inversiones por que los ingresos mensuales de ella son bajos y si no fuese por los financiamiento de Ceprodel no los lograría, ejemplo es la compra del terreno que ella realizo.
texts.en:
Ms. Erika Esperanza M. works in the customer service department of an institution in the municipality of Condega. She will use this loan to buy a plot of land where she will build her own house in the future since she currently lives with her mother. When she graduated from the university, Ms. Erika M. started working in said institution 5 years ago; she works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm from Monday to Saturday. She hopes that the purchase of the plot of land will improve her living conditions and will allow her to build her own house so she can become a totally independent person. Erika Morena is single, with a college degree, no kids and she lives with her parents. This is loan number 7 that Erika has with Ceprodel in a 3 year period; it is important to mention that these loans have contributed positively to her personal achievements. The loans have allowed her to make good investments, since her regular monthly income is low, and without the loans from Ceprodel this would not be possible. A good example is the purchase of the plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a plot of land

loans.name: Lidia Arminda

texts.es: La Cliente Lidia, llegó a nustra institución por recomendación de una cliente buena y antigua, ella tiene su esposo que por el momento se fue a trabajar a la Rep. De Argentina en el rubro de la costura, es una persona joven que desde hace unos 6 años aproximadamente se dedica a esta actividad con un capital inicial que le dió su padre y con el dinero que le envía su esposo, fue ampliando la compra y venta de autos, aún no tine hijos, lo que ella en este momento esta priorizando la conclusión de su vivienda, la que se encuentra en la última fase, siendo una persona muy joven demuestra mucha inquietud, tenacidad y responsabilidad en las actividades que realiza.
texts.en:
A good and long-standing client of this institution recommended Lidia to us. Lidia's husband has gone to Argentina for the time being to work as a tailor. Lidia is a young person who has been a car retailer for the past 6 years thanks to initial capital she got from her father and with the funds her husband sends. She has enlarged her car retail business. She doesn't have any children yet, as a young person, she's restless, tenacious and responsible with all the tasks she sets up for herself. Currently, her first priority is to finish building her house, which is in its final construction phase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana Aba U. vende lotería ambulante en el mercado Israel lewite Managua.
Ana va usar el crédito para comprar varios billetes de lotería.
Su negocio comenzó cuando Ana empezó a vender ambulante, viendo  que las ventas estaban aumentando ella decidió vender lo que era la raspadita y la chalupa.
Trabaja cada día de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
Ella espera que con este financiamiento su negocio cresca mas y a si tener mas utilidades.
Ana es  madre soltera y con una hija en la universidad.
Este es el octavo crédito que Ana ha tenido con CEPRODEL. 
Ha trabajado con ceprodel 2 años.
Ana dijo que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que su negocio se ha mantenido y este esta mas solido.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana A.U. sells lottery tickets on an itinerant basis in the Israel Lewite market in Managua. Ana wants to use the loan to but lottery tickets.

Her business began when Ana started selling on foot in the market. Seeing that her sales were increasing she decided to sell “raspadita”, a lottery ticket in which the surface is scratched with a coin or key, and “chalupa” , another type of lottery ticket. She works each day from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening.

She hopes that with this loan her business will grow more and, thus, have greater earnings. Ana is a single mother with a daughter in university. This is the eighth loan that Ana has had with CEPRODEL. She has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years. Ana says that her loans with CEPRODEL have helped her a lot. They are the reasons why her business has sustained itself and is on a more solid footing.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan is going to be invested in the purchase of lottery tickets for resale

loans.name: Cairo José

texts.es:
Cairo D. vende emparedados, gaseosa, jugos y café en el mercado Israel lewite Managua.
Cairo va usar el crédito para comprar dos termo y una cafetera. 
Su negocio comenzó cuando cairo quedo desempleado, y al no encontrar trabajo puso su propio negocio en el mercado viendo que las ventas iban aumentando el decidió quedarse en el mercado.
Trabaja cada día de 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.
El espera que con la compra de los termos y la cafetera la clientela aumente.
Cairo  es  padre de una hija la que se encuentra en edad escolar.
Este es el séptimo crédito que Cairo ha tenido con CEPRODEL. 
Ha trabajado con ceprodel 2 años.
Cairo dijo que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que su negocio se ha mantenido
texts.en:
Cairo D. sells sandwiches, sodas, juices and coffee in the Israel Lewites market in Managua. Cairo will use the loan to buy two thermoses and a coffee maker. His business started when Cairo became unemployed; when he could not find a job he set up his own business in the market and after sales started to increase he decided to stay in the market. He works every day from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. He hopes the purchase of the thermoses and the coffee maker will increase his clientele. Cairo has a young daughter. This is the seventh loan that Cairo has with CEPRODEL and has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years. Cairo said that the loans from CEPRODEL have helped him a lot to sustain his business.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two thermoses and a coffee maker.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La Sra. María de Jesús L. vende desayunos en el mercado Israel lewite de Managua.
María va usar el crédito para comprar un termo y un microonda. 
Quiere un microonda para hacer comida rápida y un termo para poner gaseosas ya que el tiene se encuentra en mal estado y a si podrá tener mas ingresos.
Su negocio comenzó cuando María tenía 35 años y dejo de trabajar como domestica, y quiso poner su propio negocio esto debido a que quería estar mas cerca de su hijo, y este fue creciendo poco a poco.
María ha tenido su propio tramo en el mercado para 32 años. Trabaja cada día de 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.
Ella espera que con la compra del termo y el microonda la clientela aumente.
María  es  viuda y madre de dos hijos estos ya no dependen de ella.
Este es el veinte y uno crédito que María ha tenido con CEPRODEL. 
Ha trabajado con ceprodel 4 años, y los financiamientos le han ayudado mucho a su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de Jesús L. sells breakfasts in the Israel Lewites Market of Managua. María will use the loan to buy a cooler and a microwave. She needs a microwave to make meals rapidly and a cooler for soft drinks, since the one she has is in bad condition. With these she will earn more income. María began her business when she was 35 years old, when she stopped working as a domestic servant. She desired to start her own business in order to be close to her son. Her business has been growing little by little. María has had her own stall in the public market for 32 years. She works every day from 8:00 AM until 4:00 PM. She hopes that with the purchase of a cooler and a microwave her clientèle will grow. María is a widow and the mother of 2 children who no longer depend on her. This is María's 21st loan with CEPRODEL. She has worked with CEPRODEL for 4 years and her past loans have helped her business a great deal.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A COOLER AND A MICROWAVE FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Simona Alicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Simona G. tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación.
Simona va usar el crédito para comprar productos para la pulpería.
Quiere el préstamo para incrementar su mercadería y a si poder ofertar diferentes productos a su clientela.
Su negocio empezó cuando empezó a vender hielo, helados, jugos y gaseosas en el vecindario y al ver que vendía mas quiso poner la pulpería.
Simona ha tenido la pulpería en su casa de habitación hace 10 años, trabaja cada día de las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche junto con su hija quien le ayuda.
Ella espera que con la compra de estos nuevos productos la clientela aumente.
Simona  es  viuda y madre de dos hijas estas ya no dependen de ella, aunque a veces ella les ayuda a sus nietos.
Ella lleva trece créditos con  CEPRODEL. 
Ha trabajado con ceprodel 6 años, y los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel me han ayudado a que mi negocio sea más solido que la competencia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Simona G. operates a general store from her own home. She will use this loan to buy goods for her store, expanding her merchandise to see if she can offer different products to her customers. She began in business selling ice, ice cream, juices, and soft drinks in the neighborhood. Upon seeing that this sold well, she decided to install a general store. Simona has operated the store from her house for 10 years, working daily from 7 in the morning until 8 at night. Her daughter helps her. Simona hopes that with these new products, her clientèle will increase. Simona is a widow and mother to 2 daughters who no longer depend on her, although at times she provides help to her grandchildren. She has had 13 loans during her 6 years with CEPRODEL, and the loans have helped her business to become more solid than those of the competition.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY NEW PRODUCTS FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Mayra Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Mayra Hernández, nació en la capital de Managua en donde construyo su familia tiene 46 años de edad, y trabaja como ama de llave a un funcionario extranjero, casada su esposo maestro de obra y con dos hijos. Con los ingresos de su esposo y los de  ella ha logro ahorrar y tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación quien administra su hija todo esto para cubrir los gastos básicos de agua, luz, teléfono y la alimentación. Gracias Adios ha mejorado su casa pero su techo esta en mal estado es por eso que desea cambiarlo y poner perlin ya que es muy bajo y además ya esta viejo es por eso la necesidad que le urge en estos primeros meses reparar y no estar preocupada en el invierno. Lo bueno es que no gasta en mano de obra por que su esposo hace el trabajo el cual es de mucha ganancia ya que es  lo más caro. Lleva varios créditos en la institución el cual ha mejorado su casa. Su meta es poder invertir  más en variedad en el negocio para incrementar su inventario como mejorar las utilidades.
texts.en:
Doña Mayra Hernández was born in the capital of Managua, where she has built her family, her husband, a foreman, and her two children. She is 46 years old and works as the housekeeper for a foreign functionary. With her husband’s earnings and her own, she has saved up to now have a small shop in her home, which is run by her daughter, to cover basic costs of water, power, telephone and food. Thanks to God, she has improved her home, but the roof is in disrepair, thus she wants to fix it and add a purlin because it is very low and, furthermore, very old so that the need is urgent to repair it in the next few months so that they won’t have to worry in the winter. The good news is that the labor won’t cost, because her husband does the work, which is more expensive. She has had various loans with the institution to improve her home. Her goal is to be able to invest more to increase the inventory in her business and improve the utilities.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to fix roof

loans.name: Mirla Anali

texts.es:
Mirla tiene 24 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el sector Tongorrape del distrito de Motupe, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año ha instalado en su vivienda una pequeña bodega con la que ayuda a solventar la economía de su hogar. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos de primera necesidad así como abarrotes y golosinas. Su esposo trabaja como profesor en un colegio de la zona y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos.

Mirla desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es ver convertidos a sus hijos en unos profesionales de éxito. Ella es una madre responsable y muy entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Mirla is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the Tongorrape district of Motupe, an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For one year, she has had a small store in her home, which helps with her household finances. She offers various products to her neighbors such as groceries and candies. Her husband works as a teacher in the local school, and together they are getting ahead with their family.

Mirla wants to expand her business by purchasing more products, but does not have sufficient capital to do so. Thus, she has seen the need to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 Nuevos Soles.

Her greatest wish is to see her children succeed. She is a responsible mother and very devoted to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchae basic products for her store

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Juana del Carmen G. E., tiene 49 años de edad es casada y su esposo es maestro de obra, él le apoya con los gastos mensuales, ellos habitan en una zona de escasos recursos  llamado Barrio San Antonio Sur, tienen 2 hijas de 18 y 16 años de edad, ellos se dedican a los estudios y practican la religión evangélica, el mayor sueño de la señora  G. sería el tener las posibilidades necesarias de brindarle el apoyo a sus hijas para que logren culminar los estudios profesionales, ella tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes y el principal problema que ha enfrentado tras los años han sido las inestabilidades de vivienda que poseen la familia, es por esta razón que ellos han solicitado un préstamo para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos y/o abarrotes que le traigan mejores ingresos económicos que a largo plazo se traduzcan en mejores condiciones de vida para toda la familia así como también los recursos óptimos para poder ofrecerle a sus hijas un futuro mejor, este préstamo significaría para la familia una fuente de ingresos que llegaría a estabilizarles la vida.
texts.en:
Juana del Carmen García E. is 49 years old. She is married to a construction supervisor, who helps her with monthly expenses. They live in a modest neighborhood, Barrio San Antonio Sur, and have two daughters (18 and 16). They are students, and their religion is Protestant. Mrs. García’s greatest dream is to be able to provide support for her daughters so that they can complete their studies. She has sold groceries for 10 years. The major problem she has faced through the years has been unsound housing. For this reason they are requesting a loan to purchase larger quantities of products and/or groceries, which would lead to more income, and in the long term would translate into better living conditions for the entire family. This would also offer the best means of providing her daughters with a better future. The loan would represent a source of income for the family that would make life stable for them.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of miscellaneous products

loans.name: Mereyda

texts.es:
Mereyda tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el centro poblado menor Corral de Arena, distrito de Olmos, ubicado a 2 horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la cría y comercio de ganado ovino desde hace 10 años, este negocio nació ante  la necesidad de solventar sus gastos personales y de apoyar al sostenimiento de su hogar. Ella cría las ovejas y las vende a los comerciantes que usualmente visitan su distrito.

Por otro lado hace un año instaló en su vivienda una pequeña bodega donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes a sus vecinos. Este negocio es de mucha utilidad en la zona ya que el mercado más cercano queda a media hora del lugar en donde viven.

Mereyda desea implementar su negocio con nuevos productos pero no cuenta con la disponibilidad del capital suficiente para lograr su objetivo, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera  vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer muy conocida en su comunidad, sus vecinos la consideran una persona confiable y que constantemente esta preocupada por el bienestar de todo el sector. En la fotografía aparece mostrándonos sus ovejas.
texts.en:
Mereyda is 47 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the small village of Corral de Arena, in the Olmos district, located 2 1/2 hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has had a business raising and selling sheep for 10 years. She started this business because she needed to cover her personal expenses and help support her household. She raises sheep and sells them to the traders who usually visit her district. In addition, a year ago she set up a small store in her house where she offers basic necessities and groceries to her neighbors. This business is very useful in the area, as the next closest market is a half hour away. Mereyda wants to stock her store with new products but does not have enough available capital to do this, and for this reason she is requesting for the first time a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian soles) from Edpyme Alternativa. She is a woman who is well-known in her community; her neighbors consider her to be a reliable person who is constantly concerned with the welfare of everyone in the area. In the photograph, she is showing us her sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic necessities and groceries for her store

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Corral de Arena, distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de maracuyá en una pequeña parcela de media hectárea que logró comprar gracias al dinero que logró ahorrar mientras trabajaba como mototaxista. El cosecha las frutas semanalmente y luego las vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Olmos. Este ingreso es el único con el que cuenta para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a la economía de su hogar.

El desea mejorar la calidad de las frutas que vende por lo que tiene que darle un buen mantenimiento a su cultivo con la compra de fertilizantes, foliares y constantes riegos. Rigoberto no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como productor de maracuyá, comprando más terreno para instalar más plantas de esta fruta. Rigoberto ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 24 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the Corral de Arena neighborhood in the Olmos district, located 2 1/2 hours from the city of Chiclayo. For a year, he has been cultivating and selling passion fruit from a small parcel of half a hectare of land that he managed to buy, thanks to money that he was able to save while he was working as a taxi driver. He harvests the fruit semi-annually, and later sells it in a market in the city of Olmos. This is his only source of income, and with it he pays his personal expenses and helps out with the household expenses as well. He wants to improve the quality of the fruit that he sells, and to do this he must maintain his cultivations well, buying fertilizers, foliar fertilizers (that are applied to the leaves of the plants), and an irrigation system. Rigoberto does not have sufficient capital to do this, and so he is requesting a loan from Adpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles. His greatest wish is to continue to increase his production of passion fruit, buying more land in order to put in more fruit plants. Rigoberto has worked with our institution previously, and has demonstrated responsibility in taking on payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expenses in the maintenance of his passion fruit cultivations

loans.name: Santos Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de edad escolar en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a la venta de emolientes (bebidas calientes hechas a base de hierbas naturales que tienen propiedades medicinales), aprendió esta labor de sus tíos y de su hermano. Se levanta todos los días desde muy temprano a vender su producto en el centro del distrito. Su esposo trabaja como mototaxista y entre ambos solventan los gastos familiares.

Leonarda se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de hierbas para ampliar su negocio ya que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción.

Su más grande anhelo es porder brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad, ella ya ha trabajado con nuestra institución anteriormente y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three school-age children in the district of Paiján, province of Ascope, in the La Libertad region located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. Since she was very young she has worked selling emollients (hot drinks made from natural herbs that have medicinal properties). She learned this trade from her uncles and her brother. She wakes up early every day to sell her product in the center of the district. Her husband works as a taxi driver and between the two of them they are able to cover their family's expenses. Leonarda is applying for a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to purchase the herbs for her business because now she does not have enough money to do so. Her greatest wish is to be able to offer her children a quality education. She has previously worked with our institution and has proven to be reliable and punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicinal herbs to produce emollients

loans.name: Santos Sidia

texts.es: Doña santos es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 53 años de edad, y una pulpería que administra desde hace ocho años, vive junto con su familia en un barrio que se llama Memorial Sandino, dos hermosos hijos que cursan sus estudios,  cuando empezo solo vendía golosinas pero poco comenzó a invertir  en el negocio con prestamos y vender variedades, pues con esto ha logrado mantener a su familia. Pues es de pocos recursos pero ha logrado salir adelante para apoyar a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera. Con este préstamo quiere comprar variedad de alimentos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, lácteos, carnes, pollo, golosinas, gaseosas y productos de limpiezas para aumentar las ventas y poder ofrecer a sus clientes lo necesario. A futuro espera invertir mas para seguir dando educación a sus hijos que es lo que mas anhela que sean unos profesionales para que tengan mas oportunidad en el ámbito de trabajo ya que por falta de recursos económicos ella no logro terminar su ciclo de estudio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos is a hard-working 53-year old woman who has run a small market for eight years. She lives with her two beautiful children, who are both in school, in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. When she started she only sold snacks, but she started to invest more in her business with loans and she has been able to support her family. Even though she is a single mother with few resources she has been able to improve her situation. With this loan she will buy a variety of food like rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, dairy products, meat, chicken, snacks, sodas, and cleaning products to offer her clients what they need and thus increase her sales. She hopes to continue investing in her business so that she can educate her children. Due to lack of resources she was not able to complete her studies, but her greatest hope is that they become professionals and have more job opportunities than she did.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic foods like rice, sugar, oil, bean, dairy products, meat, etc.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El señor Santos Ramírez Castellón se dedica a la compra venta de novillos y la agricultura en el municipio de san Juan de Limay departamento de Estelí se le otorgo el crédito para retención de seis novillos de engorde el cual piensa vender a finales de este año  su negocio comenzó con la agricultura siembra de sorgo, maíz y frijoles luego se dedico a repastar terneros de engorde y venderlos a comerciantes hoy en día solamente se dedica a la agricultura y  vender animales de pesa para el matadero ya que le generan más ingresos don santos tiene más de treinta años de trabajar en este negocio el espera que  con la retención de estos novillos le baya muy bien ya que con los créditos que ha obtenido anteriormente le a  no ha tenido muchos problemas por lo que piensa seguir trabajando de esta manera.
 
Don santos es casado y tiene cuatro hijos bajo su cargo sus padres ya no se encuentran con el ya que fallecieron. Este es el quinto crédito que tiene con Ceprodel y tiene seis años de estar trabajando  nos dijo que sus créditos con Ceprodel la han ayudado mucho a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y sus ingresos por lo que está agradecido y desea seguir trabajando con Ceprodel por más tiempo.
texts.en:
Santos Ramírez Castellón works farming and purchasing and selling calves in the municipality of San Juan de Limay in the department of Estelí. He is seeking the loan to raise six calves for fattening which he hopes to sell by the end of this year. He began his business growing sorghum, corn, and beans. Later he started to raise calves and sell them to different vendors. Today he works both farming and raising animals that he sells to slaughterhouses because this earns him more money. Mr. Santos has more than thirty years working in this business, and he hopes to continue his business this way because he has not had problems with the previous loans he has received. Mr. Santos is married and has four children. He used to live his his parents too, but they have passed away. This is the fifth loan that he has had with Ceprodel over the course of six years. He told us that his loans with Ceprodel have helped him improve his quality of life and increase his profits. He is thankful for the opportunity and hopes to keep working with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and feeding six calves

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Idalia C. Z. vende mercadería como pantalones, blusas, ropa interior, perfumees, pinturas y panas en distintos sectores del departamento de Estelí principalmente en sus municipios como Condega y san Juan de Limay y pueblo nuevo.
	
Rosa idalia utilizara el crédito para la comprar y vender la mercadería en los sectores ya mencionados su negocio comenzó vendiendo perfumees en san Juan de Limay y su negocio creció ya que su esposo le propuso que se dedicaran a vender ropa en otros sectores además de perfumees. Rosa es una vendedora ambulante no tiene establecido su negocio en un lugar estático pero le va muy bien ella sale a vender tres beses a la semana ella antes se dedicaba a la agricultura con su esposo.
 
Rosa espera que con el crédito le baya muy bien ya que las ventas suben para esta fecha y cree que tendrá mayores ingresos, ella es casada y tiene una hija de 4 años trabaja junto con su esposo, sus padres no viven con ella y tiene su casa propia donde vive con su familia. Este es el sexto crédito que tiene con Ceprodel y el primero que se le da para comercio ya que los otros eran para  agricultura donde nos dijo que se encuentra agradecida con Ceprodel por los servicios que se le han dado ya que le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones de vida mejorando su negocio y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa Idalia C. Z. sells goods such as pants, blouses, underwear, perfumes, paintings and corduroy in various areas of the Estelí department, mainly in its municipalities like Condega and San Juan de Limay and Pueblo Nuevo. Rosa Idalia will use the loan to purchase and sell goods in the above mentioned areas. Her business started by selling perfumes in San Juan de Limay. Her business has grown since her husband suggested to her that they sell clothes in other areas and well as perfumes. Rosa is a street vendor, she has not established her business in a fixed place but it has worked very well. She goes out selling three times per week. Previously she farmed with her husband. Rosa hopes that the loan will work well since sales have been rising to date and she believes that she will earn a greater income. She is married and has a 4 year old daughter, and she works together with her husband. Her parents don't live with her and she has her own house where she lives with her family. This is her sixth loan with Ceprodel and the first she has been given for trade since the others were for farming where she told us that she was grateful to Ceprodel for the services that they have given her since they have helped her to improve her living conditions, her business and her income.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE GOODS FOR SALE

loans.name: Yajauri

texts.es: Yajauri, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 28 años, madre de tres hijos, todos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, chupetes, hielo, gelatina y gaseosas, actividades que lo realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica al oficio de ser chofer de un motocarro propio. Yajauri forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manos Maravillosas”, desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de gaseosas, ahora ella necesita 500 soles , que será invertido en la implementación de su venta de comida como cocina de carbón, platos, cubiertos y vasos. La meta de Yajauri es tener su propio negocio de abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Yajauri, 28, is a very dynamic woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She has three minor children. She sells prepared meals, chupetes (popsicles), ice, gelatin desserts and soft-drinks from her home. Her husband, who is a mototaxi driver, supports her work efforts. Yajauri has been a member of the "Manos Maravillosas" communal bank for a year. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy soft-drinks. Now, she needs 500 soles that will be used to equip her prepared meals sales business like: coal stove, dishes, cutlery, drinking glasses. Yajauri's goal is to have her own general store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip her meal preparation business.

loans.name: Las Semillitas(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Semillitas está conformado por un grupo de mujeres que ven cada día  la mejor manera de salir adelante para  darles un poco mas de comodidad a su familia y tener una vida más digna, viven por la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta es una ciudad hermosa por su arquitectura, sus cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad, es cuna de grandes escritores  y artesanos.

La señora  Sandra V. es socia del banco comunal Las Semillitas, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 33 años de edad y se encuentra casada, su esposo trabaja como profesor de música en una guardería, en una escuela y dicta clases particulares, con quien  procrearon  3 hijos que se encuentran de 7, 6, 4 años de edad, sus dos hijos estudian en el Liceo Decroliano, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendado.

Sandra tiene como profesión diseñadora pero un día se le viro su ojo y perdió un poco de movilidad en su cuerpo se hizo unos análisis y le detectaron un tumor en su cerebro y no se hace operar por lo que es muy riesgoso pero se realiza resonancia magnética, ahora trabaja en una empresa de libros como promotora de eventos en las escuelas pero solo son ciertos  días y sin tener un horario fijo, y ya desea trabajar independientemente ya que antes contaba con un local de venta de calzado pero por cuidar a sus hijos tuvo que venderlo y ahora desea tener un puesto de venta de calzado en su casa.

 Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación y nos cuenta que ingreso gracias a su hermana, con el préstamo que la fundación ole entregue lo va a invertir comprando calzado deportivo y escolar para empezar con su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es de comenzar a generar ingresos para su hogar.

Nelly V. es  otra socia del banco comunal Las Semillitas, se lleva bien con todas sus compañeras de la banca comunal, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y nos comenta que los prestamos le han beneficiado en su negocio y fue su suegra quien le incentivo a formar parte del banco comunal, ella  es comerciante de calzado lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y le va bien, ha llegado a tener un puesto en la feria libre (mercado de Cuenca), en el cual vende solo los días miércoles y el resto del tiempo se dedica a su familia.

Nelly vive en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 27 años de edad se encuentra casada y ha procreado 3 hijos aun pequeños,  su esposo es comerciante y distribuye CD en todo la ciudad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Con el préstamo solicitado a la fundación va a comprar calzado casual, deportivo, y de fiesta  para damas, caballeros y niños y de esta manera surtir su negocio.

Su meta es  dar a sus hijos el mejor estudio y que se superen en la vida.
texts.en:
The Las Semillitas communal bank is made up of a group of women who daily look for ways to get ahead in life and provide a bit more comfort for their families so that they can live a more dignified life. They all live in greater Cuenca, a city that is beautiful thanks to its architecture, the four rivers that bathe the city, and as the birthplace of great writers and artisans. Sandra V., a member of the Las Semillitas communal bank, is 33 years old and lives in greater Cuenca. She is married and her husband is a music teacher at a child care center, at a school, and he gives private music lessons, too. They have three children who are 7, 6, and 4 years old. Their two sons are students in the Liceo Decroliano. She does not have her own house; she is a renter. By profession, Sandra is a designer. However, one day her eye turned inward and she lost a bit of mobility in her body. She had some tests done and a brain tumor was detected. She did not have surgery so is at risk but did have a magnetic resonance (MRI) done. Now, she works for a book publisher as a spokesperson at school events but this work is sporadic and only on some days. She wants to work independently since she used to have a shoe shop but, because she had to care for her children, she had to sell it. She would now like to sell footwear from her house. This is her second loan cycle with the Fundación and she has told us that it was thanks to her sister that she joined. The funds she gets from the fundación will be used to buy sports and school shoes with which to start her business. Her greatest wish is to start to produce income for her family. Nelly V. is another member of the Las Semillitas communal bank. She gets along well with all her fellow members and is in her second loan cycle. She tells us that the loans have benefitted her business and it was her mother-in-law who motivated her to join the communal bank. She has been a shoe retailer for 4 years and is doing well. He has come to have a stand in Cuenca’s free market where she sells on Wednesdays. The rest of the week she dedicates to her family. Nelly, 27, lives in greater Cuenca, is married, and has three small children. Her husband is a merchant that distributes CDs throughout the city. They do not own their home; they rent. The requested funds will be used to buy casual and sports footwear as well as dress shoes for women, men and children to stock her business. Her goal is to give her children the best education possible so that they will get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear.

loans.name: Mahbobullah

texts.en:
Mahbobullah is the son of Y.. He is 24 years old and lives in the 9th district of Kabul, Aghanistan. He is a married man with two children who are in school. He has a mobile-card selling shop. He requested an individual loan of 14,000 Afghani.
 
He would like to make his shop larger and make some changes in it. He wants to buy more mobile cards for his business. He is very pleased with this small loan in Afghanistan and would like to extend gratitude to AFS and to the Kiva process in this poor country.

loans.use: To expand his business
